I'm just sayin'.  If you need a quality editor for your materials, I'm available at a reasonable price.)

gorgeous hotel with swanky rooms, good nightlife options, top notch restaurants, and THE BEST POOL ON THE STRIP! also a great buffet.

the wynn also has a distinctive smell as soon as you enter the hotel. if you want to bask in the life of the opulent, stay here. 

love this place. will be returning.

haven't been to Vegas in years and our first time staying at Wynn

and sad to say, this is really an overrated hotel

the exterior design as well as the lobby floor are very nice; clean, fresh, modern, eclectic, it is a nice atmosphere and setting
the room itself is nice too, comfy sheets and bed, nice layout and design

BUT that's about it...
first, our view.. it was such a terrible  view, even the fact we only returned to the room to change and sleep, it wasnt nice looking out to see the top of the connecting building..
second, the $30 charge for calls and internet? really? we didn't need or use any of it yet this "hotel fee" is mandatory..what a way to steal money
third, no breakfast\/brunch upgrade...when we initially wanted to make the booking, we were offered a two night stay with two breakfast coupons; we asked for friday and saturday night, then when we asked to purchase another breakfast coupon (we were a party of three) we were told they don't do breakfast, only brunch for the weekends and we would need to pay the difference for all the passes...seriously? you won't even offer us free brunch?

and lastly, upon check in we told them not to text us when the room was ready..and what did they do? they texted us. better yet, 5 minutes after we left!!!
we wandered vegas for 4 hours in the heat before returning to them saying they contacted us.. BS! they even put a note in the booking NOT to text us!


not to return here, bad experience

I stayed were with my boyfriend for his birthday trip. We had a spacious room with great views. The bathroom was probably my favorite party of the room! It had 2 sinks, a vanity area, bathtub and separate shower, the toilet was in a separate little rom inside the bathroom. Very easy to share the bathroom and not have to wait around for the other person to get out. The bed was so comfy! We could've laid there in bed all day just watching tv and chilling. The room was clean and the hotel itself was amazing. I loved the location of the Wynn, close to everything that I loved. Close to shopping, food, clubs, and other great hotels. I would love to stay here again!

There was a 15 minute wait to check in. The front desk attendant was great. Once we checked in, we were told that our room was not ready (we checked in at 1pm so that was expected). We were sent a text message when our room was ready. We then had to wait in another line to get our keys. There should be a better way to do this so that you do not have to wait in two lines. This was the only complaint of our visit.

The room was on the 8th floor. The view was not great, but I am not complaining. Got the room on priceline and it was great. The bed was super comfortable. The decor was fine. The room was very clean. The bathroom was spacious. Overall, great room. I am sure if I were to pay full price, I would get a higher floor:) 

The staff I encountered were great. Everyone from the bell desk to security to dealers were awesome and customer oriented. They do a great job.

The grounds of the hotel are amazing. It is really great. 

The location is at the northern end of the strip so it does not feel as crowded when you walk on the sidewalks. 

Of course, there is a 'resort fee'  which provides you with 'free' wifi.  The wifi is fast however.

Overall, great weekend stay!

I was comped here for a weekend and made full usage bringing the boys with me.  Saw some fights, lost some money but all in all a great time as always on the strip.  

There's nothing I can add to these reviews really, high end facilities and located north center of the strip.  

It's one off my bucket list to stay and play a round here as well.  We had a suite over looking wynn's 18 holes and I dreamt of the day where I could afford to play a round and stay at the wynn on a single trip.  Now that would make me feel all grown up.  Great hotel.

ALL time FAAVORRITEE hotel. Been to vegas many many times with my family. We have stayed in over 80% of the hotels on this strip. Wynn has got to be the best. Rooms were clean, high-maintenance, class, and a luxury ambiance. Food was remarkably tasteful and delightful. You'll never leave this place unhappy. Staff are the most friendliest and cheerful people. Prices don't matter when you stay in Las Vegas. You'll always expect to pay a lot, but in due time, be worth it.

this is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed at hands down. best in room dining, best housekeeping. the bed is so comfortable! the bathtub is dreamy! omg i could live here. the casino is so clean and doesnt stink like other casinos on the strip. Every restaurant here is delicious and has healthy and vegan options. this is the best place to stay on the strip, it is worth the extra money.

My Boyfriend an I were able to score a beautiful panoramic room on the 30th floor. oncw we walked in I lost my breathe the curtains were pulled back and we had a beautiful  view of the Neveda skyline.

Very Chic and Sexy..... find it at the Wynn !
I chose to stay at the Wynn because the photos online and the amenities included with your stay (Vip in to sum of the Hottest Clubs on the property). I am an extremely picky traveler who expects alot depending upon my purpose of travel. From the very beginning the hotel did not miss a beat. The customer service was absolutely outstanding.  We arrive at the hotel and headed straight to check in. 

 Extremely contemporary and very sexy. This was the first time Ive seen a shower with see through walls so others in the room could see you take your shower. There is an ipod hookup in the main room on  which you canplay ur ipod and even charge it (I used it to charge my Iphone). And the music can be heard throughout the room, very sexy. This is not mention in advertisment.  Overall the room was spotless (that means no dust and no scuff marks on the floor or walls and of course general cleanliness beds and baths)!!! The fridge come fully stocked with  beverages .Not once did We have a problem. The housekeeping crew would call us by our lst night when we called down for room service or just simply needed more towels.

I could go on.... But I can not do my experience justice....

If your going to do vegas and do it big I recommend this Hotel Steven Wynn knows what he is doing and it shows.

Stayed here for 4 nights the other week and it was a mediocre experience. Despite being a 5 diamond property, the queue to check in was a good 20-25 minutes...

With the $20 trick, managed to be upgraded to a Strip facing room along with an early check in at 11 am. 

#2063 might have been haunted as the light next to the TV came on at 3 am... The walls are paper thin as I heard my neighbors have a good time at 4 am along with all the folks taking showers next door and upstairs...

Towels were mediocre, in line with a 3 diamond property. The bedsheets and duvets were very comfortable although the mattress had two indentations from people sleeping on each side...

WiFi was spotty despite a $39\/night resort fee. Parking is also a surcharge.

The hotel was just okay, The rooms a really small for the price. I'm pretty sure you can find a better price room in the near by hotels. The hotel in general is really crowded and its really difficult to get around. The casino and lobby are full of smoke and again really crowded.

I will review this for what it is and not from my own personal point of view. The hotel is beautiful! The room was beautiful! The shower and bath were great! The service was attentive! The poker room had the best drink service of all that I played in. The pool was great. If you want elegant, and posh this is the place to be.

The reason I don't give it five stars. The air condition in the room didn't seem to work well. I called the front desk twice and they sent people up to fix it. It seemed to help temporarily but at time the temperature made the room uncomfortable. The prices for food (in the cafe and drugstore) and well as drinks are expensive even for Vegas. Finally, Wynn seems to have two very popular night clubs. I'm not into the club scene and it tends to attract a certain type of crowd that I'm not very fond of.

If these are the things you want then it is a great hotel. I wouldn't choose to stay here again. I would prefer to be closer to center strip and I also like a little more kitsch in my Vegas hotels. That's just me.

I do recommend hitting the buffet here.

My husband really likes the Wynn over all of the other "nice" hotels on the Strip.  It was my first time and although I agree I probably like this one a lot, our last night there was extremely loud.  A new guest must have checked in that day and must have decided he\/she did not like the layout of the room.  I don't know if it was furniture, luggage or both being shuffled around for hours!  It was so loud I thought for a moment it was coming from the room next door.  Whatever they were doing it went on for hours and stopped then began again in the morning after they woke up.  We checked out that morning but man, if this happened on the first night we would have complained.

As far as casinos and hotels go. The Wynn properties are as good as it gets. Everything about this place is 5 stars. The restaurants, the rooms, EVERYTHING. Is it expensive? Yes, but in Vegas you get what you pay for. 

We arrived and were lucky enough to not have to wait in line to check in. We had a private check in then went up to our room. No detail was overlooked in the rooms. The bed was plush and comfortable. The floor to ceiling windows gave us a beautiful view of the strip. 

I love this hotel. If you have the opportunity to stay here, do so you won't regret it. 

The staff is awesome and always willing to help you with whatever you need. Take advantage of the concierge as well, it saved us time standing in line for tickets to shows.

We enjoyed man of the restaurants that are in the Wynn and Encore. We will be back for sure, we'll try getting a room in the Encore next time.

The Wynn more than delivers on the customer service front, the staff is always attentive and courteous. Shopping and restaurants are definitely geared toward high end clientele which, I view as a good thing if your looking to escape Vegas' more raucous side. I stayed in one of the regular rooms facing the front of the hotel which proved to be quite noisy but I've found that is the case at most hotels on the strip. The room is spacious with a very clean modern feel to it. I would definitely stay here again, even though its not my favorite ::cough:: Aria::cough::this hotel easily makes my top 5 here.

Steve Wynn's first branded hotel of himself is not to disappoint.  
Upscale, custom slot machines, nice decor, and good food. 

I find the rooms seem a bit aged, and at this point I'll only stay at Encore, which is his newer hotel. I prefer the food at encore, and the gaming area is much nicer. 

Of the 2, Wynn is more smoky, and gaming area is packed a but tighter; but still much better than almost every other casino in LV. 

Overall, choose Encore, but it's still a great place to stay.

rooms are spacious, the decor is random but nice, and the dealers are down to chat

buy in for most stuff is 10-25 bucks which, sadly, is too rich for my blood... anyways my friend won 40 bucks in a slot machine by doing nothing, it was awesome.

boo the Ferrari dealership for charging for admission. How can you charge people to look at cars they might by, if other stores charged your to browse you wouldn't go, amirite?

The real reason i'm givng the Wynn 4 stars though is the pool is mad baller status. It's like a giant L with chairs around it. Service is a big slow but hey, if ur by the pool no worry just relax eh?

LOVE this hotel.  It's so new, grand, and just fabulous.  The only thing I don't like is that it's pretty far at the end of the strip.  Walking to the middle is kind of a long trek.  The pool is awesome too, great music, and the service is excellent.  

I have nothing bad to say about this hotel.

I was here for a convention last week and it is an amazing hotel. You see how beautiful it is from the moment you walk in. Both the exterior and interior are very classy. The staff are very friendly and courteous. I didn't gamble much because I was at the convention but I walked through the casino to get to the convention center, rooms, and restaurants and it is very nice. The room we stayed in was on the 29th floor and had a breathtaking view of the strip and all the way west of Las Vegas to Summerlin and the Red Rock mountains. Everything in the room was unbelievable, the bed, the shower, etc. I had forgotten my razor blade and housekeeping brought it up right away. And the bellmen are timely and courteous. We couldn't fall asleep one night because our neighbors were noisy past midnight (on a Thursday night, but it is Vegas after all). They were kind enough to change our room for the rest of the stay. I'm not sure what the regular price was but I paid $ 150 - $ 200 per night. This was the convention rate and I am sure the regular rate is much higher, especially on holidays such as New Year. Definitely worth a visit.

Wynn is wynn - simply the best. But they will try to over-charge. On a regular day they were charging holiday rates - which no other buffet was doing in Vegas - just skip them on the long weekends and the day after any big day - they will find any excuse to become the most expensive buffet for that day on the strip.

Poker room review.
Great place to play.
Great dealers, great food and the best drinks in town!
I would not bother playing anywhere else!

This place is so overrated. The service is awful -- they were so rude to my girlfriend that she was crying by the time my flight landed. The decor, food, etc. are nothing special either. Our room was large. That's the only good thing I can saw about the place. I'd never stay here again.

I booked my reservation for four nights in June 2014 at the Wynn back in December 2013 on www.booking.com. At the time of reservation, there was an option for a "Deluxe Resort King" (comes with one king bed) as well as an option for "Resort Double Deluxe" (comes with two full beds), among many other choices. The "Resort Double Deluxe" was roughly $200 more per night than the "Deluxe Resort King" but my friend and I thought we would spoil ourselves a little and each have our own bed. We booked the "Resort Double Deluxe". I booked six and a half months ahead of time. 

My girlfriend lined up for 15 minutes at 11:00pm to check in. The lady at the front desk informed us that the "Resort Double Deluxe" that we booked was no longer available and that they can provide us with a "Deluxe Resort King" and bring us a single rollaway bed. To compromise, I asked if there would be a two double bed room available at any point in our stay so we could move there once one becomes available. The lady said no. She said when we booked, it was only a preference that we wanted two full beds and that it was not a guarantee. I informed her that we specifically booked the "Resort Double Deluxe" room and we paid over $800 EXTRA for it as well. She then proceeded to say that because we booked through www.booking.com, she does not know how they list their bookings but regardless, she couldn't help us as no "Resort Double Deluxe" rooms were available. Should Wynn not be responsible for the websites that give rights to book for their hotel?

I asked to speak to the manager. She said she will talk to the manager herself and see what she could do for us. It took her 10 minutes to come back. At this time, it was already close to 11:30pm and our excitement to go out for the night has plateaued. We were bummed. When she came back, she informed me that the manager will waive the mandatory resort fee. This was a total of a $121USD credit for our four nights. We paid over $800 EXTRA to reserve the "Resort Double Deluxe" to get two full sized beds when I made the booking 6 and a half months ago. I was very unhappy with this service. I had paid a good premium to stay at the Wynn and was very excited. I asked if I could speak to the manager directly. She called him and Steven came up to the Registration Desk. 

He said there was nothing more he could do for me. When I said that I will agree upon the $120 credit but our moods were flattened. I suggested if he could throw in a cheap bottle of champagne or a small credit for food, my girlfriend and I could put this all behind us and consider staying at the Wynn again. He refused and insisted that he was already doing us a huge favor by waiving the resort fee for us. I again explained to him that I had indeed booked a guaranteed "Resort Double Deluxe" with two full sized bed( this was not a drop-down menu preference as he kept insisting it was) and not the King that they are giving me. 

My husband and I, both separately and together, visit Vegas 8 or 9 times per year in total and Wynn\/Encore was the last on my bucket list. We are both heavily disappointed with their service and would not classify this as a 4 star resort. Save your money and enjoy the Venetian or Caesars Palace for their first class pool, beautiful architect, prime location, Forum shops, and triple excellent service.

What can I say? This place was a major contributor of misfortune and bad times during my recent Vegas visit. Their slots are tight as hell, blackjack and craps had $50 minimums, their damn buffet closes at 10PM--on the Strip, the Bellagio buffet closes at 2AM--and because the entire hotel\/casino bleeds money, a mojito is $12 in the Terrace Pointe Cafe. I haven't stayed in the hotel, heard it's nice, but you can find other places to gamble. Plus, the folks at the Players Club (or Red Club, whatever) lied to me several times about the buffets. I earned a free spin on an electronic wheel by joining the club and won a buffet, only to have it expire shortly thereafter without my knowledge.

We got to spend a very enjoyable night at the Wynn watching Le Reve.   The theatre was very comfortable.   We had seats in the A row which is right next to the pool.    Very up and close!!    Expect to get splashed, feel the heat of flames and have actors right in front of you!!  Excellent show, reasonable tickets, great night!!!  A definite option when your in Vegas!!!!
The hotel is in a great location and really liked my accommodations. Probably one of the best hotels I've ever slept on! View was amazing.

My girlfriend and I stayed at the Wynn this past weekend and I have to say it was incredible. Check in was fast and easy and we were greeted with a beautiful casino floor and lower level. Room was on the 28th floor with a strip view, way nice. I've read some reviews saying if you were on a lower floor you could hear the nightclub. On the 28th you could hear it faintly but it was no big deal. 

Ate at Mizumi which I would highly recommend as well as their buffet for Sunday brunch. Overall we completely loved out experience at the Wynn, everything was luxurious and all the staff we're friendly and personable. Will definitely be returning soon.

I am a Vegas regular and the Wynn\/Encore has always been one of my favourite hotels.  I rave to friends\/family about this place as to me it has always represented classy luxury-the kind of Vegas experience I am after!  I travel to get away for a nice break from it all, and usually the Wynn delivers.

My most recent trip was with my family (parents) as they needed a little getaway, too, and I thought why not take them to my favourite hotel?  (in recent years I've grown to love the MGM Signature Suites, which IMO is now better than the Wynn--much more private and better service & rooms).

It seems like many of my favourite things in life--there is no such thing as "forever".  It all began with check-in on a quiet Sunday night (we stayed here 5 nights, in two rooms I booked for us).  Usually when I arrive from a long flight i am tired, and simply want to get my keys and go up to my room to freshen up.  It is a huge turnoff when you show up with your luggage and family in tow, and you have to stand through a sales spiel to see if you want to upgrade to an even higher priced room than the one you've already booked.  NOTE TO THE WYNN: If I wanted a parlour suite I would have booked one, and unless you are giving it to me at a steal I cannot refuse (aka FREE) I am NOT interested.

After 20 minutes we finally got keys to our rooms, and they were not as nice as I remembered them.  The hallways still look clean and modern, but the interior of the rooms were starting to show their age.  Still clean, but the decor that I remembered as modern and easy on the eyes was not dated and still frozen from the era when Wynn was in its heyday.

Those days are gone.  NOTE TO INTERNET USERS:  You only get TWO devices with your $25 plus tax resort fee, and we did have an incident when the system was down.  Also we were misinformed at our lovely check-in that you opt out of the resort fee for $15\/device instead (ie. if you didn't intend to use the internet\/services you did not have to pay the resort fee).  We did end up having things clarified at checkout, but it would have been less stressful to not have these issues in the first place.

The sheets were as nice as I remember them, but my bed lacked the firmness that it used to have.  Instead it sunk badly and I had a bad back by the end of the week.  Thank goodness I already had massages booked when I got home--otherwise I would be spending a fortune at the spa to help my poor back!

Our room was cleaned nicely (we try not to make much of a mess anyway), and it was only one day when I had to call for them to clean our room).  We made use of our $200\/room food credit as well, and it was a nice gesture that helped us choose the Wynn.

Security was good and you always had to show your room card in the day and evening to get to the elevators.  I felt safe and the clientele here are a classy bunch.

Would I return?  With so many options here the Wynn might still have a chance, but they are slipping.  I hope they don't continue slipping, or I will have to say goodbye to one of my favourite getaways.

We liked the Wynn. It's a nice place. The Casino is nice as well as the rest of the hotel. The beds are extremely comfortable. However, the sheers on our windows in the room were filthy. The shower pressure leaves a lot to be desired. One of the sinks were stopped up. There is no in room coffee. What hotel today doesn't have a coffee maker in the rooms for guests? Wynn forces you to either get your coffee from room service for $9.00 plus the associated fees or go all the way down to the Casino and buy a cup fro the Deli. VERY inconvenient. Not to mention there is a $29.00 plus tax resort fee per day added to your bill. A decent place but I won't stay again.

5 stars for the fabulous rooms!!!!  Much nicer rooms than the Four Seasons but not as good staffing as the F.S. 
I love that it is right across the street from the Fashion Show Mall!!!!

If you don't like the Wynn you have serious problems. Between boosting one of the best clubs in Vegas and world class restaurants this place just screams 'money'.  From the flowers, to art work, to intricate tile work, great pools, high-end shopping, comfy beds with amazing sheets, and of course gambling this place has it all.  

AND if you are a Veggie every restaurant is required to have a Vegan menu, you just gotta ask for it.

It really is as nice as it gets. I think that the rooms could be a little better, just maybe my preference, but I really did not like the tv that you have to turn between the living area and the bed area. Overall, very happy with my stay and will come again for sure.

I went to this hotel 2 times during my trip to Las Vegas. I didn't stay at this hotel. I visited the hotel to look around and see what it has to offer. It had a very nice garden with a carousel. It's so lit at night. Perfect for picture taking. It had a large casino and a race and sports bar perfect for sports fans. I Might experience this hotel to explore more features. It also had a waterfall and a waterfall show with classic music which is lovely!

Came here in summer 2011. The Salon Suite at the Wynn is one of the largest suites I've ever spent the weekend in, and is one of my favorites. The view from the room is breathtaking. I came here with a large group, and even with many of us, the suite was large enough to hold us all comfortably. TV is large and you can pretty much see it from many parts of the living room. Bathroom is nice and can fit several people inside.   The fridge in there is enough to store your booze. Bed is comfy and warm as I was able to lay with 3 others simultaneously. I didn't win at the casino that weekend, but the memories with my friends from that room will be my favorite part. Thanks for a great weekend, Wynn!

Ahhh the fabulous Wynn Las Vegas, puts all the MEDIOCRE hotels to shame, specially all MGM and Harrah's properties.

If your all about the glamourous life of Las Vegas then the Wynn is the place to be.

The moment you step into the Wynn, you will fall into another world of luxury and the finner things in life. 

The service and ambiance of this hotel is defintely a 5 star rating. As well as the rooms and restaurants in the hotel.

The Wynn has always been a faovrite place of mine, i usually joke and call it my backyard since I am here most of the time relaxing and enjoying the fabulous lounges and restuarants.

A favorite spot of mine i highly reccomend is the Parasols down bar, located downstairs with a spectacular view of a water fountain which features a mini show every 15-30 min.

If your hungry and care for a snack indulge at the drug store cafe at the Wynn located near the Le Reve theater, cheap and portions are huge.

If your all about class and  the finner things in life, get blown by the Wynn.. :)
Horrible customer service.  I had a bunch of baloney mini-bar charges to my room.  When I called to inquire about them, I got the run-a-round.

Wynn nice casino. Play blackjack and crabs, very fun! Restaurant pricey but room service awesome. Nice rooms, very clean and neat. Went to a club call XS and got a lot of boys phones. I can't wait to go back and try other restaurants.
Most satisfied hotel in las vegas. Wanna come back next time with my family:) easy valet. Delicious buffet. Most friendly people, and they are awesome to help me anything.
Hotel is ok..our spa experience was awful booked three days prior for 9am and my therapist was a no show..I will definitely NOT be coming back.

I know this is supposed to be a review about the hotel, but GO TO THE CAFE AND GET THE ASIAN CHICKEN SALAD. You won't regret it.

#WYNNING.

I used to be a "Vegas on the Cheap" kind of guy. I decided to splurge on the Wynn. I went with my wife, who is a "do it big" person. I was totally overwhelmed by the quality, service, substance, and luxury. I am embarrassed  to say I have stayed at other hotels in Vegas. Do yourself a favor and stay 2 nights. You will thank yourself for the upgrade. The only Drawback is that there isn't a Wynn in the city I live in. Oh table minimum bets are a little high.

This hotel was amazing!!!! My girls and I went to celebrate my friends big 27 this past weekend...haha!!! I would have to say that this was the best experience i had in a while with a hotel. At least to me the staff was nice and respectful. I've stayed at the Bellagio and Aria they were both mediocre compared to this hotel. But of course you will have people every where and I do mean everywhere that may need a little more training in customer service and technical skills but, what can you do about that? Nothing but keep it moving next to your new adventure that Vegas has to offer. Time wasted complaining about this and that when you can easily go somewhere else and enjoy right? Anyway, The room was off the chain , It was one of the Wynn tower suites. It was so elegant along with the HD TVs that they have in each room. Super clean, even the bathroom mad me jealous think i need to rethink the design for my bathroom now....lol. I will revisit this hotel in the future, just might be my new place to stay when in Vegas!!! Check it out.

Stayed at Wynn for my Wife's bday thinking we were going to have the best experience in Las Vegas, especially for the price you pay for the rooms. Well..we were wrong. Their customer service and management sucks. I was not feeling good inside the casino and my wife was having a hard time getting me a glass or bottle of water. Than we spoke to them about the whole incident , it's like they didn't even care. 
Yes it is a very nice looking Casino but I would NOT recommend it.

STUNNING!!!!! SUPERB!!!! AMAZING!!!
We have stayed at Cesar's, Bellagio, Mandalay Bay but the Wynn is simply fantastic!!!
The rooms, the service, the restaurants, the spa all clean, first class and the best we have been to in Vegas all round!

this hotel is beautiful I've got to admit. I was super stoked to stay here for my first time back in June when I visited las vegas. we checked in to our reservation to find that they overbooked and didn't have our room. Although I was extremely disappointed, they gave us a comp for 2 free nights for our next visit and told us they got us a room over at Treasure Island. my friends and I spent a total of 4hrs complaining to the managers of the Wynn and TI about this situation, how extremely unprofessional and disappointing it was. Wynn kindly informed us we could come back and check in sunday for the free nights (since we weren't leaving until monday). I guess they handled the situation well and we ended up having free rooms but the hassle and complications of it all really annoyed us.

The hotel stay was great! Had a very high floor and nice room with a nice view of the Las Vegas strip. 

Did not like the resort fee they charged and the cell phone reception was horrible.

The service was excellent but overall the stay was awesome!

Wynn is a sure Win!  The ambience of this hotel was definitely elegant.  Right when we walked in there was a Koi Pond with tons of Koi fish.  Decor from ceiling to floor was definitely on point.  Oh and the flower carousel.. totally flabbergasted!  Did you know there is 50,00 flowers on this thing, and every other week they replace 5,000 of these flowers... totes amazeballs!

We stayed at the Salon Suite with an additional joining room.  The suite was definitely spacious and electic.  It had a very large living room, wet bar, private master bedroom and a bathroom that could be a room, it was so huge.

Staying at the suite has its perks: personal concierge, private entrance, access to tower suite pool and you'll also enjoy daily complimentary breakfast for two at Tableau, morning coffee and tea service, and no resort fees!

Shops, you are literally steps away from the shops!  A lot of high end stores at the Wynn and Encore but if you are looking for a tad bit  inexpensive dont you worry across the street is the mall with a huge food court!  

Even though I was on vacation I still needed to do a bit of work out, their gym is also on the upscale side.  With updated equipment, bikes, wieghts, machines, oh and did I mention that you could also get a personal trainer!? Hmm yeah might be a tad bit much if you are on vacation haha!

Sunny side up? I mean literally the SUN =)  Unfortunately, I didn't get to go swimming at their humungous european pools.  Their pools wrapped around the whole swimming area with cabanas, bar and spas.  I can't wait to go here during summer!

I will definitely book again with Wynn!

Don't forget to sign up for their Wynn Insider, savings of 15%

Food - check out my other reviews for the food we tried while we were at LV!

Good day!

The Wynn is the way to go in Las Vegas. Beautifully decorated, tasteful, elegant but still Vegas Fancy.  Friendly helpful staff, quick check in, top notch restaurants.  Everything you could need in one place.  
The Wynn feels a bit more classy and less crowded than the other big contenders on the strip.  I like that it is a bit away from the madness of the central strip, you can relax easier and there is less riff raff & scumminess.

This is gonna be my 100th yelp review and I decided to celebrate this special milestone by reviewing the Wynn hotel, the most beautiful hotel and casino in Vegas and maybe even the world.  

The first thing you notice when u walk in is the nice aroma of the hotel, it's smell of fresh and breezy well ventilated air. Then u will notice the whimsical and colorful decor and design with color schemes of mainly taupe reds golds and neutrals.  

The rooms are intimate and plush, the bed is so so comfortable, I usually have trouble sleeping on hotel beds but the I didn't have any trouble sleeping at the Wynn.  

The Wynn is a top notch hotel so don't expect the casino to have low table limits. Blackjack tables minimum was set at $50 minimum during my stay, with most other tables at $200 limit.  But sitting down and gaming at their casino is so comfortable and welcoming, u feel like u don't wanna leave.

This place is great and they are loyal to the ones loyal to them. 
Love the watch stores, the hotel rooms are great and clean. 
Views are great and regardless of how many stars it is, it's all about the value you get once you become loyal to it.
Gaming is fun, in room breakfast dining rocks! Especially the Japanese breakfast.

surprised that it wasn't nicer. expecting it to be on a par w\/ the bellagio but it wasn't. no coffee makers in the room (what a real pain) and a very plastic feeling casino. the people that work there seemed to be unfriendly or unhappy, either way they were not that nice or accommodating

After staying at the Wynn in Las Vegas last week, it'll be tough to want to stay elsewhere during my next visit to Sin City.  The hotel is elegance at its finest.  It evokes a warm feel though due to the colorful tiled floors and flowers everywhere.  I especially loved the fresh floral arrangements at registration and in the lobby of the resort elevators (changed daily) and was an enormous array of the brightest, freshest, flowers.  Walking the esplanade at the Wynn only offered me dreams of being able to walk in Chanel, Louis Vuitton, and their fine shoe store 'Shoe In' and not being alarmed at the sight of a $700 pair of heals.  It was however fun to dream.  We never had the chance to have dinner at the hotel but we had brunch at the Terrace Point Cafe which was delicious and I was also satisfied with my ahi tuna salad by the pool.  Our room was incredible.  We stayed in the resort room which offered an incredible view of the strip with floor to ceiling windows.  I loved the flat screen television in the bathroom (which by the way was bigger than most apartments in NYC).  The service was good and I loved all the extra little touches (foot mats placed on either side of the bed during turn down service and the carpet floral patterns on the luggage carts!)  Highly recommend but prepare to pay!
My favorite place to stay in Vegas. Their beds are super comfy, bathrooms are spacious, and I love all the flowers that hang off the trees by the entrance.

Whenever we go to Las Vegas, we stay at the Wynn or its sister, Encore hotel. I'm totally taken to a new destination when I enter these doors. Truly, It's like Hannah in Wonderland, but everything is a beautiful experience. The best show, The Dream, is a must see for all. It's AMAZING. It amazes your entire being. Just sit back and tune everything out... and for a few hours, you're just totally engaged and tickled deeply.

The interiors EVERYWHERE, are so exquisitely beautiful. No matter what you wear and who you are doesn't matter. The staff here are very kind and respectful. I love even looking at the casinos, the beautiful walls, and the LIGHT FIXTURES of all shapes and sizes and settings. ALL different, yet they're linked, in that they provide a nice mood that's easy on the eyes.

The butterfly is the trademark it seems. Oh and the lovely lit white peacock is so stunning. Every dining restaurant is unique and decorated to fit a certain mood. It's truly a very well thought out structure. The pool is so spacious, and they give you towels too. There's someone there to help you, and provide whatever you need. 

They even have cars for sale too! It's truly a nifty place to walk into. You can just take a nice walk within this large site, and be taken away into your own private imagination. The colors are so mixed with perfection. My eyes will take its time to really look at the details. I don't want to be with anyone else to talk about what I see... it's just for me. I love that... I feel it on my own... unsullied. PURE TO MY BONE.

3 for service and 5 for the accommodations.  

First off,  everyone we encountered was very polite and professional, however, we found that our room was not ready on our arrival.  They said they would text me when the room was ready.  One hour later, and nothing.  We drove from So Cal. so we really wanted to crash in our room for a while.  I went to check in, who informed me that they had a room available.  An hour seems a bit of a wait considering the Wynn is a higher end hotel.

Our room was a Tower King.  It was large and well appointed.  Our bags came to our room promptly, and the bell man explained the features of our room.  The room was quiet, comfortable and very spacious, almost a palace.  The floor to ceiling windows offer an amazing view of Las Vegas.

The room included coffee service between 7 am and 8:30.  If you have ever stayed on the Strip, you know the rooms don't have coffee machines and getting coffee in the mornings can be a project.  The coffee was great, but it would be nice if the service could run a bit later......  the coffee window is a bit narrow.

The room also included a complimentary breakfast, which was ok, but you should really make reservations the night before or you'll be eating a late breakfast.  Also, the "potato" that came with breakfast was little more than a tot..... come on people?

The gym is located on the spa floor and is well equipped and maintained.  It opens at 5:30 am, however someone overslept one morning and it opened 30 minutes late, to the annoyance of several waiting guests.

The casino is nice enough, but they need to work on getting that cigarette smoke pumped out.  We hung out at the slot machines, and the drink service was friendly and prompt.  The Konami slots are my favorite.... love the lucky dragon and the free spins.

Knowing what I know, I would stay again, although I might try the Encore next  to see how they measure up.

I can't stay anywhere else. I am absolutely spoiled. I wish they were a chain so when I travel for business I could stay at Wynn's everywhere. Oh where or where do I begin?? Cleanest hotel on the strip. You wouldn't know that anyone was smoking inside. LOVE THAT! Rooms are giganto. The bathroom is almost the same size as the bedroom. There is a huge tub that you can fit lots of people or just you and your honey. There is a separate shower and also a tv  in there so you can soak in the tub and vedge out.  The bed is better then the  westin, the ritz and the four seasons all put together! Seriously no joke. It's super comfy. Almost makes you not want to leave and go gamble.  It's super posh and very nicely decorated with your own flat screen tv and automatic curtains. LOVE THAT!!

The casino is great and the breakfast buffet, pricey but worth it. The pool area looked pretty cool but I didn't spend any time there.

Needless to say I really can't stay anywhere else on the strip. I am spoiled and loving it!

One star or less.  We got several letters starting in late Winter offering rooms for regulars at $ 129.00\/ night Sun. to Thurs. one night free with a four night stay.  Plus $ 250.00 casino credit.  

Could not see going in the hot season.  An email arrives within the last week warning the offer ends Sept. 30.  Same $ 129.00 price with a a $ 200.00 credit.  

Called the number to make reservations to find in September you only get two nights at $ 129.00 Nd the rest are at $ 319.00!  Oh, BTW, the credit is only toward the room, not gambling credit.  What a bunch of turds!
Country club at Wynn not very good. Expect high prices in vegas, but this was just bland. Shrimp and grits bland an boring, porterhouse over cooked and not tasty.

I've stayed at Wynn about 40 times now and it's almost always a pleasure. The only challenge is that the A\/C does not work well in the summer. So, if you like your room cool, you may end up asking for a fan. We did and it made things more bearable.

Other than that, the rooms are great. You can usually upgrade so don't opt for the extra money for "panoramic view" unless you just have to have it. I get it for free 9 times out of 10. 

Suites are nice, especially the Salon and Executive suites. I'm not too fond of the middle level, the "parlor" suite because it's cut into two rooms that aren't that usable, so you get some wasted space.

Room service is high quality. Try the breakfast burrito and breakfast pizza. Restaurants are all very good too, especially pancakes at Terrace Pointe Cafe and dinner at Stratta where you can have excellent food and still people watch.

The Wynn is so beautiful!  We didn't get to stay here, but we did explore a bit while we walked to the buffett.  The buffett was awesome, and I wish I had gotten to eat more (I was a bit too intoxicated to really enjoy).  The decorations were beautiful, and I looooooooved the forest of lights!

This was our first time staying at the Wynn. Let me preface this by saying our group was about 11 people, all mature, responsible adults.  

Rooms:
The rooms were very pretty, spacious, and accommodating. No complaints here except that we were told that our two rooms would be adjoined and they weren't. They also tacked on an additional 100 dollar resort fee for each room when we checked out. Be careful and read the small print ahead of time because they aren't up front about the total cost.

Food: 
The buffet was great and included lots of choices. Food and service were great. Be ready to wait in line, but it will be worth it.

We had dinner at Jardin, one of the restaurants in the hotel. It was a beautiful restaurant, lots of flowers. We had high hopes for this place, but were highly disappointed when we literally waited an hour and a half for our food. One hour into the wait I had to ask the waiter for bread, I guess they had forgot. When we asked how much longer until our food arrived, they said a little longer because it was taking a while to cook the steak and chicken. When the food finally came out, the steak was incredibly rare, the blood turned one of the girl's mashed potatoes red--she had asked for medium. The two salmon entrees we ordered were not fully cooked--sushi status. When one person from the table asked to speak to the manager he did not really care to listen and just said "thank you for your feedback".

We also had brunch at Tableau. It was also a beautiful place, we were seated and served quickly. Service was great and everyone enjoyed their meals and pastries. 

Clubs:
A promoter had reserved us a table and two bottles for Saturday night. They still made us wait in line for 45 minutes. Multiple groups were let in before us. Once we got in, there were tons of open tables, so I don't quite understand what the hold up was. 

Check out: 
We had a sprinter bus reserved to take us back to LA. The bell hop asked our driver to move the bus into the driveway to load our luggage since it was raining. While our driver loaded the bus three men came and started yelling at him to move the bus. Our bus driver let him know that he had been asked to move to different spots by multiple people since he arrived, and asked them to get on the same page. More valet men appeared and started yelling at our bus driver to move. They were rude and it was unnecessary. We could hear them yelling at him from inside the bus. The valet worker proceeded to slam the bus door really hard and it splashed rain water on one of the girls. They continued to yell at our bus driver, and didn't even give him time to put on his seat belt. It was ridiculous and completely inappropriate. 

Overall, for the price we paid, the experience was not satisfactory. The room was nice, but the negative experiences we had here completely negated the positive.

Let me tell You about the amazing people at The Wynn Hotel in Las Vegas!
We have been staying there exclusively for over ten years. My mom has several special needs now& is always treated like a queen! The staff goes above and beyond to grant our requests & make our stay very enjoyable each and every time!
A special thank you to OK Wells, she is so amazing!! She has been our Slot Hostess since we met her over ten years ago! She remembers our needs& special occasions like we were her own family !!
  Please know that Alexandra Jessic is our
favorite person in VIP!! She always makes sure everything is perfect for our rooms, special occasions & is an absolute Angel!!
  We can highly recommend The Wynn Hotel for all your needs!! If you want to really enjoy Las Vegas, look no further !! You never have to leave the hotel!! They have great slots, tables, restaurants,shops, a spa& gym!!!
  We can't wait to go back!!!
   Thanks for all the fabulous vacations !!
   See you soon,
   Madona& Family

The Wynn is supposedly the ultimate Vegas hotel and casino. Unfortunately, being a high-end place, the table game limits were mostly set high, unless I felt like getting up at 3am to try my luck. I didn't. 

The hotel room had a gorgeous view of the golf course. (Grass that green in Vegas? How?) We were on the 27th floor and were checked in by a very helpful and friendly staff member. The lobby was packed, but we never once felt rushed to be checked in. Even their bag check, which held onto our luggage after we had checked out and still had some time before our flight, was super friendly and helpful. We never once felt like we *had* to tip, but were rewarded with many thanks when we did. It does lose a bit, though, due to the dearth of connectivity options. Internet access? $14 a DAY! Come on - luxury hotel. Include these kind of things, it really goes a long way towards not making your customers feel nickel and dimed. 

Their restaurants are decent - we only tried a handful, but if you're on a budget, you might want to eat somewhere else. Only one of them is rated less than $$$$ for price. More details on the eateries in separate reviews.

5 star 5 diamond resort for a reason. The Wynn is high class all the way. There is a subtle floral fragrance that you are immediately captivated by at the front enternace when you are greeted by the source of the sent. Botanical gardens are all thru out the property! 

Children are kept to a minimum and required to be under control, which is a huge perk of the property. You can enjoy your experience without screaming untamed children. 

All resteraunts, including fine dining, have vegan options and menus. A MAJOR plus to the property. I only go to fine dining establishments here because of their accommodations. A must visit!

My New Las Vegas Favorite: After numerous trip Las Vegas I had made a home of the Bellagio until I tried the Wynn. My new LV home. Having stayed there several times now since it's opening I can only say it has gone from Great to Unbelievable. While it is NOT the place to stay for everyone, it was never intended to be. It is ineed expensive, but, isn't luxury supposed to be? My rooms have always been clean & frankly the best size to price contrast on the Strip. The shower & oversized tubs are fantastic. If staying in a Fairway Villa, the soaking tub is out of this world. I love the flat screen TV in view from the tub. The bedding is the best I've encountered. Soft, subtle and simply like sleeping on a cloud. Do use your latch & Privacy Tag unless you want house keeping coming in bright & early. Also, Don't play with the mini-bar. As is becoming regular in Vegas, the mini-bar is WEIGHT sensitive. To anyone complaining of being charged erroniously by it, don't play with food you aren't going to eat, especially for the 2 minute lag it has. The in room fax machine has come in handy on more than one occassion. The pool & cabanas are nice. Some of the lounge areas pool side can be a little bit cramped, but, there are many open areas to be had. One just needs to walk to them. The service pool side is regularly top quality. The food, again, is spendy, but, wonderful. I fell in love with the Chocolate shop in the Wynn Collection. The shopping is evil, though they make my credit card providers happy. With designers like Brioni you know this isn't a typical place to bring the family shopping. Now for the reason we goto Vegas.....the Casino. It is indeed a casino. A nice one with good minimum & limit amounts. Some dislike that most tables are $25 min. bets. I like it. It sometimes keeps them less crowded than other casinos. This leads me to my only true complaint: Gawkers. While Vegas is becoming more a tourist destination than a gaming destination it is bringing more and more people there who spend too much time wandering & staring than eating & playing. I only wished there were less people bumping into each other & more people there who were doing something other than sight seeing & price gawking. I loved the gaurds checking room keys at the elevators, it made for a comfortable elevator ride. I found the staff to be very helpful. While there was a few times the computer had issues during my stays (Early on), everyone was taking it in stride; Some self-important guests aside. I found check-in\/out to be painless. The Concierge team has always come through for me, even last minute. The ony time I saw someone be treated less than five star is when they began treating a staff member like the janitor at a roadside motel; You can't buy class. I read of one reviewer feeling that other dressier patrons were catered to more than he. Well, Good. This is not a place to wear cut-offs & a TShirt to a five star dinner. I stated that this hotel isn't for everyone & I firmly feel that way. That is why many like it, simply, we can be around other like minded people. The bottom line is that Wynn is expensive, but, it delivers.
If you stay at Wynn, get the executive suite. Wynn has more of a business-professional vibe. Encore is more wild and hip.

The rooms here are amazing. The amenities in the room and in the bathroom showed that the Wynn should be near the top as far as 5 star hotels on the strip. We stayed on the 24th floor and the view of the golf course was nice and relaxing compared to the busyness of the Strip. 

My main issue, which is huge, is that the noise from the club was too loud. I could not fall asleep for the life of me, even though I was really tired. I eventually fell asleep, but I kept waking up. I know I should bring ear plugs and not complain, but I expected a little more from a 5 star hotel. If we had a Strip view room, I'm sure this would not be an issue.

For us, this is now the gold standard for Vegas hotels.  New, Clean, courteous, gaudy in a good way, and the godawful smoke management is actually better than most other strip hotels.

The room was spotless.  We got a city view that was fabulous.  I'm very spoiled, now.

Wynn Buffet was a diet buster!  Dare I say, this was the best buffet we've ever had?  Yea, I think so...splurge and eat there, you WILL NOT be disappointed.

Coming back?  Oh yea...
Can I move in please?? This hotel is spectacular. The decor is top of the line in both the hotel rooms and the common areas. The service is fantastic, the food is great. Luxury baby!!

Such a nice hotel and the rooms have beautiful views! I was there for a conference and my only complaint was sometimes the elevator lines were very long. Besides that I'd say the service was great and Wynn was the best Las Vegas stay I've had.

We took our first of hopefully many vacations to Las Vegas and stayed in the beautiful Wynn hotel we stayed here as a special treat for us as it was my BIG SCARY 30th. Wow is all I can say the lobby was decorated in a floral display as in in a huge hot air balloon made of fresh flowers and an amazing merry go round that spun may I add also made of fresh flowers! 
They staff were extremely friendly and very well dressed in uniforms as expected in a luxurious hotel. I thought when seeing it we would feel awkward as we do not usually stay in these kinds of hotels ones with Ferraris on display!! However we did not everyone was very polite and eager to chat with us and have a good time! I only have the greatest of memories of this hotel. The buffet breakfast had everything to offer and was fresh every morning and again the staff were more than helpful not your usual buffet by any means. The pool was beautiful with great service for drinks weather you wanted to relax and enjoy the sun or go to the party and gamble area the choice was yours. Very enjoyable stay at this hotel. Well done to the Wynn!!!!

My stay at the Wynn was ruined from the moment we reached the registration desk. We had "pre-paid our reservation in February for 2 rooms for 2 days beginning April 30 on a American Express credit card. At check-in, I was basically told that since I didn't have the American Express card with me and didn't know the CV code we would have to get another form of payment 
that day or lose our rooms. Danny Min was the manager who basically was handling this situation and in my opinion not very effectively. In the end I called my husband who was in Orange County, CA (we live in Camarillo) and used his credit card.  Danny Min claimed that the Wynn's policy is to require the prepaid card be presented at check-in. That doesn't even remotely make sense .  People gift vacations for wedding presents, birthdays and graduations.  I feel
that the customer service is a deal breaker for me given 
that we always have stayed at the Venetian or Palazzo in the past.  Also beware of the $150 a day per room charge for contingency charges. This is not a "pending"
charge but a actual charge which will be credited back within a few days after check-out. We will never stay at a Wynn property and will advise family and friends to stay elsewhere.

The Wynn is a beautiful hotel. I enjoy walking around the hotel and looking at the fine detailing. The ceiling, walls, drapes, columns, flowers..it's obvious Steve W has exceptional taste. I've seen no other on the strip as lovely.

I stayed in the tower suites for the Christmas weekend.

Pros:
Great room, great service in the tower suites area. SW is also nice.
Casino is great, much better than other places. There are actually some good pay slot machines here and there. 
It is located at the edge of the strip, so it is not too busy and not too quiet.
I mean, Wynn and Encore simply looks much better than any other hotel.

Cons:
Service outside tower suites area is just average. You get rude service now and then, It's is more like the service you get in best western, not a five-star hotel. Probably because I don't dress up normally... You always get better service when you dress up, oh, people...

Room is not that clean, carpet has stains and bathroom floor has dirty spots.
The second morning, someone smoked in the non-smoking hallway (killer problem for me)

I don't like the fact that they replaced my 2 free buffet ticket with $50 credit (buffet are $50\/person).
They also replaced my $80 breakfast credit with just 2 entry and 2 beverage (worth only about $50)
Pool are closed and they also started charging the $35 resort fee for tower suites starting October.

The buffet is pretty bad, crabs are not fresh, rib eye is soo dry that it feels like chewing rubber. Service is also not even close to places like SW, it feels more like service you get in $15 buffet. Again, not a five-star hotel service
Hands down best hotel on the strip. Once you go Wynn you never go back!!

Not even close...the best Vegas has to offer. Even the resort rooms are great and spacious with the most comfortable bed and high thread count linen. The bathtub fills in 60 seconds and there is a flat screen TV to watch while lounging in the bath too. It is worth being in the hotel within a hotel -the Tower suites. Also, if you can get a deal through Amex platinum, the Salon suite is the best suite in the city, over 1400 square feet and it comes with its own private massage room and a world class living area and bar.  Through Amex, the rate was $760 on a weekend night versus $1000 through the hotel.  

The minute you walk into the lobby of the south tower it transports you back to the Four Seasons George V in Paris. Steve Wynn knows how to roll.

And no big deal, at least to the high rollers at my craps table, but Bruce Willis was playing craps until 4 AM at his own table next to us.

Why would you stay anywhere else in LAS Vegas? The Wynn is the nicest place with best hospitality ever!  This was not our first time there and most certainly won't be our last! Tower suites to die for!

The best hotel in Las Vegas !!
It is just perfect for me...

The double charged us the $150 a night fee taking away our spending money.  When you only have two, kid-free nights in Vegas, sitting on the sidelines is no fun.  The money was restored by the next day....but all is not forgiven.  Great customer service would have offered to comp our room.  Overall, the room was very nice.  The casino is pretty tame compared to other spots.

Luxurious!

Although it's not my favorite, it's arguably the most elegant.  we came here to see La Reve and we had some time to burn so we walked around and just being inside you felt like a million bucks.  everything new and classy from the new carpet, to the gold plated sinks, to the supple leather in most of the seats, i was impressed!!
AMAZING! No other word can describe this place. IT's clean, luxrios and I want to go back again!! Not much to write, just visit yourself and you;ll love it.

Perhaps the most fabulous hotel I ever had the pleasure to stay in. The staff is amazing from the moment you check-in to the moment you check out. They are knowledgeable and stationed everywhere to ensure that you are never lost or are in need of anything. The facility and rooms are immaculate and luxuriously appointed. And yes, everything works as it should. We had a Deluxe Panoramic View Room perched on the 50th floor which offered a priceless view of the Northern Strip and mountains through floor to ceiling windows and remote electric curtains at your command. The casino, restaurants and pool areas are first class all the way. If there is one negative; no coffee machine in the room, so bring your own if it's a must have. Otherwise, there are no better accommodations in Las Vegas, period.

The hotel is beautiful, and clean. But for a hotel with a day club it's strange that you can't walk around in bathing suits and cover ups. AFTER ordering at the Cafe, my friend was made aware that she could not eat in because of her crocheted pants. So while I waited for my food my friend was hassled by security to leave. Service is poor, and they're hypocritical. Don't have a day club then deny service to girls in cover ups. In addition, the food is inconsistent. One night we had a great tuna sandwich on a warm croissant, the next day it was straight out of the fridge. The hotel is nice but the Cafe and staff take away from the experience.

There was enough money spent (over $1000.00) at their hotel to accumulate (7) expensive Buffetts.

We arrived our party of (7) including two strollers only to find out one male in our party could not enter because he had a tank top on even though a woman behind us had very little on and she us concerned about being let in.

FYI...there is a dress code for men and not woman at the Buffett. No Tank Tops.

So we're like fine after is was 100 deg. Outside and everyone was tired and Hungry and tired we were like fine, we tried to leave and the attendant told us we had to wait for all the people in the line over (20) cleared the lines to let us out, needless to say my party was  it happy.

So, I called to speak to a manager at the Wynn and he pretty much had the same Attitude as their attendant checking people in for the Buffett. What a let down for a Hotel that braggs about being so good. (he really didnt Care.

To Be honest none of us was impressed with the Wynn other hotels are much nicer.

We ended up going to Treasure Island they were more than happy to take our $350.00 plus to eat dinner, it was much cheaper and Awesome all the Crab legs you could eat and the customer service was much better than the Wynn.

Note: I have not stayed here, eaten here, or tried the club.

I only did a walk through and damn this hotel is sexy. Did I just say that? Yes I did. Mr. Wynn has brought sexy back. The hotel had great feng shui, didn't stink of cigarettes, and had was amazing to the eyes. I have never seen a hotel so beautiful in all my life! i only wish I could afford to stay here! I'd probably never leave the hotel!

We didn't stay here, but visited the lobby and shops.  The lobby is beautiful. If you like flowers and plants, the garden area in the casino\/lobby area is great.  The curved escalator by Parasols is great!  We walked the shops and then had coffee and dessert at Le Cafe at the end of the shopping area.  We sat outside on the balcony that over looks some of the water and a waterfall.  It was lovely.  It was chilly being near all the water and there were heaters outside which was nice.

The gambling area is nice and we spent very little time there.  We did win at some of the slots, so that was our cue to take the winnings and run!

The valet took a long time to get our car compared to every other hotel we went to.  I was surprised.  Other hotels that were just as big got our car in under 5 minutes.  At the Wynn we waited over 10-15 minutes.

I'm really liking the Wynn these last few years. I came here years ago to see Avenue Q, then back for Le Reve, returned to stay here when in town for the Rock N Roll marathon a couple years ago and most recently this weekend to get out of town. The Venetian and Bellagio used to be my go-to hotels, but it feels like I may have jumped ship to the Wynn. 

This hotel is lovely, the people are lovely, the crowd is nice- you don't get the random questionable riff raff you get at some of the other non tolerable casino\/hotels on the strip, the casino is great. I'm loving the electronic Roulette machine. 

We've stayed here on two separate visits and both times have been great experiences. Our room is always extremely comfortable and welcoming. I love the TV's in the bathroom, the products are high quality, water pressure is perfection, the bed is super luxurious, sofa is great - absolutely no complaints.

I will say, with the Venetian I often feel there is a bit more at my finger tips (dining, shopping, etc.) than the Wynn, but this is still an Excellent choice! 

We have had the buffet before and missed dining at Andrea's this go around due to timing with our show but will definitely return soon and experience more of their dining options.

Their new Jeff Koon's Popeye is probably one of my most favorite pieces of his. We really enjoyed seeing it on this visit. 

The Wynn is gorgeous. It's surely one of the best options in Vegas and I can't wait to return.

Cashed in on the Expedia save $300 deal and got a flight from LAX to Vegas and 1-night at the Wynn (+$100 resort credit for food\/bev) for $1.63. Yep, you read that correctly...1 dollar, 63 cents.

The hotel itself wasnt too crowded for holiday season. Check-in was smooth and painless. I was able to check-in at 9AM, even though the listed time is 3PM. Very convenient!

I stayed in a Deluxe Panoramic View room on the "59th" floor. Really I think its the 49th since the elevator skips 10 floor numbers. Not sure whats going on there. The rooms are pretty nice and definitely have a luxurious feel. The decor was okay, not really my style. No complaints at all about the room. The room controls are actually pretty cool. Make you you press "ALL ON" when you walk into the room. Most reno's on the strip are adding those features.

The Terrace Pointe Cafe at the Wynn is pretty good. The Sangria was reasonably priced and delicious.The Mahi Mahi Tacos were awesome! Not too filling which was good since we were hitting the buffet later on.

The Wynn Buffet is one of the best on the strip. I still think the Studio B Buffet at the M Resort Spa Casino in Henderson beats the Wynn's buffet hands down (and its cheaper). Check it out.

The 24-hour cafe is way overpriced. I got a Turkey\/Brie sandwich for $10.50 which was smaller than a Subway 6". I'm glad it was on the Wynn's tab.

My group showed up to Blush lounge a little late (11, 11:30) and they tried to charge us full price ($30 guys, $20 girls) as hotel guests. Shady..no thanks. We took off and went to club Moon at the Palms and had an great time!

Overall, my stay was great. Free food, free room, free trip! My total at checkout after the resort fee was about $40. However, I probably wouldn't stay here on my next trip. I'll probably checkout the newer properties like Aria and the Cosmopolitan. Props to anyone else that got on that expedia deal!

OK..... One good thing about Vegas is you can stay at topnotch hotels for less!  Its bargain town when it comes to 5 star accommodations.  I've stayed at quite a few posh hotels, but the Wynn set the standard.

So, like a smart budgetnista I signed up for Wynn deals via email.  And BAM the deal of a lifetime came.  Well not so much of a lifetime, but you get my point.  I digress, so going to the Wynn you can't wait to check in.  Its a Status thing.  Here I am decked out at the check-in desk.  Normally I show up in a sundress and sandals.  Long story short we get our room key.

The Wynn has the most lively colors and fresh flower displays anywhere bar-none. The Elevator bouncer greeted us, checked our room key and said "Have a pleasant stay Ms. Sanders".  I was feeling special.. Note: I never had to show my room key again, he remembered me AND my name.  Now that's service.

Even the elevator was smooth.  Have you ever been on a janky elevator where you knew any moment the elevator was gonna plummet to the ground?  Well not here lol.

The Room was amazing.  59th floor, picture window, the most amazing bed.  Even better then the beds at the W.  For an hour I was in the bathroom trying to get ready.  Why you ask?  Because that damn TV had me distracted.  I couldn't leave... captivating programming in the tub!

Room service was.... expensive ($90 for breakfast), but when you are on vacation....vacation.  I got Watermelon Juice (my apologies to the black race).

The grounds, pool and restaurants were and are amazing.  There is no outrageous noise (which doesn't make gambling too fun).  But The Wynn showed me how I need to be treated.  Now if the Wynn could show me how to afford it!!!!!!

I just spent a few nights at the Wynn on a stopover between New York and Los Angeles to see family. Let me just say that I've only been to Vegas about four times and each time I've stayed in a different hotel - Caesars, Mandalay Bay, the Aria and the Wynn. The Wynn by far is my favorite of the for! 

While the others staying with me wanted to spend their time gallivanting around the Strip, I decided that since we were putting the money into our stay at the Wynn that I'd get everything I could out of it.

From dining (everything from the Maine Lobster Risotto at Sinatra's, calamari at Stratta, Crab Fried Rice at Lakeside and Vegetarian friendly Wynn burger available all over for casual dining) to entertainment (La Reve was out of this world!) and from the fitness room (so bright and energizing) to the room amenities (enjoyed a nice soak in the tub while watching TV and the wireless is included in the resort fee for last minute work projects) - the place is fantastic. 

I made an entire day alone of just shopping in some fantastic upscale boutiques located right in the resort and nearly caved and bought a pair of Manolos just because the sales girl was so wonderfully sweet and they were on sale!

The people there are very friendly and accommodating as well. If I go back to Vegas soon, you bet I'm going to splurge for a stay here again unless I try some place new like the Cosmopolitan. 

If I do stay there again I want to go without family and sample the night life a bit more. But the casino was also great and not at all too smokey or dark (as was my experience at the Rio and Aria).

Thanks Steve Wynn!
No free coffee. Nowhere to get a quick bite. Everything smells like cigarette smoke. Astro turf on the ground. Like hell, if hell were expensive.

This place is a palace! Its SO over the top! Everything is on the most grand scale... This guy has too much money and too big an ego...

Didnt really gamble. I went to the sportsbook and bet some races, but didnt hit anything worth talking about. The bar at the sportsbook DOES NOT serve comped drinks even if youre playing the video poker machines. Some places want you to play max coins all the time and then theyll comp you. Not this place... and the bartender was quick to let me know. A Bookers on ice was 12 and the tip was 3. Nice, Mr. Wynn. At least you showed my friend Karen a nice eve at your lounge. Kudos for taking care of the tourist from downunder...

Did eat a small plate of lunch at the cafe near the sportsbook which was decent. Im sure, if you take the time, youll find lots of cool things here at Wynn.

I'm a MGM property girl and when the Wynn sends me those offer letters in the mail, I usually disregard them. First, I don't know how they got my information, and secondly, their deals aren't usually that great. For whatever reason, I decided to really look into one of the letters I got and it turned out to be a GREAT deal. We got Fri\/Sat night rooms, 2 Le Reve tickets, and 2 Buffet tickets (anytime) for a really low cost. I was surprised it turned out to be legit.

Checking in on Friday was a nightmare. We were early and a tour bus just dropped off a ton of people. Luckily the management really knows how to crowd control and continuously passed out bottled of water to us. We were able to get a corner room with an awesome view of the golf course but the room felt a bit off to me. There was so much space and very little furniture. I guess I shouldn't complain because MGM rooms are the complete opposite. The bathroom was sizeable and everything was top quality. Although I just remembered, we decided to upgrade to 2 fulls for +$10 a day and the beds were SOOO SMALL. Should've just had a king and pull out couch or something.

The casino floor is easy to navigate and there are many food and night life (clubs and shows) options to choose from. It's a bit far from the main part of the strip but there's plenty to do in the surrounding areas. If they offered another deal like that I might just have to say yes again.

Wynn did get the last laugh ::shakes fist at blackjack table::
Sweet..romantic. .colorful..peaceful..bright..good service..excellent music..cheque night clubs..friendly deco

definition of fabulous. 

pretty convenient place to stay at if you're the clubbing type. as XS\/Tryst\/Surrender are all downstairs and TAO is right next door too. 

service is truly world class too. After I got locked out of my room, I left my phone at the hotel directory in a drunken stupor and the security\/concierge was nice enough to help me get it back when they didn't need to. -1 star me +1 star them lol 

celebrities regularly stay here. i took a pic with kevin durant here over MDW last yr! chill dude 

my only bone to pick with this place is that i lost  like 16 out of 20 hands here at blackjack once(i mean, forrealz? lol). oh well, at least my donation went someplace worthwhile hahaha. i'll definitely be back again soon!

I am now officially one of the "300." How does this relate to the Wynn, you ask? Well, let me tell you a little story.

So, for Valentines Day this year, the favorite Yelper and I thought it would be nice to take a little weekend excursion to good old Sin City. Airfare is dirt cheap these days, and we also noticed some pretty sweet deals on Hotwire for hotels. One of the offerings was a Five Star resort right on the Strip, and we knew we couldn't pass it up.

We were ecstatic that the confirmation sheet declared Wynn Las Vegas as our destination! The favorite Yelper was already making plans for our wonderful weekend, and we were counting the days until our vacation.

So, about two weeks pass, when I receive an e-mail from Hotwire. "We are sorry, the Wynn has been overbooked this weekend, and you have been reassigned to the Trump International." Uhh... what? Overbooked? And it took two weeks to figure this out? After we had already made additional plans in and around the Wynn area?

To say the least, we were not happy Yelpers. I'm sure the Trump is a fine resort and all, but it is not what we were promised, and in addition, it has no casino, and is a bit farther away from the Strip. I made a quick call to Hotwire, and much to their credit, they were willing to compensate one full night if we decided to stay, or even give us a full refund, something they NEVER do. Something must have been up.

Speculation was abound. I even located internet forum threads documenting similar cases. As much as Wynn would like to deny it, this is certainly NOT an isolated incident. Was it that we poor Hotwire chumps were merely placeholders until some classier folks willing to pay full price stepped in to take our spot? Who is really to blame for the snafu? Wynn or Hotwire?

And today, I noticed this in the news:
"Wynn 'walks' 300 paid Hotwire customers"
http:\/\/blogs.usatoday.com\/hotelhotsheet\/2009\/02\/wynn-walks-300.html

So, apparently, this whole thing involves that Wells Fargo fiasco, which is causing headlines amidst the current economic crisis. If it was them who bumped us in the first place, and now that the whole deal has been called off, I wonder what will happen to those rooms now? Put back on Hotwire?

In the whole scheme of things, I'm glad we found this out about Mr. Wynn and his shady business practices. Now I know never to patronize his casinos ever again (and encourage others not to as well). Even if the management did offer us our original rooms back, all they will get is a nice view of my backside.

So, I guess us 300 will march on over to the Hot Gates of the Trump International, battered, but certainly not beaten from our battle with the evil tyrant. All I have left to say is...

"Mr.Wynn... YOU'RE FIRED!!!

I love staying here, it is so  beautiful,  everything is in the details, the casino is fun the rooms are beautiful,,restaurants and spa are highly recommend, especially sw steakhouse! Only reason I am not giving 5 stars is , I stay at the Wynn a lot, the last time I stayed, I woke with lots of bug bites on my leg,,I informed the hotel, they had 2 people come upstairs and take pictures and write a report. When I got back home I got a phone call from a staff member saying she got the report back after they tested the room and said there was no bed bugs, I then asked the lady for a copy of this report but she refused to send it to me which was very suspicious, I don't doubt this is a clean hotel, but it was obvious something was in the room and the hotel did not make any effort to make it right.

Simply amazing!  We lucked out and got to stay in the tower suites.  The decor was gorgeous.  The suite was spacious, with a conference table, LCD TVs, wet bar, extra restroom, and comfy couches.  The staff at the resort was great as well.  This place has it all-there really isn't any reason to leave while you're here!

We always enjoy staying at this hotel.  However I have to knock it down a point maybe a point and a half if we could do half points because our maid never replenished our toiletries with fresh new bottles of shampoo and shower gel.  Granted they were half full but I thought it was a bit tacky that they didn't give out new ones at least every other day if they were trying to save money.  Plus we like our room on the cooler side and EVERY time the maid came and left our thermostat would be reset to 72....very annoying.  A few years back while staying here we came back to our room while a supervisor was double checking the room after the maid worked on it.  The supervisor told us she did random checks on the quality of the rooms after the maid fixed it up.  Perhaps they need to step that up again cause it kinda left a little more to be desired this time around.  Still 4 stars cause over all the hotel is very nice, bright and decently ventilated.

For the man who created the Bellagio, he's taken it a step further with his namesake hotel and casino - the Wynn. It's probably as classy as a Vegas casino can get. The exterior is almost like a Serra sculpture with it's curved facade and glass that looks chocolate brown. But enough about the outside, the inside is what makes this place a Wynn-er. If you're a left coaster dreaming of Daniel Boulud, you're 2000 miles closer with his vegas outpost. Next to the Boulud's brasserie, you'll see a beautiful outdoor cafe that overlooks a fountain\/garden. It was actually beautiful and small in scale - unlike much of what Vegas has to offer. And Ferrari aficinados can check out the massive showroom with pretty much every type of Ferrari swag you can imagine. For those on the Vegas tradeshow circuit, you the Wynn is the place to have your event or dinner - especially if you'll be entertaining clients.
By far the best hotel on the strip!  Stayed in the tower suites and I'll be back again

5 star EVERYTHING! That is all!! A bossy experience every time. FLAWLESS! The best on the strip. This hotel has a certain Beverly Hills swag that other hotels cannot replicate. I always see celebrities lounge around the casino and what looks like, the worlds elite. Ballers, shot callers, people with a appreciation for the GOOD things in life. Being at the Wynn makes me feel like a million bucks. The vibe can't be found anywhere else. 

Botero and Bartolotta are Divine. My go to restaurants in Vegas. Wynn resort has the best clubs in Vegas too. Let's see.... Golf course. The best restaurants. The best clubs. A awesome casino. The nicest guest rooms. The list goes on and on. It's amazing up in here. 

I really do hate when people talk badly about this resort. If you don't like it, GO to fricken Buffalo Bills!!! You don't belong here anyway.

This is definitely one of my top 5 restaurants SW is classy the service is fantastic the food is delicious if you want good steaks good all-around tasty food and top-notch service great environment SW is the place to go

not a place for nonsmokers. the minute you walk in to check in, the nasty cigarette smell linger all over you. we were having a hard time breathing, our eyes turn red and smell like a smoker.  anywhere you want to go, you have to pass the nasty smoker smell. don't bring your kids here.
