Drinks are expensive so have a few before you arrive. The women staff are very attractive and have a habit of reliving you of your money in return for sambuca! The music is great, and unlike most LV clubs there is plenty of seating and secluded booths. The dance floor is not huge and extends outside into a lagoon, next to a waterfall. It takes your breath away.

Overall Steve Wynn is the King of Vegas. He built Mirage, TI, Bellagio and now Wynn, and Encore. Each time he builds a hotel is makes it better. So why stay at Bellagio when clearly Wynn is a much better hotel. In my opinion its only rival is Palazzo.

I know many people who didn't take my advice and stayed at Bellagio because in the US it is well known from Oceans Eleven. When they return they have told me - next time I'm staying at Wynn. The beauty of the building is first rate, just about the only credible architecture in Las Vegas.

Once you go you will return for years. I have been three times since this year, and am planning a trip this summer to try Encore. Good rates are on Expedia, but if you want the chance of an upgrade book direct and give the check in staff a $50 bill and ask for a tower suites with a spa tub. It should work, if not they will give you back and probably upgrade you to a strip view on a high floor.

ROOM FEATURES
640 square-foot room.
One king or two double pillow-top Wynn Dream beds with overstuffed pillows and shams.
Floor-to-ceiling views of the Wynn Golf Course or the Las Vegas strip.
42" LCD HDTV and iPhone dock.
Bathroom with glass-enclosed shower, soaking tub, dual sinks and a 13" LCD TV.
Bedside touch-screen curtain, lighting, room service, and privacy controls.

Top hotel in Las Vegas.
Luxury , modern and friendly staff. 
The buffet at the hotel is great,
Pool area is large and nicely set.
Worth the money.

I'd say I was charmed by the Wynn's elegance, but I'm a dude and dudes don't get charmed.  Like I said, a very elegant and classy atmosphere, the kind that makes you want to Suit Up.  Bonus points because my friend won $2,000 from one of the slots!
First time staying at this hotel! Love everything about it. Super classy and I hope it stays this way! Definitely will stay here every time we come back.

The fact that Wynn gets a higher rating than Trump International prooves my point that I am too old to be on Yelp!  

It's really just pretty, meh!

Was a great hotel, but due parking charges each time needed to exit lot, hassle.  The front desk attempted 3 times to enable door key, but failed each time.  
Hotel does not feel the same.
Even room service each time forgets items.  Never had this experience at other stays.
Was waiting 10 minutes to  order coffee at 1st floor restaurant and was ignored in favor of employee who just entered line.  Couldn't believe it.  The staff ignored the line and took her order.  When I complained, they stated I needed to calm down.  Wow.  For a 1st class hotel with super high prices, horrible treatment.

I did not stay at this hotel but I spent many hours walking through and looking at everything that is open to the public. Architecture and design is a sight to behold. Lake of dreams is incredibly impressive and my favorite show other than the Bellagio Fountains. Lobby is full of trees and flowers with Christmas lights and giant balls of flower petals hanging from the branches. Had white Christmas tree decorations up with miniature villages. There's also a merry go round and hot air balloon made from flower petals. Floors are marble tiles with flower and leaf mosaics. Shops are amazing to walk through and the prices are sky high but still fun to browse. The new fountain outside is like a mini Bellagio but it is on constantly and dances to different songs and has colored lights. They are closing the golf course December 2017 and making way for a new entertainment park for adults which will attract a lot more visitors and make them a whole lot more money!!!

I stayed at the Wynn for three nights for a work conference. It is a stunigly beautiful hotel. This was my first time in Vegas, and I was not sure what to expect staying in a Casino\/Hotel. 

My room was on the 60th floor, with a stunning view of Vegas. The curtains and shades were open literally the whole time. Just beautiful. The bed was super comfortable and the pillows heavenly. The tub is also brilliant (i wish i had the same one at home). The shower looks really cool, but the showerhead was loose and kept slipping down. 

The staff were all very nice and helpful (with the exception of one Roulette dealer who was quite grumpy). 

There are two reasons for the missing star. One is the cigarette smoke. It was not just on the main floor, but up in the elevator lobbies as well. I can't stand the smell  of smoke. I thought that the hallways upstairs would at least be smoke-free areas, but I guessed wrong. Second is the never ending charges for literally everything in the hotel. Want to charge your phone in the lobby? $1.99. Use of the Wifi? $19.99. Use of gym? $20\/day. This was the first time I've stayed in a hotel where I had to pay to use the gym. To me, that's just crazy. And lastly was the lack of a fridge in the room...very annoying. 

Overall it's a very cool hotel and i really enjoyed my stay here.

I've been meaning to review the Wynn Hotel and Casino, but I've been procrastinating.  My wife and I stayed at the Wynn in late December 2012 for our honeymoon.  

This place is the bomb.  Everything from the opening of our door until the time we checked out was spot on.  We couldn't have asked for a better stay.
We had one of the corner suites that faced the Palazzo and TI, on the 55th floor.  What an amazing view we had of the entire strip.  The interior design and everything in it's place definitely impressed us (I'll add some pictures to my review to show you).

We aren't big gamblers, so I can't really speak for the casino, although it was large and pretty busy, I can't begin to assume knowing how great the casino is.

Played a round of golf at the course, and although $500 for 18 holes in incredulous, I figured, once in my life is worth it.  Great course, well manicured.  I was paired up with another single player and our forecaddie (can't remember his name, but he was great).  Played in around 3 hours, no holdups on the course.  The fairways and greens were very well manicured and completely enjoyed my round of golf.  Afterwards, they cleaned up my shoes, put my bag in storage for me and were supposed to provide me with a bag tag, but it was not included, they followed up with me later and mailed me a replacement.

The room service was adequate, although not spectacular, but I cannot take away a star because of one person having a bad day, we are all entitled.  He wasn't rude in any way, but just not talkative or over friendly.

If it wasn't for the fact that we try to stay in a different hotel every Vegas visit, I would definitely come back.  You won't be disappointed staying at the Wynn.

I would of given Wynn hotel a 5 star, however I had an incident with Mr. Steve Wynn himself. However, it's a great hotel and casino. Great service and restaurants and Game host by the name of O.K. Wells is a wonderful host and accommodating.

This review is for the customer service desk for the hotel...

They where so helpful and compassionate. I had a room reserved for a Saturday night. Found out Saturday morning my mother in law has terminal cancer and her kidney's are failing. With this being said, there was no way we where going to use our room. The hotel requires a 72 hour notice if you want to cancel your room, otherwise they will not refund your money..

I called, spoke to the front desk, explained my situation and they where amazing! They said because of the circumstance they would refund my money for the room..  That was so nice of them.. They could of easily told me no. I'm so grateful for the compassion they have.. 

We will DEFINITELY stay here another time!

Thank you Wynn and your warm employees!!!

Horrible!!!

My keys won't work at 3 in the morning, we had to wait for security who were no where to be found for 30 minutes.   Front door told me to "Jimmy" with the door.  That actually worked....    No 5 star hotel doors should be "Jimmied",  period. 

Towels took 30 minutes as well!!!!  

Palazzoo and THEhotel are both head and shoulders above the Wynn.

This casino is fabulous. It's really top of the line and high end so expect to pay big money to play or stay here. Minimums at the tables looked to be no less than 15 bucks!

 I played a NL hold em tournament here as well as a 1-3 cash game and although I didn't win any money I had a good time. 

 Someday when I cough up 10 bucks I'm gonna check out the Ferrari Store in here but all in all when I'm filthy rich I'm gonna lodge here one day.

Although the rooms here are smaller than the Palazzo\/Venetian they are significantly better. The corner suite I stayed at on the top floor (Floor 60) had epic views of the strip. The room was spacious and it was appointed with an ultra-comfy bed. This is the place to stay in Vegas.

This place has spoiled me SO much for Vegas, I don't know how I could possibly do it any way in the future. My good buddy got this monstrous deal from the Wynn Towers Suites. Free room? I was there. Luxurious carpet, AMAZING bathroom with a separate tub and bath (and TWO toilets!), the best service I've ever had (I've stayed in 5 star European hotels too), awesome little things like Picasso replicas on the walls and electronic blinds. 

As for the Casino, I'm not a big gambler, and lots of the minimum bets are too high for a cheapass like me. I played some video poker and won 10 bucks, but then lost 60 playing mini baccarat at Venetian, oh well. 

Also within easy walking distance. I haven't been to the topless pool, but as a Tower Suites guest I got to use the private pool, as well as cut the lines in any of the restaurants on property. Sadly this did not count for any of the clubs, which we haven't even *tried* to get into due to extravagant pricing and difficulty getting in.

If I could ever afford this in my life again, I would do it in a heartbeat.

This is my favorite hotel on the Las Vegas Strip! I have been here several times, but this time I am coming in to celebrate my anniversary. We were picked up from the airport my a brand new Lincoln limo, the driver took care of every detail. We were escorted to the VIP checkin and rested in the lounge for with complimentary refreshments. The room is on the 60th floor with a view of the strip and the mountains that are breathtaking. Every detail is paid attention to and this makes such a difference! You really feel like royalty! A must stay whenever you come to Las Vegas!
One of my favorite hotels to stay at when visiting Vegas. They have the best buffet also.

Don't got to this casino unless you want to receive bodily injury from security. The casino security gave me second degree burns all over my body by sitting on top of me on the black asphalt. Then refused to get me to a hospital. I had to scream for help from the police

I always go to\/stay at Wynn when i go to Vegas. And I go pretty regularly. Not after this time though. 

The bell people scratched my limited edition bag and when I called to file the complaint they asked if I would be willing to let someone come to my room "right now" to get the report. I said ok. 30+min later still no one. I had just arrived for my ONE NIGHT trip so it's not like I had plenty of time to casually wait around for them. I called again and finally someone shows up. I asked why they didn't come when they said they would. They fed me some bs "we had a medical emergency" line. Oh really? For a property that big you have just ONE guy handling medical emergencies and guest property damage? I work at a hotel myself and know this is not the case. 

so this security guy is inspecting my bag. He's sweating up a storm while wiping his sweat with his bare hands and then proceeding to touch my bad repeatedly, transferring all that sweat onto my bag. Then he PICKS at the paint scuffs making it worse. I had to literally tell him to STOP. he kept insisting it was a transfer and could be picked off. It cannot. This is a limited edition bag and LV themselves told me it is screen printed and will get scratched if mishandled. 

He apparently thought he knew better by repeatedly trying to convince me it was dye. It's not dye. 

Anyway, I put in the complaint, two days later someone calls me to tell me they refuse to take liability for damaging my bag but "AS A GESTURE OF GOOD WILL" they will just pay for cleaning or give me $100. my bag was in PRISTINE condition and a cleaning will absolutely not remove the damage. This was confirmed by LV as well. The fact that this hotel devalued my property by way more than $100 and refused to do anything about it other than offer a measly cleaning\/pennies only cuz of "good will" with no apology whatsoever says a lot about them. 

So wasting my valuable vacation time, my time to travel down to LV to get it assessed, and of course the actual damage itself was only worth $100 or a cleaning to them. Wow. 

I will not be patronizing this establishment anymore. Horrible customer service.

All I see when I look at my beautiful bag now are the unsightly scuff marks.
Very nice hotel with great service to match. I was always given a hello and help with a smile. The decorum is classier than most area spots.

This hotel is outstanding. At check in, we said we had a recent anniversary (which was in May but what the heck, May isn't THAT far from December is it?) and they upgraded us to a panoramic suite on floor 31 at no additional charge. The room is outstanding - automated lights and motorized window coverings and a view of the strip that can't be beat. WIFI is included when you are staying there because it is part of the non-optional resort fee, but even if you don't use any of the other resort features, it is pretty much a wash for what you would pay for the WIFI anyhow. Included with our stay was a free buffet for you. Usually buffets kinda suck, but the Wynn has the best buffet on the strip so well worth the visit (although the line was exceptionally long when we were there). The room was clean, the hotel was immaculate, and the staff was outstanding. If you want to stay in Vegas and you want a place to remember, stay at the Wynn (and go see La Rev).

Such an aesthetically pleasing place! The hotel is absolutely beautiful, the spa is amazing and the buffet is heavenly. I also love the collection of designer boutiques and Tryst is also simply beautiful..waterfall and all..I recommend that everyone who visits Vegas should at least visit the Wynn, its such a beautiful place! (arrgg...I wanna hop on a plane, and go now!)

The Wynn is a five star experience. There is nothing positive i can say on here that is not already captured by their own website. They deliver. Restaurants, entertainment, location, luxury, comfort, amenities. Although i do believe this is a 5 star hotel, i left with a few complaints. The ipod dock in our room was broken. We were on the 31st floor and could not sleep because the music was blasting until 4am when the club below closed. Also, i was a bit underwhelmed by their spa. I would definitely prefer to go to the Canyon Ranch at Palazzo or Qua at Ceasers.

nice place but expensive.  i lost a lot of money here so i might be bitter, but this place is just ok.  the atmosphere is unlike any place ive experienced.  its sorta weird, like someone decided to open a willy wonka chocolate factory.  nothing was really extraordinary when i went.  i guess i was expecting too much from steve wynn.  with advertising like "it's the only casino that i would put my name on" i would have expected more.  but im still giving this place a 4 cause its nice and new. gj.

I didn't stay at the Wynn Hotel, but I purchased tickets from the Wynn Hotel, to see Tony Bennett perform at the Encore Theater on Nov. 8, 2017. Regarding the performance of Tony Bennett, I really enjoyed his singing and his show. The man is 91 years old, and he was able to perform, singing over a dozen songs for one hour! He  was incredible!! I can't rate him high enough, as I'd have to rate him about 100 stars. He really broke the house down, and it was a pleasure to hear him perform,  many old time favorites (i.e. "I left my heart in San Francisco", etc.).

I was really surprised that the Encore theater personnel permitted many in the audience to record the show using their Smartphones, as there was a prohibition on the tickets, against doing so.  

However, I'm only giving three stars to the Wynn, because it was a hassle to order the tickets, and to pick the tickets up in advance. I had  trouble ordering the tickets online, as it was impossible to select a row, which was designed for a person with mobility problems. Hence, I contacted their box office by telephone. The person I spoke to was helpful, and got us very comfortable seats. I have no problem with that. However, there seemed to be a problem in getting specific information pertaining to any stairs or elevators which might have been involved in getting to the seats. Fortunately, we ascertained that for our specific row, there were no stairs involved, and no elevators. We were told that the wheel transport chair which we brought would be removed, AND RETURNED TO US, at the end of the show. In fact, it was not returned. When the show ended, nobody at first seemed to know where it was. Finally, we located it, together with about two dozen other wheel chairs. One of the attendants wanted our ticket. I told them that we were not given a ticket for the chair, but that my wife's name was on the chair. Finally, they ascertained that it  was ours, and we were able to get it back.

It was a madhouse in leaving, as there were hundreds of people who were exiting; some of whom were not courteous about letting us leave our row, even though we were seated in the last row. One would have thought that the Wynn Management (of the Encore Theater), would have announced at the end of the show, to let  the people who were using mobility devices to leave first, in order to allow them to get to their wheel chairs, and wheel transport chairs.

It should also be noted that even after I paid for the tickets online, they would not e-mail the tickets to us. I had to waste time going to the box office, present identification, and wait for the tickets. Then, I had to sign something stating that "I authorized charging the tickets", even though the tickets had already been charged and paid for.

Surely, in the future, there should be a more user friendly way to get those tickets; other hotels regarding their shows,  either e-mailed the tickets out, or sent them out by U.S. mail.

With so many reviews, I don't really feel the need to go into detail.  However, this is one of the few hotels we have stayed in before we moved to Las Vegas.

While the normal rooms were one of the smallest I have ever stayed in, the beds at the Wynn were the most comfortable I have ever slept in.  They were so comfortable, we didn't want to get out of bed at all.  We still, after a year and a half later, talk about how much we loved the Wynn beds.  And you can actually buy the bed at Wynn LVNV inside, which we may end up doing someday.

My only major problems with this hotel is so outrageously expensive it is.  And the red card rewards program is complete crap compared to other rewards programs in the area.  They do no promotions to attract locals, and don't seem to care if they go here.  Otherwise, I love it.

Such a supreme luxury it was to have just enjoyed a three day conference in arguably the nicest hotel I can remember in quite some time, if not ever. Every detail seems to have been attended to with elegance and quality, the staff as well was nothing but extraordinarily professional and helpful, and my hotel room was the epitome of luxury and comfort.

I feel very lucky having been invited to the luxury real estate conference this year at the Wynn hotel not just because of the business contacts made but just as importantly I now know the hotel I will always opt to stay in for future Las Vegas adventures.

Everyone knows this is a nice hotel, its 5 stars all the way. So I'll try to review some lesser known things....

Some have already said that the walls are really thin. They ARE. We could hear our lovely neighbors getting in on at 2am...5am...7am...ya it wasn't very pleasant. We got to know them real well during our 3 day stay, (you could hear EVERYTHING)  so we're actually on a first name basis now. (Hi Jimmy!) So bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. *Thank god I did*  Club music is also pretty loud...we were on the 56th floor facing the strip and could still hear the bumpin! So ask for a room facing the golf course if you want it to be quiet. I'm sure they would be happy to oblige..We found the service to be exceptional at our stay. (Dunno what Hott Pink is talking about)

Also, we tried the $20 trick...which is when you sandwich a $20 between your driver's license and credit card and ask for a complimentary upgrade. It worked! The lady hooked us up with a panoramic view room on the highest non smoking floor...and we had paid for a resort room through Hotwire (for only $120 a night!) Shows that they don't discriminate. 

I guess one thing to be grateful about the down economy is that it has made the Wynn much more affordable...thank you Wynn for an amazing time!!!

Not what I'd hoped for, seemed empty compared to the bellagio, the decor makes me ill, its like some old lady thought she could do interior design and puked up all the old pattern designs from her scarfs in her closet, ugh. The only cool thing is riding the circular escalator and checking out the lighted wall in the restaurant.

Recently stayed her for a conference. From cleaning staff to security, the employees were very nice and helpful. The room, on the 39th floor of the tower, had a nice look of the golf course. Conference facility were very up to date.

Sin city has many great hotels.  This is one of the newer ones and spectacularly done.  Our room was huge!  Not like the Boston hotels where you can touch all 4 walls....at the same time.  The bathroom was almost as big as my apartment.  Quite amazing!  As with Vegas, it is non stop action and the Wynn will add to your experience.  Their spa is amazing as well.  Well spent $175 x2.  They also have a European pool.  Tops are optional.

Don't get me wrong, this place is amazing.  However, this is Vegas and great hotels are a dime a dozen.  That explains my 4 stars.

This hotel pretty much personifies world class in nearly all facets of the hotel business. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous and the service is top notch. From the second you come in a see Picasso's work over the check in counter, you know you're in for a treat. Having stayed here about 10 times or so, I would say that this place is definitely one of the top 5 hotels in Vegas. The rooms are gorgeous, modern and very well appointed with all the necessities to make your trip awesome. The Wynn itself has an awesome casino complete with a fantastic sports book, great table games and a nice players club (red card) that has some decent comps associated with play. This hotel is also connected to Encore which has some awesome night clubs... 

Pros-
Gorgeous
Rooms 
Views 
Casino
Players club
Sports book
Elegance 
Service 
Across from mall
Ferrari 
Connected to Encore
Restaurants 

Cons-
A bit away from central strip 
Tryst needs updating
Classy, beautiful, not over-crowded in lobby or casino areas.  Great restaurants and hotel staff.  Definitely a treat to stay here.

Beautiful hotel with a great shopping Esplanade (can you beat 2 chanel stores and hermes in one place, Ummm NOPE)!!!

I played craps here and really enjoyed the Casino and the dealers, who were very helpful to a Newb like me.  

Most importantly, THANK YOU STEVE WYNN for having Garth Brooks . . . I will continue returning so long as Garth is performing here . ..  otherwise, I may have to head over to Caesar's Palace to see Celine.

Well, at least if Garth leaves SW Steakhouse is at this hotel . . . beware reading my SW review, it's pretty XXX rated!!

this place is swank. big, beautiful, clean and posh. the hotel room was awesome, bigger by a good margin than most standard rooms and the bathroom was very nice. I'm pretty sure this was one of their basic rooms too, but I was appropriately impressed by the personalization of the room (my name showed up on the phone and tv systems, which made me giddy) and the floor to ceiling panoramic windows made for a great view, especially from the 57th floor. even better, i had a great deal for the room though I would've been happy to pay more for the quality of the stay. we only had one small problem with the tv, that was more our fault than anything and they sent up a technician within minutes of our making a call about it. 

the casino area and shops are tops, though don't look for any super low limits there. excellent tables, chairs and service. I didn't get to check out any of the restaurants or clubs unfortunately, but the night scene was very active and eye-candy was everywhere.

Loved it here!! The hotel is beautiful. Its classy, elegant and has the most beautiful decor. Walking through this hotel you really feel like you're doing Las Vegas the right way! Lol 

The rooms are gorgeous, updated and clean. Our room was suite style, large and spacious. The shower was really big for a hotel shower and clean.

We always wanted to stay here but the rates are usually very high. 

Luckily my friend found an amazing rate on Vegasbooked.com so we paid A LOT LESS than the usual rates which was awesome. 

The hotel has amazing restaurants, staff and nightclubs as well. 

I highly recommend!

I had never been to Vegas.....WHAT!? you say! Yes never.
Because of the Wynn I will go back, do I need to go on?
Recently in a magazine Nora Ephron wrote that this hotel is not Vegas incredible - it IS incredible. She was so right.
Now the decor throughout the hotel may not be what I normally look for in a hotel - but there is no denying that it is over the top amazing. Even the casino was a cut above the rest. 
The buffet - I scarfed my way through the buffet the morning we flew back to SF. I needed it - the night before involved more types of alcohol than you are supposed to consume in an evening. Fun. But alcohol poisoning was happening. The food at the buffet was delicious - all of it. I tried asian, spanish, american, french and what ever else they had. I visited every station and they were are presented beautifully and the service was friendly and informative.
So let's go back to the front desk - when I checked in on a Tuesday there were still quite a few other people checking in. The staff is extremely talented at expediting your wait - so much so that there is no wait. And everything I heard about hotels in Vegas proir to this trip indicated to me I would be waiting...for awhile. Never happened. In fact I never waited for anything at this hotel. That probably is what I appreciated most - they were always available to help you. 
The very pretty girl at the front desk offered a higher floor room to me - pointing out the advantage of the view. And then she proceeded to stick me up at the very top of the hotel - stunning view, beautiful suite, I couldn't have been happier.
One other thing about the room - the bathtub. Gigantic. I am not a bath believer. I have never understood the whole "take a bath" thing. But I found out why at the Wynn. No one makes a bathtub (that I can afford) that I can stretch out in. So why bother. The Wynn has the tub for me. I took a bath drunk as a skunk and it was incredible. I am going to miss that tub.
I got a pretty good deal on expedia for my fights and hotel - which was one of the reasons I chose this hotel. I will definitely spend what I have to to go back and stay at the Wynn again. Roll the dice - it's a great bet!

This is my new favorite hotel in LV. Its so new and clean. The shopping section has almost all the high end stores you could want. The waterfall part was a nice touch. Also how it's conveniently located across the street from the fashion mall. Overall one of the best if not the best hotel on the strip!

No word for this 6 star hotel. I don't gamble, so that aspect isn't for me - we're here for Celine. The property\/decor is unsurpassed as is the service. The beauty of the interior is like nothing I've seen. The pools. The restaurants. The rooms. The cleanliness. Wow. Wow. Wow.

It is my desire for this hotel to be within my budget any time I visit town. My goodness, it smells really good, our view was BEAUTIFUL (facing the immense golf park and landing strip)...

AND THEY DON'T ALLOW STROLLERS in their aisle ways (I do not hate children, I just do not the understand the concept of pushing a baby around at inappropriate places). 

I felt safe too, because they often checked for your hotel key card prior to entering the elevators that lead to the suites. They really monitor everything here, as I observed two ladies being stopped and diverted by hotel security when they appeared to be "indecent", wearing towels over their swimsuits in their heels. 

Our two bedroom suite was gorgeous, clean, and just heaven. The homebody in me wanted to stay in for most of the trip. Big LCD screen, soft beds and lots of pillows, and a gorgeous bathroom with two sinks and another tv-which was much appreciated when applying make up.

Great shopping, casinos don't smell so strongly of smoke, large clean pools.They often have some big name shows too. 

Deliiiggghtful. If you can manage to get a free room and or shell out the large clams, definitely stay here. I loved it so much here, that I even bought their oil scent that they mist the hotel with. ;)

Another fun stay in LV and at the Wynn. Rooms are still large but the prices are coming way down - $159 a night. I remember the days before our much hated recession that rooms went for $499! 

Great food and Tryst was packed! 

A couple of cons by the pool. 
1) If you want to see the pool, or sit near it you have to reserve chairs which can be any where from $150 to $500 a day. I'm actually ok with this, but all the chairs directly around the pool were marked reserved! I've stayed there 10 or so times and gamble a fair amount, if I get to the pool at around 9AM I should get to sit directly around the pool! Quick translation: 9AM is like 5AM if not in Vegas. 
2) I'm all for saving the world from global warming, but what happened to the water bottles by the pool? Now you have to go back and forth to fill up your cup - and yes, God damn it I am lazy! 

I'm really nitpicking here, but all in and all a GREAT place to stay in Vegas!

This place is classy.  I have never had an issue here, they have a great game selection and everything is always so clean.  This is what old Vegas used to be like until all the corporations took over.  If your looking for trendy food places you wont find it here, you will find top notch customer service and high quality everything. 

I love they don't let strollers roam around the casino and the place never feels over crowded, unlike some of the other mega resorts. 

As long as Steve Wynn owns this property I will make it my home away from home.

Just came back from 5 nights at Wynn.  I have been staying and celebrating my birthday here for the last 4 years.    We have visited and gambled at most of the hotels and all the newer hotels...but this is the only hotel that I will stay at in Las Vegas!  The service is fantastic, as are the rooms and the restaurants in Wynn & Encore.  We have always had the rooms with the wall-to-wall view of the golf course.  In the casino, there are always staff cleaning, pushing in the chairs, and serving drinks.  Whenever I go to any other hotel in Vegas, it always feels like a zoo and definitely not as clean! 

Minor things to note: the wifi in the rooms are not always stable.  There are no coffee machines in the rooms, however, the coffee at Wynn's Drugstore Cafe I bought everyday is great.

Thank you for another wonderful stay, Wynn.  Although we casino hop and check out the other hotels during our visits like when we go watch shows, nothing compares to Wynn and I will not stay anywhere else.  Beautiful hotel and we always receive great service.  See you next year.

I just got off the phone after speaking to a reservation manager Sonia.  I had gotten an email from Wynn for a great offer and she did not honor that rate for me.  I explained to her that I got this email just last month and now I wanted to make a reservation.  She kept arguing with me and did not want to give that special rate.  I am very disappointed at Wynn and in the past I have had always had great service except for this time!
Great restaurants and cafes here. If you're casino hopping and looking for good food, this is the place to stop!

My super intelligent and oh so kind wife and I love the encore and always stay here when they offer a discount. It is so clean, comfortable, and beautiful. The rooms are always clean and the bed is always so comfortable. The views of the strip are great. The restaurants are too notch and the the Casio is always buzzing. The pool is beautiful and easily accessible. We just love it.

The new Charlie's Bar and Grill is a big negative.  The old deli had Much better food.  Please add from to the new menu some of the old favorites ladkas etc...   the saving grace is the staff is excellent.    Prices are a little steep.  Fish and chips $25 not so bueno.  Ceasar salad with salmon excellent.

I stayed here for my birthday weekend got 3 complimentary nights free. Once you enter the casino you will see gorgeous waitress left and right oh yeah and various slot machines too hehe. 

Hotel stay 4\/5 only minor problem was the loud noise from the club & the air ventilation could of been better.

Waitress 5\/5 gorgeous woman i ever seen in a casino

Gaming slots 3\/5 didn't win any JP but manage to win some $$

Buffet 2\/5 for the price you figure it would be the bomb

Late night clubs 5\/5 so many gorgeous woman 

Valet parking 4\/5 they were very accommodating with directions

Recommendations: If you were planning to stay in Vegas remember to always play with your red card at the Wynn & Encore to get free rooms. I would suggest eating else where their buffet here sucks to be honest with you. I would go to Rio Carnival world buffet or the Aria buffet instead. Other than that everything from the casino and waitress is a Wynner haha.
nice rooms,card dealer don't usually smile here,buffet is a great place here!

Our stay at the Wynn was fantastic! Every single person who helped us, waited on us or dealt cards had the most thoughtful and professional demeanor. The resort is gorgeous and luxurious. We will return again and again. Nothing was wanting and the environment was exactly what we were looking for
Wish I could stay in this hotel but I can't pay those high rates.  The slot machine selection is awesome!!!  Lots of variety and the workers are too notch.  One day, I will stay here.

This is a damn nice place.  Great looking place, clean.  Enjoyable to be in.  The staff looks great and they carry themselves in a way that makes you want to interact with them.  The rooms are SERIOUSLY nice and clean!  The only reason I'm not giving this review five stars is because of the price.  It's a steep one!  But the experience was great overall!

Just a fabulous experience all around.  The rooms are spacious, stylish, and very clean.  It's seems as though it's near impossible to get a bad view.   I have only one con, you can hear the bass from the nightclub music late at night (though it is nowhere near as bad as some of the reviews make it seem).  Aside from this, you get what you pay for..if it's in your budget, I would recommend staying at the Wynn or Encore.

Here are all the things we loved about the Wynn:

*Customer service-  everyone was friendly and eager to help.

*Food- Tons of delicious food options (will post individual reviews)

*The Bed- Slept like a baby every night in this amazingly decadent bed.

*The clientele- A bit more sophisticated than some of the other spots on the strip.

*The Pool- So lush, with amazing landscaping and scenery. 

I think there are a lot of great places to stay on the Strip, but the Wynn offers a great mix of "vegas" and "resort".  If you're looking for some luxury the Wynn is where it's at!

I happen to be a big fan of The Wynn. I have stayed in the rooms on a number of occasions over the years as well as dined at many of the restaurants, enjoyed shows and visited all of the clubs and I have to say I have only good things to say about the property. 

The parking is great, no matter how busy I always seem to find a good spot. The layout is convenient and despite the grand size of the property it is quite easy to navigate your way around. Every restaurant I have tried has been impressive. The shows are always quality and entertaining. The rooms are really nice comfortable and the clubs are some of my favorites in town.

The Wynn has everything going for it so I can't find a single reason not to give the place 5 stars.

Best hotel on the strip. We've stayed here about a dozen times, and their off days are better than the competition's best days. This is a huge resort designed to function on a human scale. No detail is to small from floor to ceiling and from the doormen to the dish washers.

I have never smelt cigarette smoke in the casino, the staff is first rate, the dealers learn your name, the detail work of the building's architecture is second to none.

Don't show up in cut offs holding a yard of beer. The ambiance is sophisticated. This is a place for adults to have grown up fun.

When you decide to come to Vegas, look no further...
After the first experience from the pass Thanksgiving weekend with our friends and Family, Wynn and Encore is the only choice in our heart from this point forward.

The reasons are not just the design and the luxury 
but the one thing keeping them on top for all this time is their services and amazing staff! it is unparalleled
They go above and beyond to make sure you have the best time in Vegas and the did for us just that

Special big kudos to our private concierge at Wynn tower suite name Kenny Block who make our time here so memorable :-)

In summery:
Guest Room are equally amazing both Encore and Wynn 
Casino have more action over the Wynn side 
If you like to party with friend I think Encore is the right way to go
But if you here for the family experience Wynn is the one for me
but since you can share the facility between both Hotel I would go with either one without thinking

Or stay at both Wynn and Encore like us and find out for yourself! :-)

I wish I could live here. All their rooms are suite styled and are very spacious. The beds are super comfy and I like how the drapes are electric and the lights are controlled by this iPad looking like remote. 
Super convenient if you plan on going to xs, surrender, and or encore beach!

I got suckered into staying here for 2 nights last weekend, all because I got a special deal that included breakfast\/lunch buffet for 2 along with 2 tickets to the Le Reve. The whole shabang came out to be around $735 despite the "starting price" of the package that promised it to be around $300. This price hike might be due to the fact that I booked it on a veteran's day weekend, which happened to align with the timing for the rock n' roll marathon. During the booking process, I was told that I'd get a 50th floor deluxe panoramic king suite room facing the strip. As a disclaimer to the buffet deal, I was told that I wouldn't be able to use them over the weekend since they were only valid for weekdays.   

Once I got to the Wynn, I was told that the room I was supposed to get wasn't available and that I'd be getting a garden view double room instead. The guy who helped me (Shaq?) was very nice and accommodating in finding other options to satisfy my needs. Since my buddy and I were staying for a couple of nights, Shaq said he could help us switch to the strip-facing room on the next night of our stay. We were also told that we could actually eat the The Buffet even if it was during the weekend. At first, I was a annoyed and bitter that I wasn't getting the strip view that I was promised. However, I decided to go ahead with the arrangement. Once we got to the room, I was blown away when I found out that our room (#6048) was actually on the top floor of the building. I can't get over how flossy the room was. Call me a peasant, but I'm used to staying at ghetto motels where the only way to open the curtain is manually. At the Wynn, all you have to do is push a button for "all on", and voila, all the lights in the room were instantly on along with the opening of the curtain to reveal the magnificent view of the glittering Vegas skyline underneath. It was fantastic. The room was spacious and grand, and I loved how the TV even greeted me with my full name on it. My bed was so comfy, and I love falling asleep right next to the view of the city underneath me. In fact, I fell in love with the room so much that I decided to not change my room to the strip-facing one after all. 

The pool at the Wynn was also grand. I didn't plan on going for a swim so I didn't bring any of my bikinis with me, but I really wish I did since the water was so warm and perfect to swim in. Since guests have free access to the pool from 8AM-5PM, I'd highly recommend going there after The Buffet for a quick afternoon nap\/reading before heading out to the other adventures on the Strip. 

What made the Wynn experience amazing for me was that I felt like a VIP during the entire length of my stay. On our last night at the hotel, I even received a personalized card that's handwritten by the person who helped me make the reservation (John). Wynn won my heart for its elegant set-up without the snooty attitude. If only the resort fee ($39 a night) could be used for something that made more sense than Wi-Fi and free calls (most of us have our own phones with plans that cover that), the 5th star of my rating would be there in a heartbeat.

We arrived late at night (11 pm) & were told our room was no longer available?? BUT, they upgraded us to a tower suite strip view for free instead. This was the first time I had that. The room was very good size with floor to ceiling windows (push button controlled). Service was great here. Bed was very comfy. Everything was well maintained. Pool area was really cool. Only downfall is that the sun goes behind the massive hotel mid day & shades a lot of the pool, kinda a bummer. Lots of food, drink, & shopping\/entertainment here. I highly recommend.
Tower suites are amazing! Wynn has everything all under one roof. The restaurants are all delicious and the customer service was spectacular!

I didn't stay here but I ate at the buffet. It's great! Tons of good stuff. HUGE crab legs, shrimp, seared fish, game hen, all sorts of vegetables and salads, prime rib, sushi...... Leave room for dessert. Creme brule, ice cream (get the mango sorbet), chocolate anything. Awesome. It cost about $35 not including beverages.

As I write this I am still here at the Wynn in the buffet and I  will start off by saying the buffet is amaing even better than when i was here 6 months ago and my room 63-442 Spectacular and what a view and the hotel staff housekeeping bellman top notch but then I went to the casino to get a red card I am a 54 year old man here with family I went downstairs to gamble when I went to get my card I shared 2 Arizons state ids and they told me because of no expiration dates I could not get a red card I was upset talked to mgr told again NO so I will walk away enjoying my room and buffet knowing I will never ever everrrrrrr gamble in a Wynn casino or share how much iI enjoyed my room and food but instead tell all how they should not gamble in the Wynn

Beautiful, clean resort in Vegas. The rooms are beautiful, great restaurants, clean and swanky ambiance. Definately check out the Spa and get a massage. I got the best massage ever here. We ate at the buffet which was good, and SW Steakhouse which was amazing.Will definately stay here again- we had a fabulous time!

I stayed here just a few days ago during the July 4th weekend in the standard room on the 15th floor.   I don't like that the walls are thin, and you can hear your next door neighbor if they are talking or playing their music.  Plus, some of the rooms are connected with a locked door to the next door neighbor, which causes us to hear the next door neighbor even more.  Our next door neighbor turned on their music loud around 3:00am in the morning, and it woke me up.  They lowered it a little, but it was still loud, and I could still hear the music.  I called the front desk to report the loud music, and the front desk said they would inform security.  I heard security walked by her room to talk to her, and a few minutes later, the next door psycho neighbor who sounded like she was black started cussing at us with her big mouth, shouting saying her music was not loud, and started using the "f word" cussing at us, saying "those people should fukn leave", when she is the one that started the loud music.  If I could hear music, then it was loud.  I can even hear the words to her music, so obviously that psycho woman doesn't realize it is loud.  I can hear almost every single word in her stupid song.  She should not have played music at 3:00am in the morning in the first place.  It is very inconsiderate and rude of her to play music at 3:00am in the morning when people sleep at that time.  She was cussing at us for more than ten minutes saying that we should leave.  I don't know if Wynn security gave her a hard time, which I didn't want, but maybe they could have talked to her in a nice way to prevent her from cussing at us afterwards.  Anyhow, the walls are thin enough you can hear from neighbors.  For the expensive price we payed for the July 4th weekend, it was not worth hearing loud music or our neighbors talking, and having our neighors cuss at us afterwards.  It would have been a better stay if the walls were more sound proof in the standard room, so none of this chaos and cussing at us would have happened.  My stay was unpleasant at the Wynn Las Vegas due to their thin walls.

This is a really nice resort.  Opulent without being overwhelming.  Nice decor, service and amenities.  The room was large and well maintained.  The pool area was very relaxing.  Didn't have much luck at the craps table unfortunately :(
What fun, be sure to check out the cars!! I enjoyed dinner here but ironically the Bellagio is much better:) Still a ton of fun :)
AMAZING place where dreams come true. Steve Wynn you WOWED me!

Its the most beautiful hotel I've ever been in, but you really gotta be a millionaire here. I was dying for a shnakey vodka redbull , but felt very working class, so ended up ordering a champagne mojito or some shite like that. I also tried to pretend I knew a thing or two about whiskey, but 7 grand a bottle really put me in my place. I think I'll just stick to the cheap shit they sell in the wallgreens next door.

Awsome!!!!

I stayed here last week for a conference and what a sweet hotel.  I was on the 55th floor with a great view of the strip.  Flat screen TVs in the living room and in the bathroom!!!!  

Everything was first class...from the morning maid service to the evening bed turn down.

The bars are great and the gambling area is sweet.  

A must.....take the time to have a few drinks by the waterfall...the statues in the water are a trip.

I don't have anything to say about the hotel since I haven't stayed there yet, but I did try the buffet...  Yes, of all things at the Wynn, we ended up eating at their buffet.  Supposedly, they had an abundant amount of crab legs but we never found it.  

I'm not a big fan of buffets and even the Wynn's buffet didn't do anything to change my mind.  Yes, they serve a ton of food, but for the price you pay, it's not worth it.  There was nothing spectacular about  the food (it was neither terrible nor memorable)  and the service was atrocious!   

I should've learned my lesson a long time ago...  No buffets!  Anywhere.  Not even Vegas.  Not even at the Wynn.  Period.

I have mixed feelings about this hotel.  

On one hand it has some of the best rooms in Vegas on the other, the customer service is very hit and miss.  

The hotel is very clean and elegant. Steve spared no expense when he put his name on this venture.  

We ordered room service the day after my husband decided to go a little nuts because he was feeling a little groggy and eggs and pancakes and coffee and diet coke was $75!  OUCH.

The European pool was beautiful, but the "bubbies" that showed themselves ranged from good plastic surgeons to something out of national geographic.  At around 2pm when people have gotten all nice and drunk you see some pretty interesting things happening at the pool.  I saw everything from guys making out with other guys to girls making out with other girls to swapping.  

There are pool cabana's that you can rent and the pool beds start at about $500 for the day.  But, you can negotiate the price...

EJ was our "pool boy" and the word "no" never left his lips.  I love that.  

The front desk wasn't the most helpful and they seemed annoyed if you have a question.  We had some pretty rowdy neighbors (the walls are very thin) and everynight after the clubs would close, they would bring their party back to their room.  I could hear all about who the boys made out with, who rejected them, blah blah blah.  They must not have done that well because up until last night, I never heard girls in their room!  We called security after the third night of being woken up at 3am until they finally fell asleep at around 6.  And they seemed upset that we called security to ask them to send someone up.  It was the statement of "what do you want us to do about it" that kinda sent me over the edge.  Look, don't mess with my sleep!

The concierge was awesome.  She made reservations at Le Reve for us--which if you get a chance go see it, it's spectacular--and made all our dinner reservations with a smile on her face.  Loved it.  

I think if they could get their staff all trained to be helpful and to really make the guest feel wanted, this would be a five star experience instead of hit and miss.

Better than Bellagio.  Yep, I said it.

Super comfortable bed.  Spacious room.  Awesome tub and freestanding shower.  Excellent restaurants and great service.  Best casino and poker room on the strip.  And way fewer drunken fratboys than most other Vegas hotels.

My favorite part, though, is the pool.  It's gorgeous and relaxing and the drink service is quick.  Bring your own suntan lotion though.  I forgot mine and had the privilege of paying $32 for a small tube at the cabana.  Say what?  My husband was so incensed that he actually went through the casino looking for some but there was none cheaper.  You sneaky bastards!

But anyway, this resort rules.  Five stars.  It doesn't get better than this!

I love Wynn and Encore hotel. Have been staying here since they opened Wynn about 10-11 years ago and every and single time we stay here it feels like they just opened. I don't think there is even one negative thing about this hotel. 
The only thing I don't like that they started to charge for the parking.

Hands down my favorite in LV.  You could easily stay right here & not have to go onto strip (however StripBurger x street is worth checking out ... Not to mention there is skywalk). SW steakhouse, parasol up\/down, XS, encore everything all right there. Great shows as well - Gbrooks, RÃ©ve ... Deals can be had here - find them & do yourself a favor & stay here at least one time.

So bummed.

I mean, really.   What is supposed to be so damn great about this place?   The room was nice.  The minibar charges you if you REMOVE AN ITEM.  not eat it.  TOUCH IT.  

The TV was a Gateway.  I'm sorry, WHAT?  With a broken remote.  Did i mention that we were in the Tower Suites?  The fancy side with its own entrance?  Grrrrrr.

The bathroom, though, was fun.  They had good big sized products to play with.  And a separate tub and shower.  And another (gateway) tv.I threw myself into the bathtub and dumped in their tub tea and sat there for 10 whole minutes -until i was bored. Then i got out.  

Ok, so i know that in vegas i was supposed to go shake it around, drink stuff, run around cracked out all night... but i was there with my boyfriend, who was there on business.  So he had to go biz it up while i had to wait around for him to be done.  I didn't HAVE to, but MAN is it boring to sit at a slot machine alone.  no matter how many red bull vodkas you inhale.  oh, and we had stay classy enough to make it to have dinner  (thank god at 6 o'clock) with 60 people and ooh and ahh over their grandchildren's photos...   So, you understand why i was in the room instead of vegas'ing it up...  

Anyhoo, when i DID make it to the floor or the bar or the restaurant or whatever- it was good.  the bartenders and staff were pretty friendly, but in a 'there are a lot of cameras in here so smile' kind of way.

The place has everything you'd expect from an exceptional, five star hotel. It's my favorite hotel in Vegas, and coming here you never even have to leave since it has the best club (XS) and food. So I'm going to tell you about some off beat kind of stuff: 

-Even from the 32nd floor, you can hear some bumping from the clubs at night, past 3am. I feel sorry for those on the low floors. By the way, 32nd isn't even considered high in this pseudo skyscraper 

-Exceptional maid service! I don't mean to sound like an elitist, but really! They tell you her name, she cleans up everything and puts things away, but in a really non invasive way. Everything in the bathroom was arranged neatly, and no evidence of any pre club boozing in the room the night before. Seriously, this is a real maid.

Steve Wynn expresses his sophistication and worldly understanding of hospitality in this superb hotel. The Tower Suites are magnificent-- we elected to accept the offer of a 1200sf suite for $150 over the rate we reserved, and the service and amenities have been fantastic, (with the exception of FAR TOO FEW stressed cocktail\/food servers at the pools.... (Cabana Gal, Denise, did everything she could to help tho we didn't have a cabana!) We are wYnning and loving it!

BEST HOTEL IN VEGAS!!!!!!!!! I just stayed there over the weekend and I have nothing bad to say about them. They are very expensive, but if you have the money, you will enjoy spending it here! 

Rooms were so clean and had everything you can want! Location was right across from fashion show mall. It was a bit far from the center of the strip, but honestly between the wynn and the mall there is everything you need in vegas- TRYST nightclub in the wynn was such a blast and guests to have to stand in the long line so that was a plus!

I love this hotel

Beautiful and off the path from the grungy part of the strip yet close enough you can walk

The use of flowers in the lobby is spectacular

The rooms are very nicely decorated, comfy and a great mattress with superb linens

The bathroom is also huge and well thought out 


They have a great gym and the restaurants are all really good although pricey 

The only complaint is the casino which is why I prefer the Encore to the Wynn when I can get the right rate

Either way they are both great hotels. To me amongst the best in Vegas

Woah! I was there in November and I felt so fancy!!! The room was beautiful with the view of the strip. I had a TV in the bathroom so I could take a bath and catch up on current events. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. The event halls were clean and lovely. I'd love to come back.

What a shiny building. You'd swear the Wynn Las Vegas was dipped in bronze (or gold) by the look of it. The inside is similarly grand; a luxurious sprawling layout, as extravagant as anything else on the strip.

Calling it a hotel would be a bit of a misnomer. It's a full-blown resort, with an enormous pool (thumbs way up) and spa, about a dozen restaurants, live shows, a golf course and about a bajillion shops. If you wanted to, you could spend an entire trip to Vegas on their compound and be quite entertained. The rooms are spacious, clean, and futuristic. Just about everything was automated, and I appreciated the ability to turn off (or down) all the lights in the room with the push of a button. And those beds are comfy, son.

Now, for a five-star joint things weren't exactly flawless. Even an hour and a half after check-in our rooms were not ready for us -- though kicking up a mild fuss resolved the issue. I also wasn't a fan of the $80 "resort fee" tacked on to our bill as we checked out. Shouldn't this be included in our quoted rate? But with what we paid for the room via Priceline, it's hard to complain too much.

I was impressed with the Wynn. I probably would not pay full price to stay here (nor could I afford it) but if you are getting a deal, I'd go for it.

Obligatory Title Pun: For The WYNN.

Menu Readability: Let's talk about the tile mosaic inlays on the floor instead. Wooee!

Need to mention: If you hate your money there are like a million ways to spend it here. $10,000 cocktail at Club XS would be one of them.

What this place teaches me about myself: I love pushing buttons. Oh, and phoning people from the bathroom.

I would give it a 5 but I don't really like the food selection here so it gets a 4.

I like the Wynn because I'm not a gambler but they comped me rooms couple of times. How I got comped rooms I have no idea but keep the free rooms coming. 

The rooms are nice and plush. I like it better than the Bellagio. I mean don't get me wrong. The Wynn looks like it was built with all of Bellagio's left overs but I guess I'm partial to them because of the comped nights.

If you do stay here, expect to eat outside of the hotel. IMO the restaurants here suck. It's pricey but the taste is mediocre at the most.

It is one of those places you just feel plain silly reviewing. 

Everything was perfect. When you pay for perfection - you get it! 

Best pool experience I've ever had (the asian chicken salad is great too)! Parasol bar is the perfect place to meet with folks, and the deli is fine for an affordable meal.

TOP VEGAS HOTELS: WYNN, ENCORE, VENETIAN. 

If you're a college student on a budget - and don't want to stay in a dingy, disgusting hotel - but want to fit a bunch of friends in one room, here's your best bet: 

1. Venetian - HUGE and spacious suites. Spacious with one or two beds, plus another room with a pull-out bed. Add some air-mattresses, and it's awesome. Biggest suites, so i'd stay here over Wynn and Encore if you're in a big group. 

2. Encore - BIG and spacious, but not as big as Venetian. 

3. Wynn - Love it here if i'm with family (AKA we fit comfortably) but if you're with college students it's a bit cramped. However, i've fit 9 people in one room here before...but we were quite cramped. In general, I love the Wynn because it's classy, clean and gorgeous.

And that's all you need to know.

Total sausagefest last night lol Which, if I wasn't a girl, I would probably be disappointed, but me & my girl-friend liked not having to deal with girls staring down girls all night haha Classy-dressed people in one big space. Drinks are expensive, but duh, that's the strip. Three drinks for around $60 or so? Not sure, we were pretty drunk. Maybe because it was belvedere, Malibu rum, and Jameson. Hm. Haha oh and!, I also was betting $2 on Keno and I won $3200! Good fun winning money, being dressed up with other pretty people, and shouting at fellow neighbors or walk-byers.

Definitely one of the nicer, classier hotels in Vegas. Connected to Encore, we had a lot of space to roam. Great restaurants to choose from. Our room was decent with a good view of the mountains. Housekeeping didn't come even after requested. I had to hunt someone down for fresh towels. Even when they came the next day the bed was made and we had new towels but the trash was still in the room and the ironing board wasn't put away. Poor service.

Wynn is one of the few truly unique luxury hotels. There really isn't anything else quite like it (except Encore next door, but that's a separate review). The lobby is beautiful and spacious, the casino is large and clean, and the rooms are immaculate. I like the way the hallways curve to follow the contours of the building. 

I know that last part doesn't help you much but I just wanted to add it here. 

From check in to check out, everyone with whom we came into contact was cheery, upbeat, and always extended nice greetings. 

A couple of financial matters bugged me just a little. There is a $25 daily resort fee. This basically gives you the use of their gym. And there is a $150 security deposit PER DAY! I was surprised by this. My three night stay amounted to $450 in security deposits. Of course, I got it back after checking out. But I think that's a bit steep. 

But the rooms are quite nice, even the basic ones. Ours was the basic and had incredible views of the strip, a comfortable leather white couch, and a TV in the bathroom. Gotta love that. 

We booked straight through the Wynn and saw La Reve in the Wynn Theater. This show is amazing and a must see. You'll never look at the water the same again. Also, after seeing La Reve, you'll look at the carpeting in the room hallways a little differently. You'll see a connection. Just trust me on this.

So I would definitely come back, just be aware of those fees and you'll be fine. And quite honestly for the experience, it's all worth it.

I feel like a little kid in a candy store.

The interior design of the hotel was very whimsical but elegant at the same time. I was amaze of the floral displays (are the flowers real?!) and plus there are plenty of high end stores like CHANEL, Dior, Louis Vuitton Ferrari (will anyone actually buy a Ferrari?) and many more. Their buffet  its actually called THE BUFFET is delicious and worth the price because you get what you are paying for. The freshness, quality & variety you wont get from other buffets especially the overrated Belligio. 

Even though Wynn is located almost end of the strip, take a walk and check out  for yourself. :)

The place has it all and does it all. 

There are lights, machines, tables, COUNTLESS SHOPPING, and decorations are really NICE! I have come here every time that I have come to VEGAS. I never win at any of the machines or tables but I always have a good time here. 

The smoking can be a bit overbearing but if you don't mind the light mist of smoke then you will be fine. 

Oh, getting around this hotel is fairly easy as well. There are a lot of signs which makes it easy to trace your steps or move on to the next area of the hotel. 

They do have some really nice jewelry stores but the OF COURSE they are EXPENSIVE!!! 

I was going to possibly get a watch but when I saw the price I just turned and WALKED OUT! My only way of buying anything here at this hotel would only be if I hit it BIG at this HOTEL!

There is definitely a lot to see and do here. Go the the event ticket window and catch a show. I have heard that they are fairly good here, though I have never seen one here!!! 

Great place to come when walking down the strip. Plus, I think the air conditioning here is a lot cooler than some of the other hotels.
Amazing Property, Accomodations and Service. Everything is top rate - from food to lodging. Would highly suggest.

Hotel is beautiful and the rooms are nice. It gets 2 stars for the following:

I was walking through the new room and I stepped on a nail sticking up out of the carpet. It punctured my foot, but luckily reflexes prevented me from turning the puncture into a nice big cut. I was annoyed given that this never should have happened. I first tried to pull out the nail, but it was really stuck under the carpet. I called the front desk and told them what had happened. They sent someone up with tools to remove it. They fixed it and the front desk called again to verify. I have never been one to complain, but I was very surprised when the hotel didn't even offer so much as a bottle of water for the incident. They really didn't even care that negligence from their builders caused a guest to get hurt. Mind you again that it was not serious luckily, however, I was very disappointed in how it was handled. I shouldn't have to worry about something like that when paying for room at a 4 or 5 star hotel. If it were my hotel I would at least send up a bottle of champagne or comp'd something... Perhaps I should have been one of those bitchy people that always seem to be complaining about something at the front desk. They always seem to get what they want. lol

Other than that, had a good time. Oh, also, they are VERY strict about not bringing up your own alcohol or food to the rooms. There are guards on 24x7 standby to ensure you do not sneak anything up that hasn't been purchased through room service. They try and make it out to say they're protecting their guests from strangers wandering the halls. A $30 bottle of Glenlivit 12 yr Scotch is $144 on their room service list. Pretty pricey hotel! It was $50 for two cheeseburgers. 

Decor was great. Would like some of it for my house.

If you asked me in 2011, I would have given the Wynn 12 stars, easily. My experience there at that time gave me an entire new perspective on Vegas. I will never forget one detail, and I can't begin to describe my trip. In a word, impeccable.

So fast forward to the week of 3\/7\/13, my husbands birthday, and it was the total opposite. Starting with the room. There was a major electrical wiring issue in the panoramic suite we were assigned to, and so we were moved (thankfully we hadn't unpacked yet!). Instead of a comparable room, or even an upgrade to a suite for the inconvenience, we were changed to a standard room with a mattress that was YEARS past replacing. Absolutely no support, and it felt so worn out! Our sleep that night (and every night that followed) was restless, fitful, and exhausting. We spent our entire weekend at the resort. I went to the salon and the spa, my husband played a round of golf, and every meal was at one of their restaurants. At SW, we were informed that our reservation was made for the NEXT night, not the one we requested, and the host managed to scrounge up a table at a HORRIBLE spot for us. Instead of apologizing for the mix-up or trying to fix the situation, he made a joke about my husband's age and told us to "enjoy". The meal was fantastic, but we were squished in the middle of two other couples (one of which I'm almost POSITIVE was an escort date), and the other who fought the entire time. The seating is weird. There's a long bench with three small tables on the other side. Not private, not romantic, and certainly not worth a $400 meal. The steak  was fantastic! Too bad we will never be back! The casino bartenders were great, we were never thirsty. My salon\/spa experience were great! The only thing that saved the trip from being a complete disaster was the golf. Sure, it was pricey, but it was the first time we actually felt like "guests". Everyone was wonderful, the course was beautiful, and we had an amazing afternoon. The last straw was out last evening, Saturday. The serial nights of not-sleeping were REALLY dragging on our patience, and the exhaustion was so bad that we considered sleeping on the floor, desperate for some rest. The noise from the clubs (we were on the 58th floor) didn't help either. So, at 2am on Sunday, we'd had enough. It was time to go home.
At check-out, we expressed our dissatisfaction and disappointment, given the fact that we utilized nearly every amenity available, and would still rate our overall experience as terrible. The clerk, never made eye contact, and his auto-response of "yes sir", became annoying as it became clear that he was used to this, and we were getting nowhere. He took $100 off of our dinner bill, but nothing more. So, at 230am, we packed up the car and drove away. We were saddened, disappointed, and left, pretty sure we would never be back.
The WORST part of this? I sent a detailed email to the website, under the section for guest comments, nearly a week ago. Although I received an auto-reply that my email would be addressed, I have yet to hear one word from the Wynn. 
It is a gorgeous resort, no doubt about that. And perhaps we'd had a series of disappointing events, unreflective of the typical stay. I know my first experience was amazing. So, keep an open mind, but be prepared, just in case!

Wynn - You win again!

I'm Steve Wynn and this is my hotel- the only one I've ever signed my name to. The new Wynn hotel is definitely the epitome of luxury and style, the only 5 Star and 5 Diamond Rated Casino resort on earth.
The minute you enter this classy hotel you feel as if in a different world, as entering a fairytale. Originally named La Reve (the dream), named after one of Steve Wynn's favorite Picassos. Steve's last name though was the perfect match for a winning hotel in Las Vegas, or was it the allure that somebody staying at this hotel might win? One thing is for sure this Las Vegas Hotel Casino definitely aims to out-Vegas the most luxurious hotels on the strip. Perfect is also its location, next to the Venetian hotel resort casino and to any fashionista's enjoyment right across the Las Vegas strip from the Las Vegas Fashion Show Mall.
The rooms are nothing short of stunning, and fitted out to the highest standards. What sets them apart from any other Vegas hotel though are its size, they are particularly large. Big Warhol-like paintings bring style to the room. The whole ambiance reminded me straight out of an Alice and Wonderland movie. The rooms are painted in a dark color and fitted with over-sized beds and tables. The bathrooms are huge and stunning and come with own flat-screen TV. Nothing beats though the view, fantastic floor-to-ceiling views that seem never-ending, you literally feel as if you have Vegas at your footsteps I need an ENCORE!

www.glamtravelandfashion.com

There is a reason its a 5 star.  Pure Opulence & attention to detail.  I have stayed there about 3-5 times when I've been in Vegas.  From the moment you walk through the front doors you know its like no other.  Steve Wynn sparred no expense on this property.  I absolutely love the tile flooring throughout the hotel. Everyone always friendly and helpful, great customer service.  Yes, its not cheap but if price is your major concern then try a less expensive property.  
Get your red card for sure and play the less expensive slots.  I've received emails with specials they are having for the up coming months and you can sometimes get a great deals on a room.

We stay here whenever we're in Vegas beautiful hotel beautiful rooms beautiful view on any side like all casinos set up can be a bit confusing until you get used to it but they have great restaurants and great shows on the front just people are always beautiful physically and in their service

I really love this hotel but unfortunately this time I have to write a bad review. I was looking forward to a relaxing bath in the tub but I came to discover it was poorly cleaned and there were public hairs in it! Disgusting! It's such a shame because I have stayed here many times and love the rooms, restaurants and casino, but this is not possible in a hotel like this. Also the towels had a few hairs as well! Such a shame!

I've had 1 return call from the manager and have yet to speak with anyone after calling back multiple times. I'm not sure why there's this much lack of customer service. 

We stayed here this past weekend and paid over $450 each night for 3 rooms for multiple nights. One of our rooms was located under the club and when we realized it we asked if we could change rooms and they denied us and offered us ear plugs as compensation we called around 11, 2am and 3am. They dismissed our issues and we got no sleep and I brought it up again and they dismissed the issue. We stay at the Wynn multiple times a year with a group friends. On our last day the manager offered to allow us to check out late as compensation. I was shocked at how poorly we were treated and the manager said "well it was your choice to stay here". I can not believe that they felt it was ok to treat people like this. They did not even say sorry for the inconvenience. They just didn't care. It's a sad sad thing but bad customer service can ruin a business so I hope they shape up quick.

It's so beeeeyooootiful! I loved it here (and I really, really liked the sheer lotus curtains in our room) and loved how it was close enough to xs to just walk indoors there, but far away enough so you didn't have to hear all the noise if you didn't want to.

High five and low ten to the Wynn empire. These ballers know how to roll. The decor is a little oddball, but I guess that's the style there were going for. Oddball or not, everything feels glamorous and expensive. The room I stayed in was on the 57 floor; in the corner; AWESOME! So comfortable and roomy, I wish i could live there (or go back this weekend!). XS is by far my favorite club -the crowd is hip and the DJ is bumpin! 
Service is great, staff are friendly. There is really no where I can complain about anything. I drank like a fish and didn't even get a hangover; and I thank the Wynn for that little extra bit of magic. 
Worth mentioning, the water pressure is so amazing. It wasn't very water-wise, but I took showers just to be blasted in the most heavenly spray from shower heaver. Now that I have experienced it, I will definitely stay here every time I come to Vegas. It is pricey, but worth every shiny penny for memories that you don't remember having!

Spacious and nicely decorated room with the exception of some rather odd artwork selections that just didn't seem to fit with the room colors.  Bed was comfortable and view -- even from the 8th floor -- was nice.  The bathroom was very nice, with a great tub for lounging and lots of room.  The floor-to-ceiling, wall-to-wall window was quite dirty on the outside.  Made the world look pretty dingy despite the fact it was a beautiful day outside.  I understand the hotel wants to make money, but the absence of a coffee maker was noteworthy.  We had to walk across the street to find a Starbucks in order to get a decent cup of coffee in the mornings.  Construction of a new facility between the Wynn and the Encore was going on all night.  We were awakened before 5 am by the sound of concrete being sawed.  This went on for about a half hour.  Earlier, we had been awakened -- around 3 am -- by loud conversation either in the hall or next door.  Not at all as quiet as I would have expected.  Also, the location is not all that great.  We had to walk past hundreds of guys and a few women aggressively handing out cards with pictures of scantily clad women offering escort services.  These cards littered Las Vegas Avenue, although someone cleaned the sidewalks during the night.  It is a nice hotel, but we were disappointed, and doubt we would return.

The Wynn is still my favorite hotel in Vegas. That is saying something because they build something newer and better every year. When it comes to "Class" ... in Vegas... there really is no such thing, but The Wynn comes as close to it as you can get while still staying VEGAS at heart.

Everywhere you look there are amazing pieces of art and the decor is just lush upon lush.

The rooms however are very subtle by comparison to the deep reds and bright purples you see in the casino and bars...  they are very well thought out... with one wall that is completely windows in pretty much every room. I love that and you really don't have a bad view... either you are looking at the golf course and the pool or the strip...  so you can't go wrong.

Speaking of the pool. It's great. There are two large dipping pools connected by a long canal that you can walk through from one end to the other. I really loved drinking a pina colada and walking down the canal in the cool water...  my friend and i walked up and down in the pool and talked and people watched and tanned...

The pool side food is lacking though.. the only thing they need to improve at The Wynn.

Make sure you hit The Buffet here one morning too. Not kidding. It's not your cheesy vegas buffet. You won't regret it.

I stayed at the Wynn a few weeks ago, and oh my lanta, what a lovely hotel and casino. 
  The interior of the whole hotel and casino is gorgeous. I've always come to the Wynn for XS and Surrender, but this was my first time staying here. I am now incredibly spoiled. 
    My room was on the 30something floor, and had a fantastic view of the strip.
   A lot of the hotels I've stayed at in Vegas have had great rooms, beautiful interior decorating, but nothing quite like the Wynn. 
    I really have nothing more to say about this place, it was just great. You want to treat yourself next time you're in Vegas, stay here.
I stayed at the second private tower and it was really nice. The private pool and cabanas felt a world away from the strip.

Let me start off by saying I've stayed at the Wynn before and have had nothing but good times and great service. 

Unfortunately, that was the past and this is now. I reserved a room with a king size bed and was told upon check-in that I had been upgraded. Great! When I got to the new room it had two beds instead of my originally reserved king bed. I immediately called the front desk and asked to be moved to my original room with a king bed, whereupon they notified me that there were a couple by the elevator on the same floor but also one above me on the 56th floor away from the elevators. My keys would be transferred over so there was no need to come back to the front desk and off I went.

This is where it gets interesting; and utterly unacceptable. As my keys didn't work for the new room, I called down again from a room across the hall that was being cleaned. This time the front desk notified me that when you make a reservation IT'S MERELY A REQUEST AND NOT A RESERVATION. Huh?? Furthermore, there was not one room in the hotel with a king bed that was available. I could just go back to my "upgraded" room - which is far as I could tell looked like any other room - or take nothing. Speaking to a supervisor changed nothing. How could anyone believe this explanation??

Needless to say, I won't be staying here again

At LAST! My love has come around. My lonely days are over. And life is like a song!" I finally got to stay at the Wynn! Before staying here, I have read 99% of the reviews and most of them talk about how the lobby is beautiful. If you are ever planning to be a guest and not just walk around, READ MY REVIEW :). I had to shorten my review because of the MAX Char.

Steve Wynn.. THANK YOU! You're hotel is exactly what I would have imagined a Las Vegas hotel should be. I wish that I could personally shake your hand. 

If you are in college on a low budget and need to cram 10 or more people in to a room, please skip this review. You may want to try Venetian or Palms maybe.
