Though it's a bit north of the main action on the strip, we didn't find this to be too inconvenient, and the close proximity to the Fashion Mall was handy (for the cheap food court, booze at ABC stores, and clothing, etc.) Were it my first time in Vegas, I might opt for something more central.

Check-in was a bit of a hassle, with one agent telling us we'd have to wait a couple of hours (it was well past check-in time) for our rooms to be ready. We were suspicious, and approached another agent, which resulted in us securing our rooms right away. Not a good first impression. Check-out wasn't much better, with long waits, and that friggin' $20 per night resort fee being tacked on despite any prior notice.

Having said that, the resort fee (which we were led to believe was included), would have been more than worth it, as it nets you: (1) wi-fi access in your room, (2) gym access, and (3) pool access (eh, this may be included in the price of the room) 

The gym has everything you need, and plenty of treadmills. Free fruit was all I needed for a light breakfast, and I liked having personal-use headphones available.

The pool was gorgeous, and we were grateful for the 21-and-over section to escape from the little brats. Lounge chairs were plentiful and inviting. While cocktails were pricey at $14 (for one hell of a mojito), a very limited beer selection is a bit more reasonable option.

The casino itself (and like all Vegas hotels, you have to parade through a fair portion of the casino to reach the hotel elevators) is pretty nice and clean, with more respectable clientele than other hotels I've experienced.

Finally, the room itself was glorious - lots of space, comfortable beds, and a huge washroom. The great floor-to-ceiling windows and fancy drape technology were a big hit.

It being a bachelor party, we opted to pay a bit more for the Wynn; I think I've gone and spoiled myself for any future Vegas trips. I would certainly stay here again.

Everyone should be warned......Absolutely  everything at the Wynn is triple the cost of every other hotel in Vegas. The worst part about being charged so much for every little thing is the service and amenities do not at all justify the huge price tag. It's like Mr. Wynn built this massive hotel and your going to pay a premium for just stepping into it . There are lots of gorgeous hotels in Vegas that have amazing service, don't waste your money at the Wynn. To give you a idea the resort fees for internet access are normally an extra $20 a day, at the Wynn its $20 per day per device for the low end internet access. Also a very basic continental breakfast with coffee one small cup of juice and a muffin will cost you $60, oh yeah and they brought tap water. The rooms are ok but dated, the tv in the bathroom doesn't have a clear picture and looks like it's from the 90's, drapes did not work nor did half the lights.  We have stayed at nicer hotels for $75 a night with much better service. The Wynn says they cater to high end clientele, most people are "high end" because they manage their money wisely, and the Wynn is not a wise value at all.  We will never ever stay here again. There are many better choices in Vegas to have a very enjoyable stay.

Having previously stayed at the Encore, the Wynn is a slight downgrade. 

Our view of the strip was lovely.

The bed, linens, pillows -- all were extremely comfortable.

The bathroom shower smelled a little like mildew, and one of my towels had a strange, almost salty, smell that was awful. I tried asking one of the girls with the cart for another one. She didn't speak English, and she finally said she didn't have another towel and to call down for one. I decided I didn't need another towel.

After our stay, I'm now reading that the $25 resort fee gives you access to the gym and wireless internet. If that's true, that sucks, because we didn't know that during our stay. We would have used the gym, and when I tried connecting to the wifi from the room, I was asked to pay $15 for it. If it's included in the room, why ask me to pay? I couldn't use my iPad because of it. Very disappointing.

The lighting on the outside of the building causes a strong reflection of yourself on the glass, making photos and clear strip viewing at night difficult if not impossible.

The LV marathon was taking place during our stay, unbeknownst to us. When we called the front desk asking for suggestions on where to park our car, etc., they were lost and had to put us on hold to ask for help multiple times. In the end, they had no answer. I would have liked a better solution than "I don't know."

Although the hotel is overall lovely, it's also at the end of the strip, and it's difficult to reach other resorts and activities without a car or a cab.

This is an expensive hotel, and I would expect the linens and shower to smell nice (and not bad in any respect), more informed staff, and access to the gym and wifi (and if there is access, notification that such is available).

THE best hotel on the strip.

The Wynn is beautiful from the front desk to the view from the room. The service was great! My boyfriend and I booked for a panoramic view room with 2 double beds for us and his friends. However, when we checked in, the receptionist said our room only had a king sized bed and that it was their mistake and quickly made sure they send out an extra bed for us to the room. Another problem we ran into was our air conditioning. It was so hot in the room! I complained and the front desk quickly sent someone up to our room to fix it. The staffs were extremely helpful and friendly. Service was amazing. Did I forget to mention the bathroom? It  was BIG (even for a standard sized room)! Very nicely decorated with every bathroom amenities I could ever need! 

Another thing I loved about the Wynn was that it is connected to Encore which made it extremely easy to go clubbing at XS and Surrender. Saved so much taxi $$!!!

I would honestly LOVE to stay at the Wynn again. Or maybe even Encore!

By far the classiest casino in Vegas.   The ambiance, music, table games and restaurants are great. 

They also offer some great shopping.  

We played blackjack and had a good time. When I was done playing Blackjack I went and played Roulette.  My wife and I don't play roulette very often but there was dealer named Jeff in the daytime on Roulette who walked us through the game and gave us a lot of info about the restaurants and the surroundings of the casino.

I stayed here with my sister and some friends.  It's one of the nicest hotels in Vegas.  We had 2 rooms with a connecting door, and 2 roll out beds.  The rooms were pretty quiet, spacious, and cold due to the blasting of the A\/C.  The setup of the hotel\/casino is great; it's huge.  You can walk or sit around and people watch.  The crowd is diverse.  We even had some people coming up to us asking questions, promoting, or hollering.  Lastly, if you want to use the internet or gym, of course, you must pay for usage, duh.

The pool area was nice.  Too bad no real pool party was going on.  My friends and I were too tired to head out to the other pool parties.  Hopefully we can make one next time...

Gorgeous!  Love it!  Will return!

Had an amazingly romantic time with my bf.  Room was top quality, service was excellent, and the property is so luxurious.  I didn't get a chance to do the spa thing like I normally would ( I was *ahem* busy!) but I plan to return soon to check out more that the property has to offer.

The only thing I didn't like.....no video black jack at the bar!  That's the one thing I like to do, gambling-wise.  If this is not important to you, then you will think it deserves 5 stars!

Highly recommended hotel! Stayed in a resort room with floor to ceiling windows with great views! Drapes that open and close at the push of a button... flat screen TV mounted to the wall... bathrooms you could have parties in... didn't ever want to leave the room actually!

Loved the vibrant colors throughout the hotel, the modern elegance, the attention to detail which was evident everywhere. In comparison to other hotels (Bellagio, Paris, Venetian, MGM, Stratosphere are the places I've stayed), this one is the best. Now, with Encore opening up, I'm curious to see how it compares.
Love this hotel. My first time stay was an amazing experience!! Would come back for sure :)
We always stay at the Wynn, the hotel rooms are modern unlike the Venetian and all the ppl that work at the Wynn\/Encore are awesome!  Prices are low considering the room and the overall experience.

WHAT KIND OF HOTEL LOCKS THEIR GUESTS OUT DURING A SHOOTING?! We have a room card and ID and offered to be searched as well. We came from the garage. It's not like we came from outside. Protocol or not. We deserve to be safe too.

This is a beautiful hotel\/casino.  It has some fun places to eat. I enjoy coming over to this casino and walking around. We were looking for a Mexican restaurant, but we were told that Mr Wynn doesn't like Mexican food and was directed to The Cave.  The review for that will be coming separately. They have quite a few high end shops. I do think it is very pretty inside this place. The slots and food tend to be more pricey.

Disappointing; overly crowded and pedestrian despite nice setting. When we came, lines for checkin and taxis were endless. Baggage service took nearly an hour. Pool was closed for maintenance with no head's up or warning from staff. By 230 pm room was still unmade, but a bottle of water from the minibar had been replaced. WiFi even for guests is $15.99\/day. Gym not free for guests either, with its own charges. Valet was attitude-y. During the night pipes creaked and groaned and thin walls left us hearing music and talking in other rooms. Would not return here.

This hotel is gorgeous. I espeically love seeing their garden area. I also like their buffet and they have a couple decent clubs as well. The only thing I don't like is the location which I find a bit inconvenient. I'd go more often if it were more towards the middle of the strip.

Hotel - My husband and I both enjoy staying here.  It's clean and the air here is much fresher than at other casinos\/hotels on the strip.  The rooms are lovely and the panoramic view we had of the strip was spectacular.  I enjoyed having a good soak in the deep tub they had and the robes they provided were great.  We are looking forward to either staying there again on our next trip or their sister hotel the Encore.  

Casino - the slots were a lot tighter then they were on our prior trip but the table games were still fun with plenty of other players.  

Buffet - It's one of our favorites, with a great selection and atmosphere. 

Cafe - There's a little "cafe" near the guest elevators that's open 24 hrs with food and drinks you can order if you're looking for a quick meal or snack.  The food isn't very good considering the cost but I really did enjoy my frozen caramel drink with the extra shot of espresso.

Parking - FREE.  I love that they aren't trying to charge their guests for parking like so many of the other casinos on the strip.  We love knowing that the Wynn & Encore have refused to follow suit with the likes of M-Life casinos and others who have put greed above their guest by trying to squeeze out a few extra bucks.  One of my main reasons for coming to Vegas is to get my gamble on.  I budget for my losses and know that lady luck isn't always on my side so if I'm not winning it's not great but having to pay for parking on the way out feels like rubbing salt in the wound.

This is the worst hotel on the strip.  It's overpriced.  The food is average at best.   The service is awful!  They make you walk to the back of the property to get uber and won't let uber wait for you.  I'll never stay here again !

My favorite hotel in Las Vegas if not the world! If i could give it 10 stars, I would. Once you stay here once you'll see why it's a top rated hotel & if you're smart, you won't stay elsewhere again. 

The resort is classy & luxurious without being pretentious.  All the staff are friendly & beyond accommodating.  You can literally press a button & get anything you want delivered to you within about 15 minutes. 

I love the personalization they do with having my name on the TV screen & being greeted properly when I call the concierge or anywhere in the hotel. 

The beds are out of this world comfortable and the rooms are impeccably decorated & spacious. 

The specialty drinks are the best on the strip, the dining options are fantastic & the clubs continue to remain supreme! (XS is my favorite tho)

No trip to Vegas is complete without a visit to the spa for me & the one here does not disappoint. The downside is the price is definitely steep.

I would legitimately live here if I could!

While I found this hotel very nice I have a caution about the rooms on the hold course side. You can hear the nightclub until 4 am even on the 32nd floor. If you are bothered by noise ask for room on the street side of the hotel.

I don't often review but when I do its for very positive or negative experiences. My stay at the Wynn was fantastic. This review is for the hotel rooms, amenities, and staff.  Hotel rooms are by far the MOST quiet room I have ever stayed in on the strip, which is a good thing when you are up most of the night partying. The staff is responsive and accommodating. The pool is great and caters to the relaxing or party scene. Not the best hotel I've stayed in, but by far the best on the Vegas strip.

The Wynn is pretty but her sister hotel, Encore is way more beautiful from their rooms to their casinos and restaurants.  The Wynn needs to change their towels. They're no longer soft.

We have reservations to one of their fine dining restaurants one evening. I asked the concierge if she could help me get a waterside table for dinner.  She just said there is no guarantee and to just talk to the receptionist at the time we get to the restaurant to make a request.  She also said that it "will not help if i'm nice" to the receptionist. I thought that was a weird thing to say. In other words, the concierge was useless.  She did not even make an attempt to help me or make a call or something.

I will not go back to Wynn Hotel.

My favorite  hotel on the Vegas strip. Nice decor, great bar outside by the lake. Expensive, but hey if you just want to hang in an eloquent location with a lover or friends, this is the place.

I can not comment on hotel rooms, I live here.

Seriously.  I am unbelievably lucky, b\/c my friend was able to score us free rooms for two nights (though we paid for taxes) through American Express -- and we qualified for a free upgrade.  

Soft beds.
Huge room.
Everything was beautiful (I took photos of the wall to capture the textured coppery goodness :D, the fun yellow print of the armchair, the gorgeous bathroom --I'm a nut!).
The tv in the bathroom was tiny, and not well positioned for watching from the tub (hey, I have to find a negative somewhere!).  But man, that tub filled up crazy fast and was *so* fabulous for that reason :D
Gorgeous panoramic view (and it was, though overlooking Encore + other properties + then the beautiful mountains).

We stayed Wed through Fri, so  there were plenty of spots at the pool on Wednesday afternoon from 5p til 7p (pool closed at 7), and just starting to super fill up after we got there Fri morning about 11a.  The lap pool between the two round end pools was a serious work out for me :D, and not too many people clogging it up!  We just peeked around the corner at the European pool -- people were actually using it (and a businessman confessed to us in the elevator that his meetings were held in rooms overlooking that pool -- lucky him we said!), but no one was gawking or creepy (er, other than us, I guess :D)  Friendly pool-side service; we grabbed breakfast to go from the nearby cafe (Terrace Point or something) and that was easy.  Other than that, I liked how the chaises were arranged (not too cluttered), the gardens leading to the pool are beautiful (lots and lots of rose bushes and sculpted hedges leading you down to the pool), and there's nothing Vegas-cheesy at all in these pools.  Just straight up relaxation and chill.

Gambling isn't cheap poolside, but $15 tables seem pretty standard. Downstairs in the casino, everything's beautiful, and we loved the nickel 50-play video poker :D I sunk a bit into the video blackjack, but my friends scored pretty well :)

Because we were doing so well on budget, we noshed at the restaurants located in the Wynn -- reviews elsewhere, but overall, awesome food, too :)  Overall, it was *fabulous*.  I'm pretty darn cheap so I don't think I'll be re-creating this experience, but gosh darn, I'm glad I'm lucky :D

I have stayed at Encore and thoughts I'd try out Wynn.  Although it is very nice, I feel the level of service at Encore is better.  

If you can choose between the two, choose Encore!

Best breakfast buffet in the world.  The walk from the street to the buffet through the hotel is a wonderful change from the noisy strip.  The food is fresh and healthy.  It makes having to come to Vegas for work a welcome and fun part of my stay.

Room was pretty nice... nicer then most..  not as nice as the Venetian...  but still, quite nice...  View was awesome...  Casino hurt me (switch blackjack is NOT cool)...  This place is swanky!  Overall, very quality...

Would I come back?  If there is no Venetian, Yes, I would...

My favorite Vegas hotel for these reasons:
Service: We had a slight problem with our reservation but they were very patient. 
Rooms: very contemporary, clean,  spacious bathrooms and great views! The beds are extremely comfortable...
Restaurants: Tableau. Buffet. You'd never have to leave this place. 
Pools: VIP Tower pool...euro party pools...cabanas...so many choices! Also, Encore beach club is next door.
Shopping: If I had a few thousand to spend, this is the place to come.
Clubs: Tryst & XS are my favorite clubs :)

I stayed at Wynn for two nights and it is gorgeous, comfortable, and nice place, but I will not stay there again because I could not sleep until 4:00am since their night club XS were so loud even though I was at 35th floor.  
The concierge did not seem to care about my concern.  They said, yes some people complain about the nightclub noise and we are aware of it.  I don't think they care since they will make more money until 4am?
It's unfortunate because hotel is very beautiful.  I won't recommend this place  to others due to the reason I have mentioned above. 

.

Edwin at the front desk was accommodating, welcoming and efficient! He started us off with a smile and it continued to the end.
The ambiance was beautiful and lively. Colors abound at the Wynn. All decorations were well thought out and well placed!
The rooms were clean and the views were amazing! Only two small issues; the shower head was not one I'd expect here. And the cup in the bathroom had dried toothpaste in it.
The buffet is one of the best I've been to in Vegas. All food was delicious and flavorful! 
The lakeside lounge is one that you have to visit. Relax and enjoy a drink while watching the water show. You will not be disappointed.
Internet comes free with resort fee. 
I absolutely loved it here and will definitely return!  Thanks for a great time, Wynn!

Update: several days after we checked out the manager of the hotel offered to have us back at a discount but said he could not do anything further since we had already checked out.  I am not sure why I would pay more money to the Wynn to return.  Again, bad judgment on the part of management.  He had no explanation for the lack of hotel security either.  I don't think I will take him up on the offer.

The casino is nice looking. The COCKTAIL WAITRESS SERVICES ARE WAY BELOW STANDARD!!
Was gambling on Wednesday July 26, 2017 around 9:30am and I Had to ask two different men in suits carrying a a device that looks like a phone (managers maybe, Floor supervisors maybe) if a cocktail waitress could come n take my order.
Once the wAitress came it was ok.
It took them longer then any other casino.
On Friday July 28, 3017 around 1:20 am I was gambling and no waitress around again. I asked another man in a suit carrying the device for a cocktail wAitress, the man in the suit is named Joe. About 10 min later a waitress came by and took my order. Time passed on and on. I moved to another slot machine close by where I was at when I ordered, still my order of tomato juice has not arrived. Finally ... around 1:45 am my order arrived.
As I stated earlier if you like a clean elegant casino and not wanting any kind of beverage service then this is a good place. If you are looking to drop your money on gambling and plan on beverage service...... well your gambling on whether a server will be there to take your order.
I was not staying at the Wynn, instead I was staying at the Palazzo for 3 nights but decided to do a little gambling at the Wynn since I haven't done so in the past.
Whoever is in charge of the Cocktail Service Department really needs to review the operation.
People can play slots and tables anywhere. That's a dime a dozen in Vegas. I went to the Wynn under the impression that hospitality and service would be outstanding...I was disappointed.
I didn't expect to be waited on like a celebrity, but I didn't expect to not be waited on as if I was not there.

R De Leon

Great view..but come on....who wants to hear loud music and bass all night? Literally from starting at midnight to 5 am. Never again.  The manager did make it right though.  It is not kid friendly which is nice for adults, your not getting ran over by strollers and screaming kids. The main pool is small but nice and the bar will accommodate your drink choice.

We stayed here for free for some super fun book promoting stuff and LOOOOVED it! Tyra Banks and her man rode in the elevator baby-talking next to us. They have great veggie options and really good food in the hotel. The room was incredible -- there was a bedside panel to adjust lighting. The entire bathroom had a super sexy glow. We sat in the tub eating room service. Highly recommend this place for romance! We never wanted to leave the room.

Gorgeous casino, dÃ©cor scheme seems to be taken from the Bellagio gardens- good mix of stores, restaurants, and gaming. Really appreciate how spacious this casino is, lots of space to walk around without cramming slot machines into every available nook.

Service is typically very top notch, and restaurants on site are known for being able to accommodate any dietary restriction and have several vegan, vegetarian, and vegetable-laden options at each.

Parking garage is smaller than most but easily accessible, casino itself is on the smaller side but more intimate and upscale rather than crowded and gaudy.

Fancy and expensive resort with the most impersonal and rude service. Registration was a problem, Jarred the registration manager was like a bad joke, terrible at people service; getting drinks at the casino table was a problem, their policies are appropriate for a kindergarten. I have been in Vegas 100 times, first time and last time I stay at Wynn. They wish they were half as good as Bellagio or Palazzo. NOT WORTH the price to stay, definitely worth a visit as the hotel itself is beautiful.

Stayed in a suite on the 54th floor. Beautiful. Had plenty of room in the bathroom to get ready. The "office" with a sofa was spacious. The bed was comfortable, wish i had one of those. The maid knocked, then opened the door early in the morning. I asked her if she could leave and come back. XS was beautiful, and only a few minutes walk. Got to see one of my favorite DJs, the crowd was wild. Wish the pool was open it looked beautiful.

I did not stay here (stupid me) but I spent time in the casino and walking around the hotel. And I can tell you that hands down this place beats the Venetian in terms of atmosphere, environment and service. Here's why: 

The Wynn Casino was not smoky and disgusting like the Venetian. There lots of non-smoking tables and the place felt really clean and open and not cramped at all. Pleasant even. Plus, the dealers were all incredibly friendly and sweet, as were the pit bosses\/managers. I got over my fear of single deck black jack here and cleaned up, yo! 

Plus the cocktail waitresses actually came around and gave me drinks almost twice as much as I got when in the casino at The Venetian where the cocktail waitresses were never around and seemed only interested in men when they did come by.

It is a beautiful resort, with classy decor and relaxing music playing throughout, none of that cheesy pop music or rock they play at a lot of casinos at 7am when you just want to enjoy a glass of Merlot and feel like a high roller.

I always enjoy this hotel. Going out to the fountain and having a drink (even though its expensive $9 for a jack and coke is the mentality of someone out of their mind). Not to mention its gorgeous. Its one of the most upscale ones. The shops are for those 1% who can afford to spend $1000 on a bra. However, it doesn't make it any less beautiful to look at. I always recommend doing something here that involves being near the water. So go have a drink by the waterfall and relax, and at night it lights up and a frog pops up and sings for you. Its highly enjoyable. And for once I went on a Saturday night. I dont party, but if you do, there were so many lines to get into the club.

Just got here & OMG... the valet person, Keenan was so rude & discriminating.  He accused us of not having a disable person with us. You have no right to ask or accuse.  We had a retired veteran, who had cancer twice & one eye & valet person only wanted to give lip service. Valet said: I don't see him driving?! Really, they don't need to be driving.  Nice place, we enjoy coming here & we like the buffet, but I guess if you're not a guest you're treated differently.  We filed a complaint with hotel manager. He said he would handle this situation.

The best in vegas. Incredible food everywhere, with Vegan options at each of their restaurants, very friendly staff, and lots to see. No one does it like the Wynn. Not the least expensive on the strip- far from it really. However, I feel that the cost is exceeded by value

I've been to the Wynn twice now, its a great hotel to stay at, its very luxurious and has high finishes and touches throughout.  The rooms are probably some of the nicest on the entire strip, high finishes throughout, automatic drapes, stunning views of the strip or the golf course, tv's in the bathrooms, plush beds, the list could go on forever.  As far as the casino is concerned its top of the line, exquisite tables, beautiful decor throughout especially by the main lobby, the Wynn also has amazing high end shopping, some amazing pools, a Ferrari dealership (yes they have a dealership in the hotel!!!) and one of my favorite nightclubs to party at called XS, trust me you can't go wrong with getting a table at XS at least once! For such an amazing hotel the rooms are priced very reasonably, also if you book through AMEX you'll get all kinds of cool perks, for example I received a free room upgrade along with $150 credit to spend anywhere in the casino!

Wynn never let me down except they are charging for Valet parking now. 

The line for check-in was short. In-room dinning was fine. No line for buffet.

I was totally impressed by The Wynn. I usually stay Mandalay Bay whicih I love love love...but The Wynn reall rocks. The suites are spacious. The casino didn't seem packed with smokers like most casinos. Buffet was very impressive - I wanted to try everything. The club - not too bad. I like that it's smaller as I don't like the big club scene - all though they only played Hip Hop. The pool - they have a European pool where you go topless if you like - not that I would go topless but heck, live like the Euros...they know how to do it up.

Okay, so I'm just a blubbering dork when it comes to small luxuries... and the Wynn is a BIG one so.... If you're a gambler and want to get the schweet comps, PLAY HERE. The suites are gorgeous and the service is impeccable.

The fact that you can take the elevator down from your room, dine at Alex, wander back up to your room for a quick smoke break... and come back for more of your tasting menu at Alex, is friggin' fantastic. Ok, ok... so most people wouldn't do that... but hey! If you're high rollin' you can do anything you want!

I uploaded a couple sweet suite pictures so check it out!

Pro:
1: High quality resort.
2: Professional staff.
3: Excellent food.
4: Beautiful casino.
5: Beautiful gardens.
6: Amazing golf course.

Bad:
1: Huge: takes a long time to walk from Wynn to Encore and back.
2: Very high-end: e.g. expensive.
3: The roulette table I played had cigarette burns: OK on Fremont: not OK for 5 star property.

Pointless for a person without money to go in there. If you are an economically disadvantaged person, then  this here is a vacant lot in Las Vegas. Rich people or fools who pose as them go in there. No strollers by Aileen explains a lot. The expensive buffet says a lot too.

So let me begin this review by saying I'm biased because my fiancÃ© proposed to me here for our one year anniversary staycation. I LOVE THE WYNN! 
Let's begin with the rooms. The decor really isn't my style, I would say I'm much more Aria but it was very clean, real marble tables, and THE BEDS! Literally the most comfortable bed I've ever been on, I got an extended check out just so I could lay in the bed longer. It was like laying on a cloud, everything was so comfortable. I hated even getting up to go to the bathroom. 
The view from our room was great, you could see the strip and some of the villas on the ground level. They had amazing thick drapes you could control from the bed so if you wanted to block the sun it was easy. 
My fiancÃ© ordered us a Dom champagne cart with chocolate strawberries, a server brought it up in a cart and served us. What an amazing bottle of champagne it was!
There's also so much to do at the Wynn. There's awesome shops (Alexander McQueen!), the dining options are phenomenal (fiancÃ© proposed to me at Mizumi), you can see a show (La Reve). 
The property itself is beautiful with all the waterfalls, fresh floral landscapes, restaurants, ugh I could go on forever about this place. The staff is always so helpful and happy as well. Make sure you for at least one night of your life stay at the Wynn, it's 100% worth it.

The Wynn and Encore are on better end of Vegas hotels but still good value.  Warning, like all Vegas hotels you immediately get resort fees of $35 added a night to your room.  The valets stink.  There are 3 valet stations and from what I can see, nobody wants to do any work.  They complained and encouraged us to walk to the other stations because of various reasons like 'too busy', 'long wait', 'backed up tunnel', 'your car is parked in garage closer to the other station', and 'your room is closer to the other garage'.  No.  Do your job stop telling us to carry our bags all around the resort.  I still gave hotel a 5\/5 because all the other service was good.  ESPECIALLY the restaurants are all GREAT.  The terrace cafe especially.  It will be a regular stop now at Vegas trips!  I like the location near the Venetian.

The Wynn Las Vegas is a beautiful hotel!

The floral displays are beautiful, the carousel was my favorite. Gorgeous manicured  grounds.

Love the pool and the pool side cabanas. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Pina Coladas are really good order by the pitcher. The pool sude waitresses kept ourbdrinks full all day. The tuna croissant and Turkey Burger is delicious. The best crispy fries. Great food at the pool side cafe.

The rooms are very nice we had a view of the pools and golf course. The bathrooms are very spacious. The shower water pressure is perfect. Beds are super  comfortable.

Room service food was fabulous too! Burgers cooked to perfection. Flat bread pizza and salad. Large selection of items delivered quickly.

Coffee and pastries from the shop downstairs  to the elevators is the best morning spot.

The water show was a wonderful experience out on the balcony with cocktails.

Not so lucky gambling but fun. Not many cocktail waitresses here so you have to go to the bar alot, which is not what you would expect from a 5 star hotel.
Plenty of high end shopping here.

Excellent service and attention to every detail.
We all enjoyed our stay at the Wynn, we had 6 rooms. Definitely will be back for future trips.
Beautiful hotel \/ casino. I don't think my husband and I will ever stay anywhere else.

Wynn. You are very pretty. It's really nice inside. Very Rodeo-esque hotel. I love their Employee Empowerment way of business as well. When I read about the Wynn and their EE, I definitely had instant respect for Wynn's business in general. After seeing the decor and how everything was pulled together, I am impressed.

Now. What's next? I need to actually stay here.

I will update my review after my stay (which I hope is sometime soon). I am impatient!!!!!!!!! 

:)

Went with my parents over the holidays, and they were so booked that even after 3:00 (the check in time) they still told us that they didn't have rooms for us.  We flew in, and had heavy luggage, and the "best they could do" was to take my phone number and call me.  
I was upset because it was crowded and we didn't have a car, so what am I going to do with all the luggage?  
"Well, we'll call you as soon as we can."
"No, you are going to give me my rooms like you promised.  I would completely understand this problem if I was trying to check in early, but it's after 4. You are telling me that housekeeping still hasn't done their jobs yet?"
"I'm sorry ma'am there's nothing we can do."
After 30 minutes of arguing, "okay ma'am, since I can see that you are very upset, I will move you up the waiting list for rooms."

Waiting lists??? Are you kidding me? How many other people are suffering from your inability to uphold your promises after we paid $300+ per night?

It took another 15 minutes for the manager to say, "Okay, I suppose I can give you a room."  No apologize, nothing, for making my parents (who have knee problems) stand in the lobby getting shoved around by people (very small check in area) for them to get us our rooms.

That entire situation just ruined the stay.  

I won't go back to Wynn.  I should have stayed at the Bellagio like I always do.

Beautiful gorgeous extraordinary hotel rooms. Decent and affordable buffet (cheaper than most). Very nice performance at a Jazz bar. Front desk service was average. Compared to Encore, I would say this well worth the money.
I updated my review because other than the one single bad experience I had, the other times were great. We must learn to forgive always- at least once

Definitely the rudest hotel staff I ever encountered. Everyone was rude. The check-in people were rude, the concierge was rude, the maids were rude and intrusive, the restaurant staff was rude, the people who worked at the gift store were rude, and the luggage storage guys outside the hotel were rude. It's like, "Wow, I'm paying a butt-load of money to stay here and I'm being treated like dirt." 

Steve Wynn must not care about keeping his customers at all because I never want to step inside that hotel again.

Lots written so what else is there to say?  Tower Suite..  Very nice..  Loved the controls for lighting and blinds but would have loved it more if one could dim the brightness of the LED controls..  Was like sleeping with the lights on.!!  Wynn casino is perhaps the best but not the cheapest in Vegas.  Minimum blackjack bet is $15 which isn't that bad but for some folks might be steep.  Restaurant choices are very good.. What makes Wynn is the service..  Clearly Mr. Wynn get's hospitality..  Staff is cordial, well trained, accommodating and always helpful.  Wynn is my spot in Vegas..  No it's not inexpensive; no it's not for everyone but all it takes is a walk through some of the other, less expensive, more tacky establishments on the Strip to make you understand why Wynn is special..

This is my favorite hotel to be in. It doesn't smell like smoke, instead it smells a bit like light perfume everywhere. It has the best clubs and is a great location on the strip if you want to go somewhere else. The rooms are pretty big and good if you are going with a group.
I haven't stayed here but love the public restaurants.  The sinks are amazing, the stalls plentiful, and clean, clean, clean.

The property really couldn't be any better, but the service is lacking, at best.  After deciding the Palms was crap, and booking one of the Wynn's most expensive suites, we couldn't get them to send a car to rescue us from the Palms because, as the agent said "We aren't VIP enough".  Fair enough I guess, but a more service focused hotel would have sent one of the Phantoms at the VIP entrance.  We didn't need that but the offer to at least arrange for a cash car would have been nice.  

I also found service issues in some of the restaurants.  SW, for example, does not carry service that comes anywhere close to matching their food.  Okada offers "Fiji" water in plastic bottles when ordering bottled water.  The service there is also substandard.  Some of the lesser restaurants just completely lack a minimal level of service.

Regardless, the property is fantastic and don't think there is a better place to stay.  Steve Wynn has impeccable taste, but perhaps has a thing or two to learn about service.

I was so excited to go to the Wynn. I could not WAIT. And, upon arrival, it looked amazing. The lobby is spectacular.  My excitement wore off as soon as I checked in, however.  

FRONT DESK - It was 8pm and my non-smoking "room type" that I had made a reservation for was not available. So, rather than upgrade me (like any other hotel chain in the world), the Wynn told me I could either have a smoking room (um NO), a downgraded non-smoking room, or PAY extra for an upgrade.  I'm serious. I asked if they could give me the non-smoking downgrade and then change my room the next day. Since I was there for a conference I called at lunch time (was in sessions from 8-12) and they said there was no record of a room change in the system and the earlist it could happen was the next day. So finally 2 nights after I checked in I got the room I had reserved months before. No adjustment was made to my bill for this inconvenience, despite my asking about that. 

SPA - Since I was there for a conference I went to the spa to get waxing done (didn't have time to go offsite and my bf was flying in).  Let's just say that the waxing was $170 ($10 more than the menu said) plus tip, and it was the WORST waxing job I have ever had, at 3x my usual cost. There were huge patches of hair missed. Terrible. 

GYM - it's $30 to use the gym. Nothing more needs to be said about that

I was underwhelmed by the Wynn and their customer service, and lack of empathy for poor service. For the prices they charge they should do better. Period. The Bellagio is nicer. Stay there.

When I go for a time out the Wynn is the one I choose.
Its a nice hotel and not expensive 
Enjoyed the pool and spa 
Best weekend ever

This is as good as it's gonna gets for a Las Vegas Hotel. For This particular trip, I am staying in the Tower Suite which have a private Valet entrance. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was exceptional. I definitely am a Fan!!! They clean your room twice a day. Once in the morning and when i got back from dinner, the room was clean again. If you are staying at Wynn, I do recommend that you dine at Red8 and Botero!!! The food were exceptional

Best hotel in Vegas they're expensive for a reason. Walk into other hotels on the strip and you'll understand. There isn't a negative thing I can say about this resort. From the concierge to the decor, food, nightlife etc it's amazing.. highly recommend. If I'm going to Vegas it will only be staying at the Wynn or encore!

Wynn is one of the top 3 hotels I prefer to stay at in Las Vegas. Here are the three reasons:

1. The rooms are top of the line
2. Their hosts are amazing in making accommodations and creating plans for you even when they're not working in the office.
3. The amenities from the spa to the restaurants are superb.

I highly recommend a visit!

The good...
Nice rooms.  

The bad...
$30 charge for using the gym.
$10 charge for entering the Ferrari dealership.
Staff\/Service hit or miss, some were not very friendly.
Heated pool not heated.
Buffet sucks.

We'd searched for a place to stay about a month out from our trip to Las Vegas, and prices somehow seemed outrageous for a random, non-holiday weekend in June. We looked again about a week and a half before our trip, and the Wynn suddenly had a deal going. Once you add in the resort fee, taxes, etc., no hotel is too cheap in Vegas, but you get what you pay for.

We were told upon arriving that we had a golf course view. The view was more of that of a building below the hotel (not scenic), but the room itself was gorgeous. Beautifully decorated in whites and creams with a lovely king bed, a spacious bathroom with a separate toilet, a couch area and a table sitting area. The bed was very comfortable, and as is often the case after staying at a nicer hotel, we questioned our own bedding at home! The mini-bar was pricey, but at what hotel isn't it?

The Wynn was well-located in terms of proximity to other hotels, restaurants on the strip. The hotel itself is also nicely decorated and very well-kept. It has everything: a large casino, upscale shopping and lots of places to eat. My husband was particularly impressed by their swimming pool, and said it was the best he's ever done his laps in! Free parking is the icing on the cake (though I guess you're paying for it in resort fees!). 

We would definitely stay again.

Mm I have to say I really liked Wynn. Although the space was a little smaller, in general, everything was pretty well maintained. Room service was also impeccable, this lady even organized our shoes! The location was a little annoying because it is kinda close to the end of the strip so it may take a while to walk to somewhere down the strip.

I try to stay at the Wynn whenever I go to Vegas.  Hotels that I have visited:  Stratosphere, Mandalay Bay, The Venetian, Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, Treasure Island, Encore, and Wynn.  Out of those places, my favorite is the Wynn for their excellent FAST service, decor, restaurants, casino floor, and staff.  I was comped three nights there with a $150.00 resort credit, the best thing ever!  

Rooms:
I actually prefer Wynn's suites over Encore, to me it's just more simpler and serene.  Encore is more for groups, there's a living area, so your friends can stop by and hang out with you.  Att the Wynn, when I first walk into the foyer I feel like as if I am at home and I can jump into bed and look out the window at the beautiful strip.  If you get a chance to, you have to order room service for dinner and just take in everything and relax, then go party and gamble afterwards :-) I absolutely love their bathrooms!  The toilet is its own room which is a plus!  I love the shower head, it's like washing yourself underneath a waterfall :-).  The bedding and bed are so comfortable; you'd feel like you're sleeping on air.  

Restaurants:
The Buffet!  Is my second favorite from RIO's seafood buffet.  Wynn's buffet used to be my favorite, but since they had taken away their flan, I stopped going.

There is a chinese restaurant at Encore, it's called Wasusu? I loved it!  I love the decor from the big booths, to how it is open so when you're eating you can also keep your eyes open to what's happening on the casino floor.  I would come here for lunch again.

The Spa:
Their spa is heaven!  I absolutely loved The Wynn's spa and I will definitely be coming there again.  If you do go, please make sure to arrive there at least 2 hours in advance so that you can take advantage of their spa amenities and then have your service.  Right when the elevator opens, you'll notice the difference in ambiance and their reception area is so welcoming.  I like to lounge around there for a few minutes and just relax while waiting for a friend.  Make sure to drink their teas and have some fruits :-).  My only regret was that I did not use the amenities enough last time I went, I had booked my appointment right away and didn't have time to enjoy the rest.  Ooo ladies, this is European style, but you can also wear a bathing suit of course.  I prefer going Euro ;-).  

The Wynn Theatre:
I'm very picky with my theatres and where I see my shows or concerts.  I hate The Staples Center or the Honda Center in California because the layout is NOT for concerts, sound just floats everywhere and you can't hear anything! ugghhh pet peeve....  Wynn's Theatre is not like that, you have the stage and the audience fans out, like how a theatre is suppose to be.  Their sound system is amazing, I saw Le Reve here and I absolutely loved it.  Such a different experience and no matter where you sit, the performers are not tiny, where you'd like binoculars.  Granted, I have seen all the Circus Du Soleil show, my favorite is "O", absolutely amazing!  The reason is, I love to swim and their show is just wonderful in the water.  Any Circus Du Soleil show would be great to see, just depends on your budget.

Golf Course:
Please please please, go visit the golf course!  It is awesome!!!


I think that covers it!  Let me know if you guys have questions and I'll try to answer! ooo and my luck at the Wynn on the penny machine won me $500.00, so that was a bonus!
Pretty hotel, terrible service (as in none whatsoever) at the pool. The one waitress basically ignored us the entire time even when we approached her to try and place a drink and food order.

The Wynn Hotel - 3 Nights.

Back in August of 2015 I stayed at the Wynn and my stay was not "Wynn Standards". I wrote about it in detail and it was not positive.  

Last weekend I re-visited the Wynn. Hotel Manager Steve asked me back for a retry. I am thankful to Steve for the consideration and efforts.

On this trip we had no problems as before. The staff was very nice and professional. Any small items of concern were taken care of immediately. 

The hotel designed by Roger Thomas, has a colorful France\/Italy feel in my opinion. Quite beautiful. The Tower Double Suite rooms are neutral in color, large showers, large bathtubs (for us guys at 6 feet and above) and without doubt the best hotel bed\/mattress I have ever slept on. No sore back issues the next morning.

The Wynn is a high end hotel. ($$$$) Needless to say, you receive what you pay for and hopefully what you receive is worth to you the dollars spent.  The various bars in the casino with video poker do not provide bar comps. On the casino floor, slots, tables, etc, bar comps are given. I don't consider casino gaming.  Gaming good or bad... it's a matter of luck. 

The Wynn prides itself on everything Wynn. I cannot speak for Encore but at least at the Wynn you are not going to find a 'Food Court' or 'Starbucks'. The Wynn has their own dining and their own coffee shops. 

The Wynn pool was quiet, nice and restful. The waitresses serving within the pool area were attentive.

My trip was great and what I would expect as a Steve Wynn hotel experience.

I was very lucky to have the opportunity to stay here.  This hotel is very pricey.  As they should be.  This hotel is absolutely spectacular.   It doesn't get any nicer than this.   Rooms are gorgeous, the pool area is heaven and then there the shopping!  You definitely Get what you pay for.  Truly the best hotel in Vegas.

Like anything new, this place is pretty snazzy. The buffet or as I like to call it the boo-fay. Aren't I ever so clever? Okay, maybe not.  Anyways, back to reviewing the buffet. You will drop about $80 for two people at the buffet. Since its quite expensive, you better have  a good strategy. to get your money's worth. I would load up on SHRIMP, KING CRAB LEGS, PRIME RIB, EXOTIC FRUITS, and anything else that remotely looks like sea food. If you have room at the end of your smorgasbord..load up on desserts. The food at the buffet is pretty good. I can't say how it compared to Belagio because we didn't eat there this time. 
Once you fattened up, time to walk off all that cholesterol. The hotel has a hand full of shops that you can check out.

I love the Wynn and the Encore.  I don't always go to Vegas, but when I do, you can bet that you will see me at one of these hotels.  I like the fact that it's on the strip but a little more secluded and a little less nuts but still walking distance to all the action.

This review is for the casino portion of the hotel. I was there on 8\/20 and signed up for the Red Card. I was told that their system was down but that it would be up the next day. I went downstairs right before my flight to find out if the system was up and if our points from the previous night had posted. We were told that they did and that we qualified for all new member bonuses based on the pattern of our spending. I was offered four free meals. I asked about using them the next time we returned, which I said would be for the Mayweather\/Canelo fight. I was told that I had seven days to use them. I asked for an extension given the fact that the points system had been down the previous day. I even went up to the cashier at around 4am to see if it was up yet. We were told that no exceptions would be made.

We will never return to this hotel again and will make sure that my boyfriend tells his company to put up their employees at another hotel. Why is it MY fault that YOUR system was down? I spent hundreds up dollars that night gambling but that meant nothing. They could have at least given me an extension on the meal vouchers until 9\/1
Vad sÃ¤ger man, det har allt. Servicen enastÃ¥ende. Utsikten bedÃ¶vande, Ã¤ven om jag inte spelar golf (man ser deras golfbana nÃ¤rmast).

Wynn is the best hotel in Las Vegas. 

Vegas has been my party destination for the past 5 years and I go there minimum 7 times per year. After trying out hotels like the Venitian, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan I quickly found paradise and it is Wynn ;-))

We book the salaon suite room in  Wynn which goes around $1000 per night, but it is totally worth it. You have a mini bar in your room, nice couches and they have frette luxy sheets... A hot tub in the bathroom and the room services comes multiple times per day.

Tons of restaurants and awesome bars in the hotel area, simply the best!

Truly lovely,Wynn is a much younger, hipper more relaxing resort than Bellagio or Venetian.  The pool has a unique layout, 2 stories and spread out across a large area with landscaping and plenty of lounges.  I have stayed at Mandalay, Bellagio, Venetian, Monte Carlo, Mirage, TI and would recommend this over the rest.

Hotel is beautiful and if you want to stay at a place where you will be treated like shit, this is the place for you. I stayed here last year and it took me an hour and a half to check in at what they like to call the VIP check in.  Believing it was an isolated instance, I came back this year. I reserved an $800 suite four months ago and it is now 5:00 pm and the room is still not ready. The staff and manager offer no accommodations or apologies and their attitude is that if I don't like paying for a room that I don't get to use, I should stay somewhere else. I assured them that I would on all future stays.

At registration desk : JJ was very attentive AND CHRISTAL , Lian was very patientionally helped my difficult request and I appreciated ! That's why I prefer pick WYNN even little more expensive . It's very beautiful hotel and staff are all awesome . They try to give me what I want as much as they can... I really love this hotel. I try stay other nice hotels but that was not complete like here. And just staff work here are really great people.

My wife and I were taken back with the unbelievable customer service we received durning our visit here. It started at our arrival with the valet dept. our car door was open and they welcomed us kindly. 
As we walked around admiring the casino, Bobby (table game supervisor) came right up to us and introduced himself. Normally  there's apprehension approaching tables in Casinos, however that was not the case here! Bobby was genuine and so were the dealers in this area. Bottom line, we were made to feel welcome and that's worth every penny.

My husband and I were excited for our one-night stay at the Wynn. When in Las Vegas, we typically stay at Caesar's Palace, but this visit we decided to try the Wynn-- after all we had heard so many positive things about it. We were looking for a nice, relaxing setting for the last night of our two week California vacation.

All was well until midnight when a concert out at the pool area got rolling. Note we had a room with the golf course view. The music got louder and louder. Finally, my husband called the front desk at 2:30 am and spoke with the front desk supervisor. He was rude and extremely unhelpful. My husband pointed out that no one had forewarned us about the concert upon checkin. The supervisor offered ear plugs , a fan with white noise and a room change at 3 am. All of which were completely unacceptable. When one stays at a 'so called' 5 star resort, one expects to be treated with professionalism and outstanding customer service WHICH was not the case. A very disappointing, frustrating sleepless night for over $300\/night. Oh yes, one important detail. Because we booked and paid for our room through hotels.com, we were treated like second class citizens.

Booked an Encore salon suite (different tower, same hotel) for $1500\/night.
Private concierge asked me for my arrival time, but failed
To have our room ready.
Concierge booked my spa appt, instead of booking at he spa in my tower, they put me 15 minutes away in the far tower at the Wynn. Makes zero sense.
Then when I tried to move the appt to the Encore, they told me they'd have to charge me
50% of the services they booked me for at the ATM Spa. WHICH WAS THE WRONG SERVICE ANYWAYS.
I've been here for 15 minutes and I couldn't be more displeased with the level of service.
The room was great the only reason I don't give it 5 stars is the slow service...   Room service..  Extra pillow.  All took way too long.    LOVE this hotel though!!! One of the best!!!!!

Wynn is pretty fancy in my opinion. The curtains, lights, privacy setting, and room temperature can be digitally controlled by your bedside, near the hallway, and by the entrance. Their snacks and minibar sits on a sensor so for those who have kids who like to explore everything (or for those who don't like to read), you'll need to be careful because you'll automatically get charged if the items are moved\/changed for more than 60 seconds.

The bed and oversized pillows are so fluffy and comfortable - I didn't want to move once I plopped onto the bed. If I hadn't made any plans beforehand, I'd probably wouldn't leave the bed! Also, the service was impeccable. Upon returning from our exploration of the strip, I found that housekeeping had arranged all my make up and placed them neatly on a towel. I ran into a very small incident in which I brought to the front desk's attention to see what my options are. They went above and beyond and notified their manager immediately. She called to apologize, offered to file a claim on my behalf, and offer me a replacement. I told them to disregard it as it was such a minute thing, but knowing that they take even the little things very seriously is reassuring.

Everything else was pretty standard of the nicer hotels in Vegas - large restroom with a separate toilet room, oversized roman soaking tub, large stand-in shower, floor to ceiling windows, etc. This place is on the pricier side, but you get what you pay for.

So I was having a good time when a bartender complained about her one drink minimum at the B bar. She called security even tho I told Beth the bartender I gambled 30 dollars at her bar. She didn't care, then I told security when they came up to me. They escorted me out and Richie the security guard stopped me almost physically to ask if I was a guest staying at the casino, I had to put my hands up and say loudly I was leaving. Almost got assaulted while I video taped it.. next time this happens I will have metro there to arrest anybody that threatens me the way your security did. I filed a complaint t with three different managers hope you respond mr. Wynn. I have video of the security guards walkin in front of me and telling me I have to answer their questions which was am I a hotel guest hahah I raised my hands and yelled I'm leaving. Call me if you want the video.its funny how the your casino mr. Wynn and the security doesn't give a f about the gamblers on your establishment it happened about an hour ago please watch the videos on surveillance. Because you will see how unfairly I was treated

Stayed at Wynn for 3 nights and really enjoyed it.  The layout of the hotel was not as confusing as other hotels and the interior was quite nice. Smooth check-in and hassle-free check-out. 

I didn't gamble so I can't review which tables\/machines were hot but I noticed that the gambling areas were kept very clean and the ventilation must have been working great because the secondhand smoke wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. 

The best part of staying at Wynn was that we were able to purchase tickets to two of the hottest clubs in town namely, Tyrst and XS. As hotel guests, we didn't have to wait in line with 200 other people. I came to party and Las Vegas and party I did.

The Wynn is probably the best casino on the strip for anyone who has a little bit of money. I've never stayed here since I'm a local, but I've had friends who have booked gorgeous rooms.

I come here more for the food; the restaurants are top notch. Bartolotta is rated top 5 in Las Vegas, Strata is good for late night eats, Okada is delicious.

I'm not a big fan of the clubs here because the staff are kind of pretentious douchebags at both places, but the hotel, gaming, food are all top notch.

Well it is upperclass and the drink prices are pretty severe here. But it is worth checking out. However it resembles the Bellagio and is not that unique when you compare the other High end hotels like Aria and Cosmo.

The rooms are absolutely amazing.  They contain floor-to-ceiling windows that provide a gorgeous view.  They have lights that include a "low-lighting" setting that makes the room appear much more mellow and at-ease.  The bathroom is also large and spacious, containing a bathtub and separate shower.  The Wynn also contains a wide variety of restaurants to eat at.  Guests should be warned that some of the restaurants are unreasonably expensive, while others, such as Terrace Point Cafe have good food and are affordable.  The hotel is also very tastefully decorated, and I especially love the beautiful lights and Christmas decorations during Christmas-time.

The Wynn has it all. I've been to this hotel during trips to Vegas (mainly for the nightlife) over the past few years; my husband and I decided to stay here on a more recent visit. The room (we stayed in the deluxe resort) was very clean and well maintained. Staff and service is friendly, prompt, and attentive. In line with competition, the hotel also offers great specials\/packages. 

During our stay, we watched their water show, Le RÃªve - the Dream and it was AMAZING. I was most impressed with the talent of the performers versus the story line. In addition to the entertainment, you'll find XS  nightclub here, which in my opinion, has the best DJ's. 

The hotel lobby is one of most beautiful I've seen with the vibrant flowers. Whether you're staying in the hotel or not, it's a definite photo-op.

Gorgeous well-maintained casino. I remember when it first opened, it was very dull and stuffy but now is is party-central! It has a lively atmospehere and is very crowded; two things I prefer in a casino. If you prefer the same level of quality but on a smaller scale, with fewer crowds, then Encore is for you. One complaint is there aren't any nearby casinos to walk to just in case you want a change of scenery.

Unfortunately the staff did not handle the fact that 2 people in our party got sick from the tuna salad sandwich from the deli properly. Its a shame that such a hotel doesn't care to step up when things go wrong. I would never eat or stay at this hotel again.

Just came back from staying here 4 nights.  Loved the hotel.  Can't say enough good things about it.  The last time I was in Vegas I stayed at the Bellagio when it was the nicest hotel on the strip.  Now I will stay here.

The room was very nice.  Great panoramic view of the strip which is especially fun at night.  The bed was super comfy which is what they are known for.

The pool was nice.  Water temperature just right, the whole area was very clean and constantly being picked up by the staff.    The hostesses around the pool offered pretty quick drink service. Next time I would like to rent a cabana though - very pricey but nice to have the shade and misters. Plus a plasma TV!  Certainly if you go with friends or another couple, worth the price.

The bar areas are all very nice, clean, not too loud.  Someplace fun to hang out.  The sports book looked fantastic!  All of the gaming areas are clean.  Yes, it is pricey to gamble here but its a high-roller place.  So $5.00 blackjack is down street if you want it (currently across the street at The Frontier which is closing this weekend - no doubt for another luxury hotel and casino - Trump I believe.)  

The Penske-Wynn Ferrari showroom and dealership is also here.  They charge $10 to look at the cars - which I think is silly if you are a hotel guest. But beautiful cars for sure.  And does keep the many teenage boys out of there (saw them drooling through the windows) which is likely the reason...

The staff were always very friendly. From the registration desk to the taxi porters to the pool attendants.  I also appreciate that they have on-the-ball security.  They seem like they are paying attention and not just biding their time to get off their shift.  

2 complaints though: One is no coffee maker in the room or ability to get one (The Ritz on Maui "rents" them to you for your stay.)  How many people would like to wake up and have their coffee before going downstairs?  And the coffee bar downstairs is cute but would rather have one in my room.

Second is they charge a $25 use fee for the gym even if you are a guest.  That seems ridiculous.  Even a $25 fee for our whole stay would have been ok.  Seems like I am paying quite a bit to stay here per night so the gym shouldn't be an upsell.  

But would definitely go back!

I absolutely adored my stay at the Wynn.  If you are looking for a truly luxurious experience when you come to Vegas, I highly recommend you stay here.  The rooms are stunning, the hotel is clean and definitely filled with... classier people for a lack of a better word.  It really gives you the feeling of being royalty, whereas other hotels feel a little more slimy.  

So! If you are looking to treat yourself, stay at the Wynn.  You won't regret it.

The Wynn is, hands down, the best hotel in Las Vegas. It isn't gaudy. It doesn't smell like cigarette smoke. It's always clean--even the casino area. The theme of the entire hotel is Picasso's "Le RÃªve", so if you are into modern cubism you will love the decor.

The lines at the check-in\/out desk are ridiculously long. It helps that there is an outdoor patio area where you can sit, have a cocktail and enjoy the outdoor waterfall (there is always a light show at night, too!) while your man stands in line and checks in line for your group. That's what I did!

We stayed in a double-bed room, and it was pretty huge. We could have easily fit 2-4 extra cots and had more people stay with us. The beds were comfortable and linen was high quality, as expected. Flat screen, wall-mounted TV, as expected. One big wall as a window to let in the sun, as expected. The only thing I really didn't expect was having a flat-screen TV in the bathroom and in the toilet room. Lol

On the first level of of the hotel, you will find the standard, but cleaner-than-usual, casino and various restaurants. We tried both Alessandro Stratta's restaurants: Alex (5 AAA Diamonds, 5 Mobil Stars, 2 Michelin Stars) and Stratta. Both were exceptional, and dining experiences I will never forget!! Steve Wynn really knew what he was doing when he invited Stratta over to Las Vegas.

But let's keep this Yelp review focused on the Wynn, shall we? Another feature of the Wynn Las Vegas is the high-end boutiques. I was stopped in my tracks when I saw the Alexander McQueen, Manolo Blahnik, and most of all, Oscar de la Renta! 

If you are going to stay at the Wynn, please watch "Le RÃªve". It was an amazing show, and on par to Cirque du Soleil. If you've never seen a Cirque du Soleil show, or anything like it, you haven't really lived.

Winter in wonderland. Everything is so beautiful. Love all the decorations and colors. With thousands of ornaments and dozens of fully decorated trees, there truly is no place for Christmas like Vegas.

Best in class, best in service. You could NOT associate anything negative with this Hotel\/Casino. My experience with the staff was 6 stars if it existed. Steve Wynn
is a great example of the American Dream.

An outstanding resort in the heart of the las vegas strip.  The upscale Wynn with its sister resort the Encore provides the class and service that vegas has been in need of as of late.

Its not The Palms nor the Hard Rock, so if you're expecting a savage enviroment, don't come stay at the Wynn.  The Wynn has a subtle elegance about it, but don't underestimate it's ability to show its visitors a good time.  Two of the hottest clubs in Vegas are located at the Wynn and Encore, Tryst @ the Wynn and XS @ Encore.

The rooms at the Wynn are spacious, however not as well laid out as others in their league, e.g. the Palazzo, Venetian. Although larger than most standard rooms in Vegas, the living area of the Wynn's rooms are smaller in contrast to rooms at Venetian and Palazzo.  This is because most of its square footage goes to the bathroom.  Yes, Wynn's bathrooms are huge.  Double sinks, separate and enclosed toilet, large shower, and separate soaking tub.  For a five star, five diamond resort, the beds are just ok, not the greatest, considering hotels with less stars like the W,Sheraton, and Westin have much better beds and linens.

Overall the Wynn is a great place to stay.  Its great location, top notch service, and beautiful people will have you coming back for more.

Sleep Well....

First time in the Wynn in Las Vegas. I have stayed at the Aria, Cesar's, The Nobu in Cesar's, planet Hollywood, New York New York, The Venetian and I absolutely LOVE the Wynn. I fell in love with their decoration, the rooms, the views, all of the detail Steve Wynn put into this hotel. And most of all I absolutely LOVE the customer service. Can't get any better than that.

I've stayed at Wynn, vdara, treasure island, Mandalay, and Venetian. This is tie with Venetian.  I love love the large spacious tech-savvy rooms. The view of the pools and golf course was stunning. The pools were a lot of fun. it is clean, quiet, and so big. The Buffett is great too and a nice cheaper alternative to Bucchanal.

Would highly recommend. I think this is my new go to Vegas hotel.

Oh and check out the large mall across the street. It's got a good court and like 270 stores!

This place is nice...not too many hillbillies or kids.  Everything is high class or faux high class. Nice restaurants and lots of good dining deals with the Taste of Wynn menu. 

I doubt anyone that I know could afford to buy anything from any of the stores.  With the recession that we are in how can one afford an $88,000 cell phone?  Well we actually saw some moron buying one!  Yes you too could use a years salary to buy a jewel encrusted cell phone with crappy nokia guts.  Gotta love the extremely rich and the fact that they will buy almost anything as long as it is shiny.

Okay, so to clarify, I did not stay in a room here, just spent the day exploring and gambling. 

I've been in a fair share of hotels and casinos on the strip and this is by the far the best one I have been in. Meticulously clean. The decor is so fun and whimsical, unlike anything I've seen in any other hotel. It was beautiful.

The staff was incredible and very friendly. I very much enjoyed spending time there.
Subpar hotel pretending to be first rate. I've stayed at nicer hotels in Vegas. Service was deplorable. Tom Ford could do better than having his products associated with this hotel and owner.

Worst stay I've ever had in Vegas. Customer service was terrible and the security team was just as bad. I'm shocked that they were that rude to guests at registration. I have never had such a bad experience at a Las Vegas hotel.

Favorite hotel in Las Vegas! I have stayed at the Wynn on multiple occasions, and always have an exceptional experience!

Beautifully styled! Amazing restaurants and boutiques within the property - From a delicious chocolate croissant & latte at the Cafe, poolside bunch at Terrace Point, to an impressive steak dinner at SW. Great memories of afternoons at the pools. The hibiscus lemonade is delicious and refreshing! 

Ideal location - The casino has great energy but is never overwhelming. Love that the Encore Hotel is easily accessible as well!

when i went to vegas for the 2nd time in my life with my family... (I know, it's weird but my parents don't like to gamble? but i think that's a good thing).. so it was cool when we finally went last year. 
we went to the Wynn and i think it's the best hotel on the strip. (i liked it better than the Bellagio) the room was spacious and cool.. (they had a tv in the bathroom! so you could potentially watch tv while you. went pee or poo.. sorry) and the bed was comfy and the mini bar had a lot of fun, overpriced stuff in it...
i really enjoyed the buffet too. It's clean and there is a wide variety of different cuisines you can choose from.. (okay, that's all buffets -_-) and they're desserts were good too.
the pools...are really big and i think they were heated...l think two of the pools connected somewhere... it was weird...but different?
also, it was conveniently located right in front of a mall! my favorite. and i got some shopping done there. fun stuff.
so, all in all, i love you wynn. i think you're pretty. even though some think that you're tacky. 
i think they're adding a new section to it... yayyay

After looking at every hotel on the strip I choose the Wynn to get married in. Was a dream come true! Perfect! That was 3 years ago and every year on our anniversary we go back. Friendly staff, beautiful hotel! Rooms are large beds are comfortable and bathrooms are spa like. We go to Vegas on average 2 times a year and now can't stay anywhere else because they've spoiled us.

Never been to the Wynn before so as a first timer it was pretty nice. I keep feeling that each new hotel that goes up just has to outdo the last one by a little bit. I guess Wynn succeeded. I liked the floral walkway from the entrance into the hotel's shopping area. Since we didn't stay there I can only review the areas I did visit -- the shopping area and the public areas of the hotel. I'm not sure why they put all their security guys in purple jackets. It just threw me off. I'd expect that at the Rio, but at Wynn? Purple is just not a very nice color for big security guys.

The other thing I didn' t like about Wynn was how the valet drop off and pick up are kind of far away from each other. Yes there is an airconditioned room for you to wait in but when there are 20+ people standing around, the room just doesn't get cold anymore. Even with the misters, it was hot. The Wynn valet was also the slowest of all the hotels I've experienced with the same amount of people waiting for a car. Not sure why.

This is one of my favorite hotels besides the Venetian.  The only disappointment is that they started charging an additional $20 for internet, fax, and printer service.  It's great if people use it but there are a lot of people that don't use it.
One of the best hotels in Las Vegas!  They have one of the best buffet here in Las Vegas, The Buffet.  Best nightclub, XS Nightclub.  A few great restaurants as well!

Received a promotion from the Wynn which we booked for this weekend. We were offered a choice between two different types of rooms- one at the Wynn and one at the Encore. We picked the Wynn. Upon arrival we were given a room at the Encore as an "upgrade" which we didn't request or want. We had booked the Wynn. 
We were also given two free buffet passes as part of the promotion. The line was a 2 hour and 15 minute wait. You can't leave your name and come back. No, thanks. 50$ in free slot credit, you say? Nope. Only after you get 300 points- very misleading. 
Once we walked across the property to the Encore and entered our room. We found the previous occupants clothes still in the closet, and the room had not been cleaned. Disgusting and unacceptable. 
Of course we had valeted our car at the Wynn upon our original arrival and we were told it would be moved so at check out it would be at the Encore. This didn't happen, and we saw the Valet's seriously annoyed face she had to go to the other building to get our car. We looked like the jerks, but it was their mistake. Thanks, Wynn. 

Besides all of these mishaps, the property is stunning and the Le Reve show was great. The decoration is gorgeous and so well thought out. 
The promotional offer? Maybe not so well planned. I guess if you get a deal, you're not as important.

I don't think that I can possibly stay in another hotel for the rest of my life and have a better experience.  

We purchased a small suite on priceline for roughly $250 per night. Upon arrival we were informed that the hotel was booked and our room was given to someone else -which, you may think, is cause for concern. But no!  Oh, no. We were bumped up not once but twice and eventually upgraded to the second largest suite in the hotel to make up for the oversight. 

As for the suite - I can only liken it to the moment in the "Hangover" when they first walk in - this thing had two bathrooms, a full living room, and an enormous bedroom and bathroom (with jacuzzi tub and separate shower).  Robes, slippers, two TV's, private pool, insane views, you get the idea. It DESERVED a tiger in the bathroom. I felt downright fancy!!

My only complaint - which doesn't really qualitfy as a complaint - is that the myriad restaurants\/bars\/stores in the hotel had pretty strict dress codes, and there were times when I found myself dripping with pool water, in shorts, unable to find a place that would accept my disgustingness.  But honestly, thats my fault - and good on them for having standards. Next time I shall cover myself head to toe in fanciful Dorthy Zbornak-inspired blue satin. 

Everyone who worked there was kind, professional, and helpful. The food was amazing; all of it. I fell in love.  And now I'm heartbroken that the experience has ended.    

God bless you, Steve Wynn.  God bless you and your ridiculous empire. May you live forever.

Probably not much to add that the other 700 reviewers haven't already covered but nonetheless I'm a huge fan of the Wynn!  Our stay was nothing but luxurious.  The check-in and staff were superb, all restaurants we tried delicious, our room gorgeous and clean, and the best drink service on the casino floor of all the ones we visited.  We had NO problem getting several drinks throughout our nights.  We treated ourselves and upgraded our room to be in the tower suites which was a nice little extra, though not necessary.  

The only negative but not entirely worth pulling a star was the drink service around the tower suites 'private' pool was slowwwwwww.... it took at least 1\/2 hour to get someone to take our order then at least another 1\/2 half our to get our order.  She first only brought DH's beer after 15 minutes and she forgot my beverage, which when reminded it took another 15 minutes to bring a mojito.   Oh well... it was 115 degrees when we were there and too hot to even just hang out by the pool so we stayed inside with the AC!

We are creatures of habit and once we find something we love we stick with so I see many trips back to the Wynn in our future.

Your typical five-star review for the Wynn.  Went during Valentine's Day with the girlfriend, which, coupled with a 3-day President's Day weekend, meant for incredible crowds and something I probably wouldn't do it again.  No fault of the Wynn, though.  

Thinking back upon it, the check-in process did take a long time, but the twenty-dollar tip drink worked like a charm, as I received a "complimentary" upgrade to a 54th floor room with an awesome view of the strip.  The rooms are simply incredible, the largest in Las Vegas.  Mechanical moving shades, 42 inch HDTV on a swivel that has your name computerized on it, and a spectacular bathroom with separate shower and giant tub alongside a TV in the bathroom and a separate room for the toilet.

The food at the buffet is incredible - best in Las Vegas (and I'm not just saying that, I've been around).  It's the priciest in Vegas as well, but I guarantee you will not be disappointed.  

Pool was out of order when I visited, but I guess you can't win them all.  Casino is also nice as well - the blackjack dealer Frank was awesome and everyone at the table had a great time while he was there.

This place is amazing and unthoughtful at the same time. The food, the rooms, the hotel- are all top class and the best we have had in our many trips to Vegas. 
But here is the kicker.... The outdoor ALL NIGHT (till 4am) club pumps house music with bass emanating through our room that is on the 11th floor. This is not relaxing music. And yes, I love to party. I even enjoy some house music when I'm at the club, but when you have decided to retire at midnight to have a good awake morning in Vegas, DO NOT EXPECT IT AT THE WYNN! I thought it was some street party at 3am and realized it was the Wynn decoding to allow a few hundred people to party until 4am while anyone in bed at the hotel just suffered. Did I mention it was Thursday night, not Friday or Saturday.  Yes this party is 7 days a week. 
A 5 billion dollar resort that has forgotten it's guest might want to sleep, damn what a shame.  Steve Wynn got everything right at this resort except for the fact that sometimes people need sleep to keep the party going. Again it's a shame. 
I guess we are going back to Palazzo, or Bellagio the next trip, they have larger pools anyway.

Amazing rooms with great views of Vegas from all angles. Craps table was fairly hot for me and the sportsbook is one of the nicest. Palazzo has a better sportsbook and is only a short walk The Wynn consistently has better service though.

Very simply put, this is what Bellagio used to be. Very clean and excellent service. Prices are sky high but that kind of keeps the riffraff out. Break out the platinum card and throw caution to the wind and enjoy yourself. Good on you Mr. Wynn
