The amenities will spoil you rotten. The pools look like they should be Roman baths and the cabanas are like outdoor resort rooms complete with couches, tvs and refrigerators. The Wynn pools combine with the Encore pools, so it creates this ongoing view of never-ending pools. They have an outdoor bar with video casino games so you can enjoy the best of both worlds. 

Parking is free which is good enough for me!

Encore and Wynn are connected so if you can't stay at the Wynn and stay at the Encore, you can still enjoy the benefits of both. 

If you get the opportunity to stay at the Wynn, take it and don't be surprised if you never again want to stay anywhere else!

One of the best hotel I stayed. Cleanliness 4 star, lobby 5 star, entertainment 5 star, service 4 star. We stayed at the premium room with Panoramic view of golf course. The lobby guys said it's quiet room but it's wasn't we heard the music from the xs club but we didn't mind. 
Pool and spa amazing. Restaurants were really good! We are at Andreas and it was amazing

This last stay June 8-10 was less than wonderful when checking in. We were moved from one dirty room to another room to a final room which  still had a musty odor. took us over 2 hours to finally get checked in and settled in to our room with waiting in the hallway for over 30 minutes. They staff is very nice and helpful and i guess they did their best to help mitigate our problem. We saw Le Reve which is amazing and at their seafood restaurant, Lakeside, Superb! Then came the gambling: I played for over 10 hours and they only had me down for 4 1\/2 hours. Very frustrating when you are trying to get rated and regularly play. They tried to make it right after speaking to a casino manager, but only gave me nominal credit to go away for play i have been fully comped in the past. I like the hotel, but will be gambling elsewhere in the future and probably staying somewhere else too.

Really a very nice hotel, they took care of us, very spacious Tower suite The views were outstanding.  The hotel staff did an outstanding job taking care of us. 

Bartolotta Di Mare does good as it gets. As a foodie I am very particular when it comes to fine dinning and this restaurant was spot on.

 I will continue to book my Las Vegas stays here.

Going for my byo's birthday, it was SUPPOSED to be a couples thang. My other half was unable to attend, and I will admit I was highly disappointed. BUT my solo stay @ the Wynn Hotel helped me out a bit that weekend. A girl is now spoiled and this looks like it will be a winner going forward for myself. Upon entry the perfume scented lobby, and decorative floor and abundant flowers but me in a zone of my own. I loved the garden. Check-in was a breeze, now show me my room!!!
-Gorgeous - I was torn; disappointed for being solo but LOVING the room I had to pacify my disappointment. The bed and touch buttons next to the night stand were a plus in addition to the sunken tub that was waiting for me.
-Two thumbs up for the fabulous chocolate cake I ordered from room service. 

I CANNOT WAIT to go and stay back again. Keep up the great work. Great location in being across from the Fashion Show Mall and the walkway to the Palazzo was a great help for the walk back in high heels.

The morning buffet in this hotel is not bad , but the serve is super suck, because I went to have breakfast alone, and the waiter take away my all stuff included my ticket, thus once I came back, they attempt to kick me out, and the manager ask the waiter if I stay at this place, he says no, because he thinks I do not have that ticket, but my neighbors can approve that I used to sit there sit but just leave for a while, ok, I sure they are rude and stupid and out of manage for there business, never access with them

The Wynn reeks of luxury. With my humble mid-western roots, it's one of those places that when I walk in, I can't help but think "I must be in the wrong place..." That being said, every once in a while it's nice to pretend, and staying at the Wynn will certainly make you feel like you're hot stuff. 

Even their basic rooms are incredible, and since it's a new hotel, you can expect everything to be in tip top shape. I did not experience a single problem during our stay: housekeeping, front desk, concierge, bellman.... all spot on. 

I am definitely an atypical guest for the Wynn  - as most of their patrons probably aren't terrified by $25 tables like myself. So I tend to just high tail it out of here when it comes to gaming. Only reason I dock it a star is the location: It's so stinking far north that if you don't want to play here and you are too cheap for cabs you are going to have quite a hike to get to just about anywhere. Come on Steve, I thought you had enough pull in this town just to tear down Bally's or something and build there? Would anyone really miss it? 

I was a bit underwhelmed by the pool as well, although the cabana with black jack tables is a nice touch.

This was my first trip to Vegas and my wife's second.  I had planned our itinerary so that we could visit the Wynn Casino since it looks great on Trip Advisor, the Wynn website, and all the reviews everywhere are great.    

Well it was as good as they say.    The place looks and feels ritzy.  The chairs at each slot machine are super comfortable and some even incorporate the games theme into the chair.   The air is clean and fresh - something a lot of casinos lack.   So just the overall feel of the place is high end.  I rate this as the #1 casino we visited with the Cosmopolitan second.    

I don't drink alcohol but like non-alcoholic beer and had been ordering it in Vegas.   As a non-drinker I used to roll my eyes at casino reviews where the primary emphasis was on drink service.   Now I understand that point of view.  Many of the places we visited, including the Encore, had terrible service, but the Wynn's waitresses were on the ball, very polite and helpful.  I was also impressed that instead of getting a plain O'Douls, the Wynn carries Buckler, Heineken's brand of NA.  So higher end verses average.  

The Red Card was okay, it's the Wynn's reward card.   Once you obtain 100 session points you can spin for a free prize. I got 10$ in slot play but hey it beats nothing.   Levi and Michael were both very helpful at the Red Card desk taking the time to explain everything to my wife and me.  

Overall great experience.   If we go back we will most likely stay at this resort and take advantage of all of its offerings.

Let me just start off by saying that although I am now a Californian, I lived in Vegas for about 30 years. I have stayed at a good number of hotels in this city. With that said, the Wynn is BY FAR the best hotel I have stayed at. The ambiance is luxurious, the rooms are always impeccably clean, the beds and pillows are the best ever and the customer service is beyond amazing. From that beautiful fragrance that greets you in the Tower Suites Valet, the VIP room with delicious goodies and the friendliest staff you could ever meet to the beautifully decorated casino. The Wynn never fail to impress and if I could shake Steve Wynn's hand I would. Best in Las Vegas.

as a returning guest I knew the Wynn was going to be great - sadly they put all my room charges onto my sister's credit card (we had 2 separate rooms) & when I asked that it be moved they wouldn't :-(  just refused, very disappointing, very frustrating & especially surprising  It really bothers me when a hotel can't or won't fix something for you

Ballin'!!  Love this place to stay or play.  I definitely try to stay here when i am in town.  This place is very classy with it's beautiful decor.  Also, club  XS is here!!  The buffet is not shabby at all...but i usually prefer to dine at their other restaurants in the casino.

We spent a nice week at the Wynn resort and really liked everything about it. The least we can say is that this hotel is gorgeous and very classy. The room was clean and confortable. However, if you are staying at this hotel, my advice would be to use the safe of course but also to secure your baggage with a lock when you're away from your room. I used a lock to secure my main baggage but didn't use any for my small cabin baggage and when we got back home, I noticed a little too late that a few small items that I had purchased in Las Vegas had disappeared and we were sure we didn't move them from the suitcase. I also noticed that at the beginning of my stay, housekeeper wouldn't take the tip that I left on the table but the last 2 days, the money was gone and it was okay but so was the small sign with the name of the housekeeper and the number of housekeeping that I could contact if needed. I thought it was strange. All in all, it was a nice stay and I'd definitely go back.

What a great hotel!! We stayed this past weekend with a bunch of friends in the Wynn Tower Suites and everything was perfect. I had never been to Vegas before so I wasn't sure what awaited me but this is as good as it gets. 
The suite was the most awesome suite one can imagine, with a beautiful interior, lots of wonderful details and a view of the Trump Tower, Treasure Island and the Mirage. At night, you get a full view of Las Vegas with the lights on, which is wonderful. It also had a rain shower, a private jacuzzi, a second bathroom and a very cozy bed. Also important: iHome to play music and charge my iPhone.
We ordered breakfast on the room both mornings and it arrived within 30 minutes and was both times delicious. The suite had its own dining area, so it was very convenient.
The service all over the hotel and especially the croupiers were all great.  They were genuinely friendly, all seemed to enjoy their job and were great fun, they knew when to be courteous, they knew when to be humorous.
The interior design with all the details in this place is incredible. I lost all my money but who cares if it's in a place like this.
Michael Jackson stayed here last weekend too (fun fact), not that we saw him...

We had a great time here with our friends and I would love to come back.

When it comes to seeking guidance, many people turn to God. Others turn to wise old great-grandmas or even psychics. Being an atheist\/cynic with a crappy grandma, I turn to my friends, and depending on what I'm seeking advice for, I have certain people lined up in mind as go-tos. So when it came time to figure out what hotels\/attractions I should visit for my first Las Vegas trip since I was 15 (I'm 24 now),  I turned to my good friend Jessica, who had moved from LA to Vegas sometime in the last couple years.

Now I'm a relatively transparent person; my likes and dislikes are pretty well known since I tend to talk a lot. Knowing my proclivity for class, style, and the company of people who speak in grammatically correct sentences, Jess suggested that I would probably enjoy the Wynn as my favorite Strip-area hotel, citing it's reputation for "elegance, cleanliness, and less smoke." Clean and low-smoke?! She really *does* know me!

Luckily, Jess was also tactful enough not to suggest I book a room there for my weekend trip, because although I have a taste for Van Cleef and Arpels, I operate on a Jewelry Exchange budget. So maybe all I could afford was the Westin via Priceline, but I'd be damned if I let that keep me from dressing up, driving down the street with my boyfriend, and sneaking in to the Wynn's pool as if we owned the place. (Hey, the Westin's pool is literally the size of a deck of cards. Cut a sheisty girl a break, kay?)

So after pulling off our 'let's sneak into the Wynn's pool and cabana!" heist not once but TWICE (I blend in w\/families with kids and room keys well; like a babysitter or aunt), we looked around at the gleaming water, perfect ratio of shade to sun, fully-stocked cabana bar and nearby poolside cafe, and decided that our Saved By the Bell scheming was DEFINITELY worth it.

If you have the means to actually stay at the Wynn, I'd highly recommend it. The amenities speak for themselves; I can only infer that the rooms must be just as nice and well-appointed. And if you don't? Make like Krissy M. and pretend to be rich for a day. Maybe you can't spend the night, but you can get into the swanky pool! Just get (tastefully) dolled up and try and blend in with a group as they get off the pool elevator. It helps if you're wearing designer shades and you pretend to be having an important conversation on a cell phone.

Many thanks to my friend\/wise grandma\/personal deity Jessica, who helpfully steered me away from my crackerjack pool and 3 star hotel and in a more classy, Krissy-friendly direction. ;-)

The Wynn Hotel and Casino is one of the top hotels in Las Vegas for two reasons. The employees do the little extra things that make you feel special and the place breathes class instead of oozing kitsch. If you're going to spend $30 extra to stay at a hotel in Vegas, the Wynn must be one of the first you check.  

 - The rooms will run you 2 bills and up which is just fine because the amenities and 600+ square feet are worth it when you are wanting a "better" vacation. 
 - Le Reve is a 4-star cirque-style show in the water. We sat in the third row, but the circular theater looked like every seat had a great view.
 - I'm not a golfer, but the course looks beautiful. If you can't have a room with a view of the strip, getting one of this course is nice.
 - Lakeside is a nice restaurant to enjoy the Lake of Dreams
 - The Buffet is especially nice for dinner on weekends or holidays.
 - Save money on taxis because the 3 nightclubs (XS, Tryst, and Surrender) at the Wynn & Encore are bumpin!
 - the Esplanades at Wynn has high-end shopping too rich for my wallet, but still a guy can dream, right?
 - The Wynn pool is heated and a true Vegas party pool
 - The Casino is classy. They still will take your money, but in $25-$100 chunks instead of $10-$20 bites.
 - Housekeeping is wonderful. Need something? Ask. Seriously. Be prepared to tip.
 - Even the valet was great as he recommended we just walk instead of ride to the Venetian and then gave us bottle waters for the 5-minute stroll.
 - The worst part of the Wynn is the ever present voice of Steve Wynn telling you how awesome he thinks the hotel is. At some point, he needs to let the property, service, style, and experience speak for itself, but until then we are stuck trying to find a way to change the channel or hit mute.

Even if you don't rake in dough at craps or baccarat, you'll feel like a winner at the Wynn Las Vegas.

I stay at Wynn every time I go to Vegas. I enjoy everything there: the vibe, the stunning interior, the huge pool and comfy rooms. Make sure to book the corner double window room with a gorgeous view of the Strip! I love falling asleep and waking up to that. 

The rooms have a big, fluffy bed and the bathroom has everything you need, including a magnifying mirror for your makeup and skincare. 

The restaurant that I enjoy the most there is Tableau, a cute French style breakfast\/brunch place. Try it, it's such a lovely experience! 

I really enjoy shopping at the stores in Wynn, the staff at Givenchy was really friendly and helpful.

During my visits to Vegas I walked around other hotels, but none of them could compare to Wynn, they gave me a slightly lousy vibe and the smell of smoke is crazy out of control in most. Not Wynn! It's just SO much better.

I can't wait to be back next month! Overall, I always had a flawless experience there, and I feel that it's not expensive at all for what you get.

Gorgeous hotel with amazing service, restaurants, and ambiance.

The hotel room is gorgeous and whenever I book a hotel, I check in the restroom first. The restroom is gorgeous, clean and I could not find a speck of dirt in the room! When I called room service for extra towels, blankets, and toothbrushes\/paste, they promptly delivered to our room with a smile even though it was 1 A.M. They even started a conversation which was great. Also, the maids and maintenance employees greet us good morning or night every time they see us. Even when we call in, the employees ask for our last names and greet us by "Ms." or "Mr." The service is what makes this hotel so spectacular. They answered our questions quickly, efficiently, and pleasantly. 

I love the atmosphere of the lobby, beautiful and gorgeous. I can never get enough pictures there!

Although the rooms are expensive, if you book at the right time and at the right website, you can end up getting a great deal.

So for some reason I am really interested in bathrooms. We went for drinks here before heading out to the bachelor(ette) party and I had "to go." I love high ceilings and I could have spent 30 minutes admiring the sinks and decor..... anyways... decent drinks, beautiful hotel... coming back for a peak when I return

This hotel exemplifies the new Las Vegas. No more theme hotels for me unless I bring the kids. This, my friend, is a hotel for adults.
I recently stayed in the tower suites. Living room, bedroom, huge bathroom and a terrific view. It was nice sitting back at night drinking a glass of wine and watching the vegas night. 

Great staff with plenty to do in and around the hotel property.
Looking forward to returning.

Stayed here 3 nights with a bunch of friends to celebrate some birthdays.  Rooms were very nice and beds were very comfy.  We upgraded to a panoramic view room an stayed on the 65th floor.  Not worth the extra $$$.  The view of the strip wasn't really that great. If wanna stay where their is a good view, I would recommend the Bellagio or someone more towards the middle of the strip.  

The pool area is like any other pool but they have areas for kids only and one for adults.  Heard the pool party is pretty killer but we didn't get a chance to go. 

As far as food,  the two deli shops suck!!  Way overpriced.  Roast beef sandwich + soda at one was $20. My wife had a $8 Tomatoe basil soup at the other. If you want fast food, I would recommend the food court across the street at the mall. 

We did also eat at the Chinese restaurant Red 8.  That was great! We had Pork Belly, Jelly Fish, some noodles and a veggie dish.  Overpriced of course cuz they can..Its Vegas.   But at least it was good..

Overall the Wynn is a very nice place.  Staff is always friendly.  Still doesn't beat Mandalay Bay only because they have a badass pool! Loved my stay though and would come back.=)

Stayed here recently. The place nickel and dimes you a little too much. Fitness Center Usage, 15$ .really. It small and not even that nice. Machines aren't cybex either and no free weights. 

The restaurants are good, but the actually hotel and services are lacking for certain. 

Better off in the newer properties, Cosmo, etc. For the quality of the hotel and tough location, its not worth it to stay here.

My best friend and I are quite particular with our private living quarter spaces so we did not know if we would be able to survive a five day vacation together. But we persevered and emerged closer than ever thanks to all of the comfy and large room amenities at the Wynn.

We both had plenty of space to spread out our makeup, clothes and shoes with room to spare. The beds were downright luxurious and came with lots of extra pillows to cuddle with at night. My hair and skin, scorched by the Vegas heat survived thanks to their never ending stock of coconut scented Molton Brown products. 

We barely had to leave the hotel for a good bite to eat because nearly all of the restaurants we tried were downright delicious (with special shout outs to Red 8, Andrea's and Allegro). 

The pool is large and private with tons of lawn chairs to lay out on. I appreciated their towel service and complimentary cucumber water as well.

 I was able to attend Annie K's wedding here and was really impressed by the attention to detail and the accommodation of the staff in the salon.

I'm not a gambler at all but had to walk through the space to get through my room -- compare to other casinos this was the least smokey and crowded.

Don't forget to sign up for the Wynn Insiders program online to get 15 - 30% off your stay! I will happily stay here again!

Amazing! It is by far my favourite casino, I almost don't mind losing money here. The whole place is just beautiful, not a detail was forgotten when they put this place together. The dealers are the friendliest in Vegas and the drinks are always excellent.
I play Poker Pai Gow there and have had the same dealers and pit bosses for the last few years.
I have never stayed at The Wynn just its sister casino The Encore, which is equally lovely.

I've stayed at the Wynn properties now nearly every time we visit Las Vegas. The service is top notch, rooms are always clean and the casino is laid out nicely. 

We visit the adult pool and cabanas during the day before our evening Vegas shananigans. That is all I am legally allowed to disclose.

Easily, my one of my favorite places to stay on the strip so far. The Wynn just keeps getting better too upon every visit. They're generous with their room comps and sales promotions, their room amenities are deluxe, there's great nightlife in-house (Tryst, XS in the Encore) and their selection of highly concentrated luxury stores are some of the best on the strip (Dior, Manolo Bhlanik, LV, Gucci, Tiffany's, etc.). Le Reve is wonderful, and the Ferrari showroom is another neat feature that is definitely worth a look. The Wynn just exudes class, sophistication, luxury and the right amount fun.

I struggled with giving them 3 or 4 stars, but at the end of the day service was impeccable (Jazmine, Berta, JJ, Richard, Jose, guy who flagged me a cab, chef who made the woman next to me a special vegan, gluten free meal on the fly) so I leaned toward 4. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was they have horrible phone and internet connection! My calls got dropped several times over two days. And since I was here for work, no bueno. If this was a non-related work trip, 5 stars. But for the love of technology you need better connections!

My first experience at the Wynn dates back a couple of years when my wife and I came here to eat lunch with my mother and stepfather.   We had a lovely lunch at 'Sugar & Ice' and, at the time, I thought it'd be nice to stay here.   Fast forward 2 years:  my father's visiting the US from Europe and we decide to do a post-modern post-nuclear-family weekend trip to Vegas with myself and my wife, my father and his girlfriend, and my mother and stepdad.   Yay!  Fun stuff!!
 
Rooms - The goddamn rooms in this place are absolutely stellar.   They easily compete with the Bellagio as far as the room and bed is concerned and I gotta tell ya... the bathroom probably takes #1 spot in my book.   TV in the bathroom *while* you're taking a bath?   check.   A bathtub so big you can have an orgy in?  check.   Shower with water pressure so fucking fierce it'll bitchslap your hangover into tomorrow?  check.   Seriously... that bathroom's got it all.   You can even pick up the phone while you're praying to the porcelain God.   How Vegas is that?

Pool - When I come to Vegas, it's a good idea to keep me away from the Casino (see below) so my wife and I thought we should plump down $400 and get a cabana at the pool for the day.   It's hella pricey, but I gotta say that was one sweet experience!   The hostess came by every 15 minutes to check whether or not we needed anything.  I felt like royalty!   The cabana's got a stocked fridge with complimentary beverages and a decent size flat screen TV if you wanna crank some tunes while catching some Rays.   Seriously, we just hung out my the Wynn Pool Jay-Z style, and that was hella sweet!   Still, I thought I'd go try my hand at the Blackjack table that sits poolside and got quickly reminded that I'm not a celebrity... One thousand dollars minimum on that table?   Hmmm.... yeah no.  Thanks but no thanks.

Casino -  Eat shit and die.  Fuck all the dealers.  They always steal my money when I play Blackjack.  Fuck you casinos, fuck you!

Dining - We ate at Boulud, Switch, and Sugar & Ice.   All three restaurants, while very much distinct in style, had some very good food.  Service varied with location but the dining at the Wynn is certainly good.  Even the food that we ordered poolside while at the Cabana was good.   It wasn't the best culinary experience ever, but it certainly proved as a capable way to mop up the many Vodka Red Bulls loitering in my stomach.

Vibe - I dig the vibe at the Wynn.   It's snobbish enough to filter out the ghetto bitches and twentysomething hipsters.   Yet it's not so snobbish as to feel like you're at a retirement home with a bunch of people waiting to die.   It's got class, but it doesn't have the fake-factor I've experienced at the Mandalay Bay.   I think I've just found my favorite hotel in Vegas!

For being a resort hotel with so many five star ratings, the Wynn does not seem to know what they are doing. I had a friend come to town with some of her friends and we stayed at the Wynn. We decided to go to the pool and ordered some food. One of the girls and I split the bill. Be careful. The gratuity is included, even for small parties. But they won't tell you that. 
I noticed my credit card was over charged. I have been back and forth with Shoba Mahtani for a month and a half and I STILL  have not received my refund. They acknowledge their mistake. But they can not seem to figure out how to issue a refund. FAIL.
Great place to stay in Vegas. Garden are beauty, food is good at Wazuzu, rooms are spacious with views on city and desert. I love it.

Hotel is okay, but very expensive. The shops are the same way, but I think that's to be expected.

Someone won $10 million at the hotel recently. I feel like their slots are not paying because of that. My whole party lost bad at the hotel.

It may be coincidence, but never know.

$150\/2 nights room offer to my dad from Wynn Las Vegas.

PROs:
1. Very attractive hotel.
2. Full of flowers and expensive furnitures.
3. Big room.
4. To die for bathroom.

CONs:
1. Expensive!
2. No Monorail Station
3. Staff and most guess were snobby
4. Buffet wasn't that great.
5. Tight and expensive slot machines.
6. A friend of mine said that they are really strict in damaging their carpet. They didn't allow stroller to be on the carpet... wtf! 

Will come back only and only if they offer me a nice price for the room.

Wow!... The Wynn is absolutely amazing.. The room was perfect with a gorgeous view.. Every morning we  opened the curtains (via electronic keypad device) to enjoy the view.. The casino has a lot of games to choose from.. The restaurants are amazing.. The decor of the hotel alone is something you have to see from the famous Popeye statue to the beautiful carousel made of flowers, you wont be disappointed.. If you open up a red card for the casino (player card) and accumulate a certain amount of reasonable points you get free vouchers to a meal.. In my case i accumulated enough points for 2 free meals for my husband and I..  We opted for the buffet breakfast and dinner ( yes its that good).. Late night dining is also available at a classy spot on the casino floor.. While you are a little ways down the strip its only a walk or cab ride away from other venues.. Its a nice walk in the morning, which is what we did to get or daily walk in before it got into the 100's out of the way..  The pool does not get too packed.. You are sure to find a lounge chair to enjoy the sun or just rent a cabana.. Lance who was there to help us with our cabana was awesome.. Very attentive.. We will definitely be back to the Wynn!

I'm a little torn on this because the property, including both the Wynn side and Encore side is great.  Great restaurants, casino, clubs, shops.  

The negative is that the Wynn tower is starting to show its age.  Room was a little basic with a small older tv.  No real extra amenities in a 'panaroma' room.  For the price, you'd do better elsewhere just room wise.  Also, no turn-down service even though its a 5-star hotel?!  

That said, its still a solid room and the property itself is just awesome.  Encore rooms are nicer though.

MAJOR WIN AT THE WYNN!

We took our son to the Wynn for his 21st birthday last weekend and I can assure you it was an experience we will not forget. 

1. Reservations through the marketing dept....perfect
2. Concierge's attention to detail and perspective before we even checcked in....outstanding
3. Arrival and check in (greeted promptly at the limo and very efficient and quick c\/i (john was amazing, we requested through marketing, a high floor and rooms close together(we all know how these requests usually go)....top floor(60th) and rooms right next to each other..perfect start.
4. Rooms were clean, extremely well appointed and an unbelievable view of the strip...even better start
5. Lunch at La Cave...excellent food (charcuterie plate and the pizza with the quail egg is the way to go here), great wine list...even better service
6. Casino time...this casino is gorgeous, well laid out, not smokey, and just has an overall cool, trendy vibe. Great music, great cocktail servers, great dealers, and most of all friendly, professional, classy, pit bosses. (Jimmy at the craps pit is the reason I wont play craps anywhere else. This gentlemen is an asset to the casino if he can deal with me and make me happy and laugh at 5 a.m.)...Thx Jimmy!!
7. Parasol Up is the classiest casino lounge in Vegas....trust me, we've been to most..Chandalier Bar is the only close 2nd.
8. Saturday brunch at The Country Club (not the jazz brunch, just standard menu Saturday 12ish). Some of the best food in Vegas, classy atmosphere,(dont settle for a table by the hostess stand, sit in the back room or at the bar for a magnificent view of the well manicured golf course and the waterfall). Perfect start to a day at the Wynn!
9. XS, young..old..in between...just do it..really! Not snotty and pretentious like most high end clubs in town. From the doormen to security to the bartenders and servers..first class all the way..(we even got to party next to Gronk and his brother...which is great when your son is a huge football fan and your at the club celebrating his 21st bday)..What a blast!! Jo at the concierge was fantastic our entire trip, and suggested we get our club passes from the concierge desk, which we did, and as a guest of the hotel we skipped the line and went straight in..passes were very reasonable...do this for sure! XS *****
10. SW steakhouse....WOW! Over the weekend we had dinner at "Cut" and "Bouchon"...Cut gives them a run for the money but SW is the real deal. We are from Austin and hard to impress when it comes to steak, but SW has the service, food, and ambience that you want before a big night out in Vegas. Perfect spot to get the party started and have a wonderful meal..SW*****

Excelent Stay at the Wynn! It is the Ritz Carlton\/Four Seasons of Las Vegas but better. The cool vibe, chic atmosphere, polished service are all reasons we will only stay at the Wynn. Thank you for a truly memorable experience..my son is ready to come back for his 22nd!!
Great job Wynn!!! See you soon!

I got a great deal on Priceline (surprisingly) for this hotel. Maybe that's why I am going to give it a great review! 
The room was spectacular. I was on the 54th floor and the view of the strip was terrific. The room was very clean and larger than I expected. The bathroom is delightful. I can watch TV while brushing my teeth or taking a soak in the ginormous tub.  
The only reason I'm taking off a star is because check in was horrible. I came here way before check in time also. The line wasn't even that long, but there were only a few open front deskers. Boo. 
I love the look and feel of this casino. Yeah, it is a maze like all of the other places but everything seems plush and well done. Nice.

The Wynn is beautiful!

The rooms are clean, nicely decorated and feature HUGE bathrooms.  The pools are sparkling clean and lovely, with good service.  Free water and fruits are passed around and you can order off their poolside menus.

We upgraded to the Wynn Tower, which got us access to a second level of pools that weren't quite as crowded.

I'd love to stay at the Wynn again!

Everything is outstanding from valet to check out. Rooms are insanely gorgeous, opulent. One of my favorite hotels in Vegas...and consistent every time! 
Words really are inadequate- just go and see for yourself :)

I've been coming to the Wynn for seven years now. It is the only place I stay on my business trips to Las Vegas. They make these trips a pleasure, something I look forward to. It's a lovely property, and the rooms are elegant, comfortable, spacious, quiet and thoughtfully appointed. The food is excellent and there are dining options aplenty. I'm vegan and let me tell you it is so very unusual (and appreciated) for me to be able to order a delicious late night veggie burger with a vegan chocolate shake off the room service menu. The in-house restaurants all have creative vegan options -- the opposite of the kind of perfunctory vegan dishes often found at high-end restaurants. But what sets The Wynn (and The Encore) apart is the level of service here. It's a modern hotel but with an old-fashioned approach to hospitality. Your every need is anticipated and accommodated, without any obsequiousness. The staff is simply attentive and on-point. On my most recent stay the concierge helped me recover a laptap that got lost at the airport. The staff seems to work as a team and they want you to have a wonderful experience. And so, we do. Some day I will come here purely to relax.

The best hotel in Vegas. Nothing comes close! Excellent service and everything is always impeccably clean, down to the casino bathrooms which always smell consistently good. I can't ever stay anywhere else.

Wynn is the pinnacle of Las Vegas hotels.  From the moment you walk inside your surrounded by an affluent host of shops, service, dining, and shopping.  The entire hotel and casino from start to finish can only be described as mesmerizing.

When you stay inside the hotel your treated like you were staying at a five star resort, which, is why this is a five star resort.  Anyone can tell you after staying in one of the Wynn rooms, they are special.  From your standard suite to the Tower and Penthouse suites this place is upscale and magical.

Restaurants are all exceptional and the showrooms and shows are only matched by maybe one or two properties on the strip.  When you really think about the other properties like Bellagio or Caesars and make a comparison, Wynn, delivers on all fronts and doesn't seem to lack in an area.

Just got back from a very relaxing vacation at the Wynn.  Loved the hotel.  It's absolutely beautiful inside.  From the fresh flowers everywhere to the intricately tiled marble floors.  Stayed in a corner room and had two large windows that overlooked the strip.  Amazing view, especially at night.  We ate at several restaurants in the Wynn and were equally impressed.  We also saw Le Reve and was blown away.  It's my new favorite show in Vegas.  It's almost as if Steve Wynn watched "O" and said let's make something 10x better.  We spent most of day at the pool which was very nice.  Sun and shade options.  We got great tans! Delicious fruity cocktails poolside.  I will definitely be back!

Beautiful and classy, with kind and helpful employees. Traffic- both vehicle and foot- can get crazy though. Definitely convenient if you have reason to go to the Encore as well since shops line a hallway connecting the two.

Great time at the Wynn. Large airy room, attentive friendly staff and great restaurants. Didn't have one borderline meal here, all very good to excellent. 
Usual problem with smoke smell everywhere, even in hallways remote from casino. Would have been 5 stars except for long waits to check in and out. I travel a lot on business and every hotel chain has expedited check-in and check-out except, it seems, Las Vegas Hotels. Why is this? Makes your last encounter with the hotel mediocre to bad and colors rest of experience.
Tip: When catching cab from airport ask drive to take you to hotel on strip via "cheaper route" or "non-freeway", or else use Google maps or Waze to track where he\/she is taking you. Saves $5-6 minimum.

My second time at the Wynn drew much dissatisfaction and criticism.  After my first trip there a couple of years ago, I absolutely loved it!  Of course, that was my pre-signature days.  We were also there to enjoy the holiday season and 200 bucks for this room was nice and i liked it a lot.  BUT after experiencing MGM's Signature a few times in the last few months, I can't help but not want to return to the Wynn again.

Yes, everything is luxurious... but the service that comes with it is sub par!  I also hate dealing with attitude when I'm spending so much money gambling at your casino only to realize that your comp system sucks as you're catered to only high rollers... and 4000 points a day @ $3 a point doesn't mean crap to my host.  I would have much rather pay for my own room at the Signature and get comped at the wonderful restaurants there.  Never mind the free room here.

We arrived to an overcrowded lobby past midnight - everyone and their gramma was trying to get into the club and was either obnoxious or drunk.  Checking in was relatively painless tho' I wish he would have asked if I preferred a lower or higher floor, closer\/farther away from the elevator.  No it usually wouldn't matter but it got to be a pain in the mornings sharing tight elevator trips with 48 other people trying to get to the spa level or check out ... taking too long to get to the casino floor.  Yes, the Signature has gotten me spoiled.

The pool is too small for that many people... the drinks much too expensive tho' the mango daquiri is excellent - even at that price :)  Service is slow but only because the place is huge and there are too few of them.

I'm not gonna' spend any more money at the Wynn.  I'd blow it you-know-where.  ...if you like the Wynn, you'd love the Signature @ MGM.

The Wynn was super convenient for our trip to Vegas since it has everything you could possibly want! We weren't able to visit the pool since we had unseasonably cold weather, but enjoyed the casino and dinner at Andrea's (technically the Encore, which is connected), and a night out at XS (also the Encore). The best part, however, was the room. We had the cheapest room since we were only staying for on nigh and had a packed itinerary, and it was still super comfortable with a tub and shower, two sinks, two TVs, desk, table, closet, safe, and large bed. We wish we'd stayed longer just to relax in our room!

This is my favorite place to stay when in Vegas for a variety of reasons. First and foremost, the pools at the Wynn and Encore (you have access to both) are basically perfect vacation pools - happening scene, respectable clientele and friendly service.  The casino is clean and well ventilated, the air seems fresh and there were never issues finding a suitable blackjack table.  There are several good dining options on-site, as well as some very swanky nightclubs that were quite popular. If you plan to visit one of the clubs, I suggest speaking to a guest host about your admission options (lines can be very long). The golf courses are immaculate.  The rooms are modern and bright with great views through windows that span the entire width of the exterior wall.  My only complaint is that because of the hotel's popularity, you can frequently run into crowds.

Oh, and the Peppermill Restaurant is nearby, the perfect offsite spot for a great breakfast.

The Pros: Pretty flower balls when you walk in. Nice pool area, but when we're in Vegas, we never go to the pool. Room service food was excellent.

The Cons:

NOISE. I couldn't sleep at the Wynn. This place is all about appearances. It LOOKS nice when you walk in, but it's poorly insulated. Our room shook every time our neighbors closed their door and it sounded like they were slamming it. Compared to our stays at the Aria, Bellagio, MGM - you can hear a pin drop. The other major noise issue was the wind. Silly, I know, but the wind outside was so loud I could NOT sleep. The Wynn told us it was their "windy season" and the desk lady commented she's a heavy sleeper so it doesn't bother her. I am a light sleeper, but my husband is an incredibly heavy sleeper and the wind and door slamming woke him up too. I've stayed at top floors in many Vegas hotels - I've never been kept awake by the wind whistling. I think the Wynn is just poorly insulated! 

GAMBLING SUCKS. Again, I'm used to MGM with a seemingly endless amount of tables to choose from. The casino is rather small and the table minimums are high. During the day, you will be hard-pressed to find more than one table under a $25 minimum. It's even difficult to find many tables to choose from in the $25 range. The table minimum is no problem for my husband, but I don't like to bet that high. The MGM allows me to bet lower and he can bet as high as he wants. We were there with a big group for a birthday this time, and this was a huge problem since most people were not wanting to bet that high during the day. MGM and Aria are much more accommodating to a group.

LOCATION. Again, I prefer the excellent location at MGM and Aria. When we want to venture out of the hotel, we've found it to be easy to walk to a ton of nearby casinos. The Wynn was not convenient for us. It's walking distance to Treasure Island? blech.

The Wynn is all about appearances and it falls so far short of the mark I can't imagine ever returning. Most importantly, I didn't sleep for 3 days because of the noise issues with this hotel. Don't believe that just because you're spending a small fortune to stay here you're going to get luxury. You're not.
The worst customer service I have encountered in a long time ! Undertrained staff . Completely ruined my trip . Will never stay at this property again !

Remember in Happy Gilmore how he had to go to his "happy place"?? The Wynn is mine, without question.  I love everything about this hotel, especially the fact that they're always playing Kaskade when I arrive - always!

I've stayed here about 4 times and the service is nothing less than stellar.  The rooms are nice and modern without being completely computer programmed (sorry Aria), and the beds are heavenly!  The whole theme of the place is like a grown up wonderland which is right up my alley, and the entrance is just so pretty! 

The best thing about staying here is you never have to leave.  There are tons of great restaurants and clubs within Wynn\/Encore, and the Encore casino is my favorite for blackjack.  Make sure to hit up Botero for an amazing dinner and Encore Beach Club for the ultimate Vegas pool party experience.
Mmmmmm what can I say , it's the Best nicest and beautiful Casino in Vegas.

Beautiful hotel and rooms.  It's a quieter hotel than some more centrally located at the middle of the strip, but there's still a lot going on to keep you entertained.  And it's a more mature crowd than the crowd at Cosmopolitan, which is nice if you want to get away from a lot more party goers, although Wynn has its share too.
- Decent sized casino floor
- Near mall
- Good bars, clubs & restaurants
- Better location than at the other end of the strip (The Hotel, etc), but still a distance away from more activities than others like Bellagio, Aria, etc.

Shower would not drain.  One of the sinks would not drain.  Bathroom light out.  Safe not working.  A\/C acting up.  Called down and these things were all fixed through out the day.  It would have been nice if I didnt have to call the front desk so many times every time I encountered something wrong.  I spent a lot of time calling, being put on hold and explaining what was wrong with my suite.

What I love about this resort: Great Beds! sooooo comfortable.  Friendly employees.  Great food! and we won $360 total on the penny slots!!! comp drinks while your gambling.  The pool is fantastic!!

I would have to say that the Wynn is a nice looking hotel, but bad management. I was staying at the Wynn a few days ago on a Prepaid R.S.V.P. and when I arrived they told me in order to check in I would have to let them Hold a 300 dollar a night cash deposit or 200 per night credit card deposit. I informed them that I don't have funds like that for them to hold and they said that it was that or I would have to stay somewhere other than Wynn. I got a manager and he told me the same thing. I had to end up staying at the Embassy suites where I got much better service and did not need to hold a Security deposit. I think a security Deposit is something that a Budge motel would charge it's guest. I would not recommend staying at the Wynn. I will also instruct my Business partners, colleges , and friends to not stay at the Wynn. The Wynn need to take a look at that Stupid policy.  DON'' stay at the Wynn, because They will RipYou OFF.

The hotel is pretty. Most beautiful in Vegas. That's no doubt. Restaurants, shops and entertainment are luxurious. Rooms are spacious, comfortable, have nice views, and service is friendly. 
One problem that people post very often about Wynn is that, lower floors are able to hear the noise from the nightclubs at night. Based on my experiences, I've stayed there a couple times, in lower floors and I did not hear a thing. (Yes, i was facing the golf course and yes, I think it was Skrillex who was playing in XS that night). 
Other problem people complain a lot about the hotel, is that they charge an expensive, "secret" resort fee for the uses of pools, spa, etc. 
Once again, based on my experiences, I can tell you that the resort fee is expensive, but it is no secret. From the moment you arrive to the registration area, staff will ask you if you agree to pay the resort fee. Let's not forget this is a luxury hotel, and even though I think the resort fee is expensive, it is very well worth it. 
Those are the problems people post very often, other complains include: long lines, security, etc. All I can think of, is that maybe those people had bad luck and experienced a not very enjoyable stay, because overall, the hotel is prepared to give the ultimate vegas experience. 
My Tip: This is a hotel that has a lot to offer, but in order to do that, your budget has to be prepared. It is not an ideal hotel for people who are looking forward to save money or buy a shirt that is not above 1000 dollars.

we just stayed there 8\/1\/-8\/3 and loved every minute we were in the hotel.
the moment we walked into the registration area, we were greeted right away and Martin helped us with our reservation.  He gave us two options as we arrived at noon and the check-in was to be at 3pm or something like that.  16th floor or the one on the 58th floor with the view of the city...which he recommended and we look.  awesome view from morning to night.  the room was facing strip so at night, the lights of the city glowed.  one of their wall, was the whole window, can you imagine the view.
everyone who worked there made you feel so VIP.  from the maids who paid extra attention of the junk i left in the bathroom and organized it to the valets who had conversations with you to make sure your stay was good.  the concierge desk was particular the best ppl to work with for anything.  we had two requests...moving our dinner reservation at Switch to another time and checking into our flight.  Brenden did both for us with no issues, even if there were ppl in back of us who also needed help.  he didnt rush us and took his time communicating w\/ the restaurant and printing our boarding passes.
the hotel is immaculate and the attention to detail in every part of the hotel cannot be surpassed.  
we got a great deal from Cosctotravel.com with air, hotel and shuttle w\/ $75 credit toward food\/drinks at the hotel.  We cannot ask for more.  didnt pay too much nor did we pay too little but what we paid was less than what we got.  I left feeling so VIP, so special and will be coming back again and will stay here every time.

BEAUTIFUL hotel. I've been to most hotels on the strip and I just can't get enough of this place. The suites are to die for and the room service... Fantastic! I managed to snag a deal for the weekend for a massive suite... Two queen sized beds, kitchen, monstrous t.v., huge jacuzzi tub, beautiful standup shower. I want to live here!!
Currently my favorite Vegas hotel to stay and gamble. The right amount of everything.

Great place to wine, dine, stay and play.  I try to make it out to Vegas at least once every quarter.  Work hard, play hard.  The staff at the Wynn do things right.  You can't beat the location.  My wife loves the shops as well as the spa.  I can't wait to get back.  Great sized suites and you can't beat free.  You're sure to see a celebrity or two.  My wife and I have seen a few in our last couple trips.

I recently went to go to Vegas for two reasons:  1) to see my very favorite band Duran Duran and 2) because I needed to reclaim Vegas.  

It has been about 10 years since I went to Vegas.  I used to go every year when I was married.  It was a thing for us.  He even proposed to me there at the Stratosphere and we always stayed at the Mirage.  We even went there after our wedding to honor Vegas with our nuptials. That was our spot.  BUT a year after our daughter was born, it came to light that there was someone else in our marriage.  He left. Married her.  And because he is unoriginal and a creature of habit, they now frequent the Mirage.  Tacky.  Classless. 

So...it was kind of a big deal for me to reclaim Vegas.  I had to do it for me.  It would have been convenient to stay the Mandalay because that is where DD was playing, but I wanted to do it bigger and better.  I chose the WYNN.  And boy, oh boy...did I choose well.  

The hotel is top of the line.  The dÃ©cor, the details, the flowers, the shops...all top of the line.  They decorate that atrium in the front with live flowers for the merry go round and the hot air balloon.  Amazing.  Gorgeous.  Everyone that works there is professional and nice and happy (happy that you are there to spend your money-lol).  Their rooms are very nice:  floor to ceiling windows, electronic curtains and lights, a tub to fit a small family...and I happened to take 2 bubble baths just I've never been in a tub that size.  The bed...mmmmm...very comfy and luxurious with their sheets and mattress and pillows.  Oh. My. Oh. Yes. 

My only complaint was that I went to bed at 0300 on a Friday night and I could hear the bass from Encore's outdoor pool\/night club spot.  Seriously.  We were on the 25 floor or something like that, so we weren't too close to it.  I couldn't fall asleep.  So when we go back there...cuz we will, we'll have to request a higher floor or to face the strip instead of the golf course.  

If I could live here, I would.

Ive made this place my second home when in Las Vegas. Ive stayed up and down the strip and this place is definitely the cleanest. I saw the cleaning crew doing their magic one day and i was impressed. They actually move all the furniture after each guest and clean behind everything. Literally!!! Obviously cost more than other places but at least you know you wont find a used condom in one of the drawers. And the service is amazing. Definitely makes you feel like your on vacation. After all if your gonna spend some money you might as well get what you paid for. Bring some nice bottles of wine and splurge for the salon suite if your planning on having guests. Otherwise the parlor suite will do just fine.
My ultimate favorite hotel in Vegas! It's just simply the best hotel to stay at if you want ultimate luxury!

From the outside Wynn and Encore look beautiful. People are pleasant when you check in and then you are screwed. Our first room was beautiful with 2 panoramic windows with a clogged sink which was not looked at for over 5 hours. I would recommend asking for this room, it on the high floors facing and closest to TRUMP

Front Desk and Housekeeping wanted to conduct an interview to determine if they should move us or keep us in the same room. 

 After much complaining we are finally moved to another room which lacks hot water for shower which in turn is fixed after over an hour by housekeeping.. i mean for fooks sake, even a damn motel has running hot water..

Complain to hotel manager about cold water and he wants to run an investigation to determine our claim, this mind you that we informed him that the plumber did measure the temperature of water to confirm that it was cold. Only thing he can do is give us a $40.00 comp

I love to stay at Wynn. When I get the VIP free rooms and Free plays, I usually go. They gave me up to three nights stay each time. Last time I went in July, They gave me 3 nights stay and $150 free gambling money! Now thats VIP style for someone who doesn't gamble that much. 
I love their ambiance. It's elegance makes you feel like you are in Europe, or perhaps just one of the best in Vegas. When I'm there it's either gambling or on the strip so never took advantages of the pool, spa or the fine dinnings. 
The rooms are contemporary style with electronic curtains, flatscreen wall tv with music and mood swings background, huge bathroom with the toilet in its own little room, a standing shower and a bath tub, ooohh.. not to forget their beddings... sateen eqyptian cotton sheets and pillows. makes you feel so warm and cozy and guarantee a great night rest. You can also buy their hotel amenities and beddings at one of their shop cals NVLV.  

Their Toiletries is called bambu. They sell it at the gift shops.. pretty expensive. so Take advantage of the useages. ;)

I'm only giving it a 4 star because I like more of the elegance style, like Venetian more then the contemporary. At the price you are paying you would think its a bigger room like the Venetian rooms, with a living room and a pull out couch. 
But overall its a great and luxurious ambiance and decor.

Wynn Las Vegas represents what a 5 Star Resort is all about.  Every detail in this hotel has been experimented with, thought about, and perfected through years of experience and knowledge from the Wynn team that built Mirage, Treasure Island, Bellagio and now Wynn and Encore Las Vegas.  

The aspect that separates Wynn from the rest of the 5 Star resorts in the area (Venetian\/Palazzo, Aria and Mandarin Oriental) is the level of personal service and attention you receive from every Wynn employee.  From the housekeeping staff to the Blackjack dealers, their job is to make your stay as comfortable as possible and to address any need you might have.  

Another aspect of this hotel that is touched upon in several reviews is the atmosphere throughout the hotel.  The level of detail is over the top with the freshest of flowers throughout the resort, the spotless carpet in the Esplanade and Casino floor, the polished marble in the public bathrooms and the ornate and very expensive furniture found throughout the hotel.  Roger Thomas (head of Wynn Design) has spared no expense in decorating this hotel with pieces that are so unique yet so unassuming that there is something always to be discovered.  A table or chandelier at Wynn isn't just a typical piece that you'd find at Pottery Barn, most of these pieces have either been designed in house, commissioned or purchased at auction for your enjoyment from many places throughout the World.

The Resort rooms (not the Tower Suites) are phenomenal!  Floor to ceiling windows, electronic light and window shade control and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on are just a few highlights of the standard Resort King.  While the amenities go even further in a Tower Suites room, the standard Resort King holds it's own quite well. 

The Wynn (and Encore) represents the Best in Las Vegas, period.  Staying here is an experience like no other and I can assure you that you will not be disappointed.

Wonderful Place to Get Pampered"

Stayed at the Wynn from June 30, 2013 through July 9, 2013. The entire hotel staff were the most courteous people ever. Always treated us like we were special. This is the second time we've stayed at the Wynn, but this time was the best ever. The room was spectacular, the amenities such as the gym were the greatest, the pool was superb and the service at all the locations was superior to any other we've experienced. If you want to enjoy Las Vegas and be pampered the Wynn is the place to go. However, on a separate note there is one down side and this is the Casino.

The Casino comps are virtually non-existent for the average player and do not promote good business client development. The "Casino Host" was not customer service oriented and did not make any effort in promoting future patronization. As I stated before, the Wynn is the best hotel ever and I'd stay there again just to enjoy the ambiance, amenities, and the fine restaurants. 

Room Tip: Try to stay on the 28th through the 60th floors facing the strip. Excellent views!!!! 

Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple

I live in Las Vegas and I must say that the wind is my favorite hotel. The hotel grounds are impeccable and first class all around. The lower parasol bar is a great spot to enjoy a craft cocktail or other beverage and view the North Show water display. It's a great place to chill. The upper parasol allows cigar smoking and an excellent selection of drinks. The lobby is beautifully appointed. The pools are stunners. The night clubs excellent. The shows are great and the showrooms first rate. I was sorry to see the Show Stoppers extravaganza come to an end. It was one of a kind. The food is pricey. I'll leave it at that. There are many many choices. The staff is well trained, professional and friendly.

This review is not as a guest, but as an admirer.  This was my final destination in my strolling escapade of the Strip from Excalibur.  What a beautiful hotel, thankfully absent of any theme, but just classy and oh so chic.  

I enjoyed wandering the lobby and taking in the view of the environs and outrageous restaurants (primarily Bartolotta Ristorante Di Mare and Parasol Up Parasol Down Lounge).  Just brilliant decor dripping with sophistication, all made more dramatic by the chill cabanas and breathtaking waterfalls.  

As far as ambiance goes, this is so 5 stars!  How can I dare go back to my Excalibur digs knowing this heaven exists!

#Yelp 365:  047\/365

This hotel could of received the 5 stars if I stayed for a night. Arrived at 1:30am on a Memorial day weekend as I checked in am told that they were completely booked but would check with the on duty manager since they saw I pre-paid for 3 nights, after approx. 20mins. which seem as 2hrs. due to my antsy 9mo. old boy I start to become impatient manager comes out tells me that they thought I wouldn't be coming for the first night and my room was given out but they were going to place me for the night in the only room available a Villa allegedly the biggest of the 5000 rooms over 2000sq.ft. with its own private pools etc... The villa was gorgeous 3 bathrooms, steam bath, massage room, living room, bar, jacuzzi, private heated pool, and other amenities all was good then. The following afternoon I was moved to another room and when I arrived there it wasn't as I requested, so I had to wait a while longer to get another room available did I mention with an infant, finally was taken to the correct room located on the 33rd floor with an excellent view of the golf course not bad untill night came that's when I was truly disappointed I could hear the music from the bottom level night club the XS, as night falls they turn a pool area into a club is nice except the  that I could cleary hear the music in my room on the 33rd floor. That was not expected due to been one of the newest high end hotels on the strip is real lamentable.
Gorgeous hotel, we were staying i'n a beautiful suit, and we had great time, treated as Queen & King, great service

Perfection!  I have yet to stay here, but this is my favorite casino to lounge around at.  The place is so nice and seems to have much more class than most of the other casino's in Vegas.  Steve Wynn did it right when he build this place!  Not much more can be said that hasn't already been said.

i love the wynn!! plus, its even better when you go through hotwire :)

the rooms are really spacious and they have the cafe downstairs thats open when you are stumbling back to your room and drunk and hungry!  macaroons while drunk? best thing ever!!
The best hotel on the strip. The Beach Club is amazing. Their day club events are great and they have great djs lined up. Even when I don't stay at the Wynn I end up at the Wynn.

Beautiful, big rooms with spectacular views of the Las Vegas strip. The window shades and lights are controlled by panels at the door and beside the bed, which is not only cool, but very handy. The bed and furniture are very comfy, the shower is strong, and the wireless internet works well. The only drawbacks are the wall-mounted safe, which is too small and narrow to put a laptop in, and the ridiculous, $25 charge for putting anything in the room refrigerator. There is also a warning that you will be charged for any item you take out of the refrigerator for longer than 60 seconds. As for the casino itself, it is big and luxurious...the pool is heated and huge and ringed with very comfortable, padded chaise loungers. There are plenty of nice restaurants but avoid the buffet, but the food is truly awful, bordering on inedible, far below the standards Ive come to expect from past experiences at other Wynn resorts.

Wynn is by far the most classiest hotel\/casino. I have stayed at almost all of the 4-5 star hotels at Vegas but none of them come close to Wynn's level. XS and Surrender are great clubs, their restaurants are amazing (SW Steakhouse), the rooms are spacious with good views. I always stay at the Wynn no matter what.

Unfortunately my stay at the Wynn was not as great as I was expecting it to be. Last time I came to Vegas I had stayed in a different hotel, but spent most of my time gambling & partying at the Wynn & so I decided to book it for my next trip. This trip I decided my stay would be more relaxing; I'd go to a few shows and drink at hotel bars instead of clubbing. 

Well when I tried to go to bed at 2 AM I could hear the music from the club clearly in my room. This happened both nights and I was on the 22nd floor. Other friends who were staying on the 25th and 34th floors were able to hear the music in their room each night too. I mentioned this when I checked out & the front desk attendant said to request a room with a lower number next time. Upon check in I had requested a room on a higher floor, but they were unable to accommodate my request. Also, the beds and the pillows were extremely uncomfortable...I was surprised because this is supposed to be a 5 star hotel, but the beds\/pillows were WAY more comfortable when I stayed at the Palazzo. In addition to this the bed was supposed to be a king sized, but I swear it was a king...I have a king at home and that definitely was not a king.

Despite all of this, I do think the hotel is absolutely gorgeous. I love the hot air balloon and carousel art creations they have inside...they're absolutely stunning. There is a lot of great options for food in the hotel. My favorite is the Wynn Buffet! It's a bit pricey, but totally worth it! You can add on unlimited mimosas for $19 to the buffet meal price. To save some money we drank a ton at brunch and were drunk by the time we were going to go to the pool and didn't have to order $15 dollar drinks. 

Make sure to check out the pools. We had a wonderful time relaxing all three days at the pool. You'll have to get up early if you want a spot next to the water. We showed up at 11 one day and it was already crowded without any spots. We had to sit in the back by the towels until someone people left thankfully. We did notice several high class escorts trying to pick up drunk men at the pool too.

Like another reviewer said, the room deserves 3 stars and the hotel itself and amenities deserve 4 stars. I was surprised to see a ton of families staying here. I'd probably recommend a different hotel for families with children. Maybe the Bellagio or Caesar's Palace?

This Incident occurred in Decemberm but I finally have the time to write about it. We had previously stayed at the Wynn before to celebrate our anniversary with my wife. We were so impressed that we were treated like Royalty that this time we chose the best Hotel in Vegas even though I'm not a rated gambler at the Wynn. I chose to give my wife the time of her life. Everything was flawless, we were impressed by the chocolates and the well wishes card. I told my wife, Mr. Wynn doesn't play game he's a piece of Vegas history and he delivers the best service ever, makes other's looks like amateurs. We enjoyed the Cajun chicken wings, and I have so far never tasted any chicken wings any better than those in my entire life. Everything was flawless with the hotel. Security was more than happy to guide us in the right direction to where we wanted to go. I was so impressed that I would surprise my wife and take her again for her birthday which was a few weeks away. The flatware was outstanding and flawless. I am unsure about the towels, some look a bit on the creamy side and some look nice and new. Maybe it's time to update the towels.

This time I decided to amaze my wife with another stay at the Wynn, I stayed and relaxed and enjoyed our room most of the time and walked the street for some fresh air and random live entertaintment.  Our stay was as extravagant as our first stay. The flatware from the first visit was once again perfect and the yellowy towels were less than my first time. As well, the hot water ran out or was not working for a good thirty minutes or so, just when I was about to shave. We were so enchanted by the view of the golf course and I could feel safe because I could see my Hummer from my window. We were so in love with the Wynn that we decided to stay and extend another night. We were made aware that I had to be by the downstairs desk by three p.m. to have new cards reassigned and to process my card again. The line was so long that even other attendants were serving us water. I was so frustrated that I considered just leaving. My wife even called me from my room worried if everything was okay, and I told her that it was really busy and that I was next in line.
I was tired of standing and I just wanted to go to my room and relax. I finally was greeted by my check in host "Edwin" and he greeted me and I was in the middle of explaining to Edwin that I was extending my day for one more day, when I begin to see Edwin lose attention away from me and roll his eyes to his left (completely ignoring me and let me talking to myself). The gentleman who was in front of line just ran up from beside me and invaded my personal space without excusing himself like if I was non existant to both him and Edwin. It took me two seconds that Edwin totally disregarded me and had left me talking to me self, that humiliated me and I felt like walking away. Edwin took a good five minutes ignoring me and addressing whatever this gentleman's questions were. I had to wait five minutes for his additional questions.
I was shocked by the level of rudeness of both Edwin and the guest, (Edwin could had asked this guest to please wait a minute while he assisted me as he was doing but he decided to ignore me).
Edwin's reintroduction was "so where were we Mr. M*******?" I asked him, what was this guest's issue he almost trampled me and disregarded that I was speaking with Edwin and he come and just barges right in-between my conversation in such a rude manner. To my astonishment! Edwin's reply made my blood pressure go up (I have a genetic heart defect) I asked Edwin what was that all about, and his response was, "well he had multiple reservations, he had three rooms, and he's a business owner". That really unsettled me because I could feel my heart palpitate. Edwin considered this gentleman more important than me because he was a business owner with three reservations. WOW! I'm a business owner with one reservation and an investor. I did not address the issue I proceeded with Edwin and left back to my room feeling disrespected. I later called and spoke with a front desk manager named Yuri regarding this matter, she sounded really busy and assured me that everyone is equal at this resort and that there was no excuses for Edwin's behavior. Yuri advised me that she would have a talk with Edwin. That was the end of it. 
After that experience I am not sure if the Wynn is the right place for me. 
I have been to Vegas twice since that incident at the Bellagio where the towels have the hotel logo and are all white. I game there and average a hundred dollars a bet in roulette and I put in more than four hours a day. I can turn five hundred dollars into twelve hundred in less than two hours. My host can verify that. I am disappointed with the Wynn and was looking forward to another magical stay. Oh and thank you for telling me other guest's personal business Edwin.
This is our 2nd time staying here.  We love it! The decor is amazing, the staff is helpful, really have enjoyed ourselves again!

stayed her with my husband for a weekend getaway......


super fancy lol something we aren't use to. made us actually feel really uncomfortable.  our room was nice, we got a horrible view :( 


over all it was nice and if you have the money go crazy as for me i prefer a more humble hotel

Nice lobby with beautiful mosaics in the floor. They definitely spent some serious cash! Awesome light show at night on the huge waterfall (you have to be seated at the bar or the SW Steakhouse restaurant to see it). The employees were all friendly and accommodating. 

The location can be a positive or negative. It is not on the main drag area of the strip (it will take at least 20-30 minutes to walk to where all the action is).

Stayed at the Wynn three times now and its always been a fun experience. Today at the registration however- a guy named Jarrod was super- UNfriendly and led to a bad start to a fun Thanksgiving holiday- I hope they find cheerful crew and not someone uptight like Jarrod.

Stayed here back in 2009, and now I'm forever spoiled when it comes to Vegas hotels. Previously I had stayed at TI (2000), Paris (2001), Bally's (2002-2004), and then Bally's again this year. 

The rooms are HUGE and the windows are floor-to-ceiling. We had a view of the Wynn golf course and the Northern end of the Strip (if you looked closely, you could see Circus Circus down the road). 

The casino is not that big but the atmosphere is nice. The restaurants are all great. We got a package deal through Expedia (I stalked it a bit to get a low price, hehe) and ended up paying like $119\/n and $200-250 for airfare (from Detroit) which was a great deal.

My only complaints about it was that the pool was closed for renovations (they told us we could use Encore's pool, but of course we did not ... it was Feb. anyways so wasn't that warm) and we had a $100 dining credit EACH that we thought we could use at Okada, but it turned out we couldn't. That's still the most expensive meal I've had in my life, to this day, but also was very good, fortunately.

(moral = read the fine print, I guess!)

I would definitely stay at Wynn again, although now it has some competition from Aria, Cosmpolitan, etc. (the "new kids," at least since 2009) ... I checked all of those out on my recent trip there in January 2013.
The overall nicest Las Vegas resort.  Can't beat the combination of ambiance, food, gambling, entertainment, and class.

We had the pleasure of staying here for 4th of July weekend, and we are happy to say that we loved the experience! The service was top notch, the best we've ever experienced in a vegas hotel.
Our room was beautiful, and extremely comfortable. The entire staff were friendly, and accommodating. The pool is wonderful, and the poolside service is unmatched. We're definitely coming back!

My fiancÃ© brought me here on our trip to Vegas and I completely fell I love with this place, I loved loved the garden and the flowers and everything about this hotel. We stayed at the encore suites and ahhh so beautiful and luxurious!! My new fave hotel to stay at in Vegas!

Wynn is not a hotel that I would chose to go gamble at or stay in, unless I got a free room...lol I don't find many slot machines that I like & if you sit at any of their bars to play on their video poker machines & want to get a comped drink well forget it.....this casino does not comp drinks for the players....I know!! I was like WHAT???? I didn't even get a reason on why they don't do this. Every other casino bar I've gone into not affiliated with Wynn does. It's a beautiful casino to look at inside. I've never stayed here due to the over priced rooms. I had a friend who stayed & I saw the room & I have to say the rooms at Bellagio are better & not priced as expensive as Wynn charges. 
I went to the Wynn tonight to attend a seminar & I used valet. I asked the valet guy if he knew where the conference was located that I was attending, which he did. Kudo's to him but when he tried to tell me how to get there I couldn't understand what he was saying. I even asked him more then once & then just shook my head yes & pretended I understood. Unfort. his English was very poor which makes it hard for customers who don't speak his language to understand what he's saying, but what really upset me was when I went to go pick my car up from Valet. It was very busy & moving slow. I heard a valet guy yelling out a name that was not mine & I could barely see the car due to another car blocking it. I tried to get a better look at it thinking it may be mine because I had already waited about 20 minutes & noticed it was mine. I went walking over & had to yell out to the valet guy because he was driving away. I told him that the name he yelled out wasn't mine & proceeded to tell him what my last name was. He didn't even say sorry his response was "that's the name on the ticket." OK so the guy I dropped off my car with not only has bad English but apparently bad hearing too. I even had to say my name more then once which isn't a hard one. If you don't understand someone's last night or don't have a clue to spell it then you should ask Mr Valet guy. Due to his mistake it could of resulted in a longer wait if I wasn't paying attention & valet could of re-parked my car & they would of had one mad customer. Get it together Wynn employees!! 
The conference room was nice (Chambertin), with a nice & comfortable set up with great food. The lasagna was delicious & their tomato, mozzarella salad was to die for!!! 
The registration line & food line was confusing though, I felt like those two were not very organized. I found myself standing in the food line thinking it was the registration line until I got up to the registration table. Not sure if this was Wynn's set up or the people running the conference. Plus the food was in the middle of the hallway too....not the best place to set food up. It would of been nice if there were some signs posted thru out the casino indicating where to go for the conference considering there was more then one going on tonight.

Worst costumer service for a club. They don't give a Damn about you. Obviously it's just to make money, which I understand but they do not take care of you at all. Even if you have money. No warnings, no nothing and they will kick you out. I'm not going to come back.

Comped, 3 nights.
Day = pool with pineapple mojito... heaven (but watch out they are $15 a pop)
Night= anything.

Not many if any places can match the opulence of the Wynn.  Just walking in is like being slapped with a golden gauntlet, yeah it hurts but the good kind of hurt that you want more of.

Yeah I knew I was going to leave broke, and I didn't care.

Stayed here for two nights at Wynn corner view. Even with this fantastic view and elegantly decorated room, I had one of the most horrific experience in Vegas tonight. I was mocked and ridiculed by the slot machine floor manager. I won't be coming back to Wynn thanks to this omniscient guy, who I can't remember the name of. Now here's my story of being ridiculed by the hotel staff.

My first night at Wynn, I sat at a table to play Blackjack. The dealer requested me to provide an ID for the age verification, which was a bit odd, but I took it as a compliment. (27 - turning 28) I gave her my expired license (I'm currently not eligible to reinstate it until next month), and the table manager of the night requested me to provide another id. This also was perfectly reasonable, so I did tell her that I'll bring my passport and be back. No harm here. I know the law. I brought the passport, and upon presenting it, I was asked if I would like to create a "red card", which is Wynn's playing membership card. She stated that I could use that as a form of my identification. She specifically told me i won't have to carry the passport around, because my passport will be in there system. Knowing that I would be playing tomorrow, and even more in upcoming years, it sounded perfectly reasonable to get one - at least up to this point, so I consented to the terms (verbally), and was given the "red card." I played shortly and went back to my room. The Red card benefit -replacing id- ended up being partially misleading. Real story unfolds.

Now the 2nd night was when the vegas experience went dreadful. I know I am over-exaggerting here, and becoming a bit verbose, but bare with me. Tonight, my wife joined me to play Casino, so we decided to play slot. I took my red card and cash to play. While I was playing, the waitress came by and asked us if we want to order drinks. I ordered one (first drink of the night), and she requested our couple to present our ids. Because of the information that I was given last night I gave her the "red card," and my expired license.  She told me that she cannot run validation via red card. I told her about the last night story, and she said she will check with someone else (a slot machine manager).

Now this cocky manager came, and the story gets interesting. He told me the same information given by the waitress that they cannot Id me with my red card. I told him the same story that I told the waitress. He didn't listen and kept on repeating the same thing, which was bit upsetting. In addition, he said identifying via red card is absolutely not possible. I asked then why I was given the misleading information, and why I ended up providing my passport to be registered to their system. He then jokingly said, "well because the red card provides wonderful benefits." My initial responses were acquring justifications around why I was given the wrong information. He then reassuring said "no one on Wynn's floor would have given that information." Then I reasserted him that my passport is registered, and I don't have any incentives to lie. I stay at Wynn, so it's just a matter of time to grab my passport. I actaully had to state these facts MULTIPLE times, because he would turn deaf on me. In between he ridiculed me by exampling some elementary facts about identity. After my persistent effort to convince him to check their system, he unwillingly agreed to check again.
