Because the Wynn was such a major buzzkill, I headed back to the Encore where just the feel of the place (and the always impressive female staff and club crowd) hit me like a Red Bull for a second wind.

Maybe the Wynn is now just for older guests who want their gambling, drinks and dining accompanied by plenty of peace and quiet. If this is the case, why the heck does this crowd travel to Vegas in the first place? How many times can you look at the Bellagio fountains, watch yet another Cirque show and ride that new ferris wheel that the Linq tells its employees NEVER to call a "ferris wheel" before you realize you would have been better off staying home and simply going to the movies after dining out at Texas de Brazil?
Marie in the ticket office is amazing! I want to deal with people like her every day! Her charming smile and "can do" attitude made me leave a very happy customer! Kudos to Marie!

I love Wynn, room and service is very nice, Spa was wonderful. I am still trying to get that wall color to my place because really it makes your skin tone look so pretty. So I just sit there in the bathroom all day looking at my self and singing "I feel pretty oh so pretty and GAY......!!!!" LMAO

My gf and I had a romantic weekend here.

Yes, the room is very stunning and took a hole out of our pocket.  The hallways itself was already making the walk special.  Once inside, wow.   Bed and pillow were very soft, probably egyptian? 800 tread? Obviously, better than what we had at home.  If you have kids, don't let them play around the mini bar.  Everything is weight sensor on there.  I like the set up, L shape couch with a flat screen that turns to view on the bed or couch. 

Ladies, my gf loves the bathroom.  Very nice and roomy.  Has a little seat that you can sit on and apply make up with a circular lite mirror. Duel sinks.  Your welcome.

We had a deal on the booking.  2 night stay, $50 in gaming, 2 tickets to Le Reve = $500.  Not bad since one night at Wynn is around $299?

Hospitality is very wonderful.  They assist you the moment you come into the lobby area.  Checking in is simple and you can hardly call it a line since we only waited about 3 mins.

Sorry to be the spoiler in a long list of happy 4 or 5 star reviews, but I seriously cannot give Wynn any more than 3 stars considering my vist there.  While the hotel and the rooms are luxurious, customer service isn't as great and things just aren't at the level you would expect a Steve Wynn hotel to be at.

Check-in, where the hotel should be trying to make its best impression, was miserable here.  The reception area looks pretty, but the individual lines are confusing.  What was the worse thing about check-in was the hopeless customer service.  We had arrived early by about an hour and were told that in order to get two rooms together, we would have to wait until 3 pm.  Fine with us...I just wish that they could have directed us to someone who could hold our luggage while we waited out that one hour.  There are no seats anywhere near reception, unless you count that little bar out in the veranda overlooking the waterfall and "lake."  Even then you had to have a one drink minimum to sit out there.

We check back at 3 pm, only to be told that only one room was ready.  The other room didn't become available until 5:30 pm - way later than what was initially promised to us.  That room had wet carpets from a recent cleaning.  We complained and they moved us to a different room on another floor, which had a TV that didn't work, a restroom light that was burned out, and missing glasses.  So after a full afternoon of stress, we ended up on different floors anyway.  

Now, if maybe this was a Best Western or a Motel 8, we wouldn't have cared so much.  But this is the freaking Wynn, supposedly the most luxurious hotel on the Strip.  We expect that a stay at the Wynn will be free of problems and things like a broken TV (an engineer had to come up to fix it)!  A complaint about our check-in experience to the assistant manager on duty didn't bring about much, other than some excuse about how the front desk doesn't get much communication with the cleaning staff.  They did offer some chocolates as an apology, which I thought was just about the lamest apology from a hotel ever.  You comp people left and right and all you could offer to a really disappointed guest was chocolates???  Umm...thanks....guess who won't be back to stay at the Wynn ever again?

They do get stars for having a lovely swimming pool, as well as a luxurious room with the most comfortable pillows I've ever used.  I'd be back to eat at their amazing buffet, but I doubt that anyone from my family would go back and risk repeating the check-in experience again.

Before I booked the Wynn, I did a lot of intense research, and thought it was weird everyone on Yelp kept talking about Steve Wynn like they knew the friggin man.  But after a night at the Wynn, you can't help but to think "Damn.  Steve Wynn.  What a guy.  Such excellent taste."  Every detail in the room added to our experience, and god it made me want to throw out all my apartment furniture and go to the Wynn store to buy everything.  But a weekend without the shopping in Vegas already breaks the bank.

Loved that there was so much we could do at the Wynn like see La Reve and go to XS, we didn't even have to leave.  The Wynn is a little more expensive than some hotels.  My boyfriend's Amex Platinum reservation services got us a discount, with guaranteed upgrade if there are unbooked rooms, $100 resort credit, and guaranteed late checkout.  If you got one of these cards, use them.

I absolutely loved this hotel\/casino. My room was amazing!! and it had wonderful views. I had a room on the 56th floor, it was an upgraded resort room- wonderful king size bed that I was very happy to come back to every night and i loveddd my bathroom. My sauna shower with the choice of taking a bath. I did both one night!
 It's nice without being cheesy like most of the other hotels. I loved the tile flooring and the drapes through out the casino, I had warhol like poppies in my room, and there were cubist tile works all over the rest of the place. I also loved how the casino part of it wasnt crowded and didnt smell like cigarettes everywhere.
Love this hotel, the rooms, the service, the restaurants are also great! Best buffet in Las Vegas! Always a great time at the Wynn!

Classy and tech savvy. Large rooms and suites with great views of the Strip. Very personalized service with your name on your keycard, TV set and in any interaction with staff they know you. Free Wi Fi, TV screen also in the spacious bathroom. Very few Frat Boys and Bachelorette parties as opposed to other Hotels and strollers are banned except for hotel guests.

This is my fav place to visit in las Vegas. The customer service is always outstanding. Its such a nice hotel and casino the fashion show mall is connected to it by bridge which makes shopping so much easier and fun. I always have the time of my life here

Ooooolala this place is absolutely amazing. The decor is beautiful and they've got and incredibly organized valet parking system. Major kudos to them for XS nightclub. This is definitely one of my favorite my clubs in Vegas. Steven Wynn knows exactly what he's doing because the energy at this casino is amazing.

My gf's and I came here for her birthday. Her bf and his friends had deals for the hotel so I was glad to check it out since I've never been, only for the buffet ;) The inside is real nice and clean. Lots of pretty colorful decorations. Very nice gambling layout. A few nice restaurants and a cafe. 

We stayed at a room, that we got to luckily upgrade to 2 full size beds instead of 1 queen size.  We had a great view and at night it was so pretty. Right as we walked in it was real spacious, good layout and the lighting was real welcoming. I loved the bathroom. The sinks with a vanity in the middle. Perfect for 4 girls sharing a bathroom. And as you enter there's a huge mirror so you can look at yourself from head to toe. That's a plus for us ladies before we head out to the clubs and for selfies hahah. The bed was pretty comfy, which is always a plus. 

I went to the gym which is located in the spa area. The gym is a decent size. When you enter you check yourself in. They have towels, water and fruits. There is a few trainers on the floor. in the front is some treadmills and cardio machines. As you walk a bit towards the back there are weights and other machines. The gym was clean and great to get a quick work out session. 

Service was great! every time we asked for something they brought it up and always called to make sure we got what we asked for. Make sure to always have your room key because there is a worker in front of the elevators that you have to flash your room key to. Wynn is a great hotel and a good mix of people.

This hotel is a class act.  The steak house restaurant with a show is spectacular if you sit outside in the garden where the waterfall is.   The buffet is spectacular and the best in Vegas!   You will also enjoy the sandwich shop in the center of the casino next to the Italian restaurant.  The coffee shop at the Encore is very good.

The rooms are superb, clean and quiet.  You never hear the maids outside talking and banging their brooms.  They have suites in the tower that are amazing.

I am a gambler and do very well on the slots.  They are generous.  On two occasions I have won $33,000.00.  In the casino you do not see low lives walking around or hear super loud music that can drive you crazy.  Service is superb.

The beautiful thing about the Wynn is that people dress up for dinner or to play the tables.  I hope we continue this.  It reminds me of the old days.  You will not see drunks falling down.  They have amazing security and they kick them out as fast has they come in.  You feel safe.   FIVE STARS ALL THE WAY!!!!

I cant begin to describe how much I love this hotel. I was located at the top floor of the hotel so I didn't hear anything from the casino and the view of the golf course was amazing. The beds were extremely comfortable and at first I thought I would hate the color scheme but it was very soothing to the eye. The bathrooms are beautiful and the perfect place to chill after a long day on the strip. The hotel itself has so much to do. From the waterfall show at night, to club Tryst, to Le Reve, and so on. 

My favorite part was walking into the room and hearing the quiet music playing from the tv, which had a pretty ocean scene showing. It was really an overall relaxing experience. 

Remember to constantly check the tv for any unnecessary charges that may be added to your account (just in case :D).

This is a beautiful hotel but we found one of our pieces of luggage damaged once the bell service brought our bags up. We had just cut the tags off of a beautiful Samsonite roll away that morning... to have them scuff it up pretty good in three places. We filed a report so they could take better precautions and to see if they could do something to make up for the property damage. We spent 3 days and 2 nights there. We've experienced most of Vegas and didn't have the need to explore many other places this time around. Our entire party spent easily at least 15K at the Wynn this time around with the rooms, meals, drinks, gambling etc. and their response to us was that there was nothing they could do. The only reason I didn't rate this 1 star is because this place is gorgeous and the staff is friendly, but I will say do not gamble here because the odds here are terrible; and take your own bags up because if they ruin something they will not compensate you in any way.  We will not be returning to the Wynn because of this incident.
Love this hotel Casino it has to be one of the best on the strip. Everything here is just beyond beautiful. Excellent restaurants and shopping.
Stayed here a couple times. Honestly palazzo is better deal to me\/: the only thing I like more is the day pool here(:

From start to finish, they just do it right here.

Of course, an entire massage room in the suite doesn't hurt either. ;)

Great hotel other than the fact that the security is beyond ridiculous!  I have my two sons with me and stopped to get two sodas on the way up to our room.  The security scolded me in front of the entire bar about how children were not allowed in the bar.   Mind you, I was not born yesterday, they were standing in the hallway that we pass through the hotel every day.  I ordered two sodas to go - two minutes tops.  My kids are very kind and extremely well behaved.  He said to give the hotel key to the boys and that he would take them to the elevators and I could meet up with them.  ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!!!  Leave me kids with a stranger, especially in Vegas?!  WTH!!!!!  I said no way!!!! The security a-hole called for back up and then followed me down the hallway all the way to the elevators berating me the entire time...!  UNBELIEVABLE!!!!!  Even my kids were completely embarrassed.  Mortified like we jumped on top of a casino table or something.....!  Ladies and Gentleman, there are plenty of places to choose from...  thumbs down here.  Mr. Steve Wynn, please address this issue ASAP.  Maybe open a place that kids CAN go to for a soda!

for what it is and for having the wynn name tied to it, i expected more.  stayed in a standard room.  it was very nice but if i'm comparing price ranges, it doesn't beat THEHotel at Mandalay Bay.  The room was huge but the LCD TV was tiny being in the big room.  

However, their guest-only spa is the best place to get a massage.  Great services and they have a very unique feature.  A huge waterfall of water in which you can stand under. The water falling down is a massage alone. They have separate men and women's facilities so if you have the guts, you can prance around in your birthday suit and enjoy all sauna, the waterfall and all the other great amenities.

The restaurants are one of the best. I dined at most of them.  The nightclub is one of the best in Vegas! 
both Wynn and Encore are incredible! 
beautiful, well kept and highly exquisite !

We stayed at Encore, but frequented the poker room here at the Wynn. We had originally planned on going next door to the Venetian's room, but after checking this place out we found no need to go any further. First of all the staff is great- friendly, attentive, great service. This is from every dealer, every server, and the room managers. They have a great daily tourny ($120 buy in, 10k chips, 30 min blinds) that gets a decent draw, though not nearly as big as Venetian's. They have a good variety of cash games from 1-3 and 2-5 and up. Drinks were always readily available. The atmosphere is comfortable and cozy. We have found our poker destination!

Most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in.  Upgraded to a gorgeous suite! Service is friendly from check-in, check-out, concierge, bell hop and each person you may pass in the hall.   Free pressing?!  I felt so spoiled having someone pick up our clothes and bring them back pressed.  All the bathroom amenities were wonderful.  We couldn't stop playing with the controls for lights and curtains :).  Yeah, we don't get out enough!

Stayed at the Wynn recently and was very pleased. Check in was a breeze and was asked if I'd like a strip view or golf course view. Chose the golf course and turned out great. Mountains in the distance, etc. Room was very nice. Electronically controlled curtains, 2 bottles of water, chocolates and robes and slippers placed at your bed in the evenings. Bathroom was large and had its own TV and telephone. Nice glass enclosed shower and large tub. Bed was one of those that you hate to get out of with the nice linens and comfy pillows. Artwork was a little weird. Andy Warhol stuff that seemed a little bit like it should be at the Luxor instead of the Wynn but who the hell cares about artwork. haha  Security was tight getting to and from elevators but friendly. You have to meet your prostitute downstairs and bring her up. Damn!! 5 star hotel and I cant chill in my robe. :)  Great overall experience and would stay again to be centrally located on the strip with a nice casino and great sportsbook.

The Wynn is a beautiful and classy casino with posh stores like Chanel, Cartier, and Ferrari-Maserati stores but it's just a bit too pretentious for me. The do have some good restaurants with great views of the waterfall area where they have some interesting eccentric shows every hour or so at nighttime. 

Bottom line: Beautiful. Except for the Wynn buffet, Tryst, and some the restaurants there, I find it a bit too much and not really for me. I much rather be at Venetian or Caesars. (Didn't stay in the rooms though.)  3.5 stars.

When I think of the Wynn hotel, I think top notch hotel. Unfortunately after staying there I can not say that is the case. Upon arrival our room was extremely dirty with hair everywhere. After calling housekeeping I had hoped they would clean it properly. However, that wasn't the case either. It took 2nd call to the manager of housekeeping  (setting us back even further on our short anniversary trip) who assured us it would be properly cleaned and disinfected and that we would hear back from him and the hotel manager.  We asked for a few hours of privacy to sleep and get ready for our plans and he assured us we would not be bothered and would hear from them the next day,  yet once again, our phone was ringing within 1\/2 hour of our arrival and housekeeping was knocking on our door within the hour. We gave up and just left to get an early dinner although we were exhausted after the long drive. The next day we tried calling the manager Gerardo and hotel manager Steve and NEVER heard back from them. We left them our cell phone number and just in case we were not in our room and still never heard from them again. I was so disappointing in this treatment because it became very clear that once they had secured our stay and had our credit card on file, they certainly didn't care.I thought when we booked our stay at the Wynn we were staying at one of the BEST hotels in Vegas, yet their treatment showed me they were no better than a cheap hotel on the strip with dirty rooms, poor customer service and no turn-down service.  I will say the hotel itself is beautiful, the views are spectacular but does any of this matter when they don't pride themselves in cleanliness and service? Very disappointing

I cannot say enough positive about this place!! I love the shops, the choices, and the service. My casino Host Jun always provides over the top service!! If I could give 10 stars I would!!! Keep doin what you do guys!! You're the best!!

Stayed here 4 nights. 8\/31\/17 - 9\/3\/17. On the last full day, while my wife and I were at the pool and our room was being turned over by the maid staff, someone went into my wallet--that was tucked into my baggage--and removed $300. The maid that day was named "Raj", as was noted by the placard left in the room indicating that if anything was unsatisfactory to contact Raj. 

We immediately notified the Wynn's security, who came to our room and had me fill out a claim report to commence their "investigation." 18 hours later the investigation was over I was told by Erica and Kristen (Erica's manager) in Guest Services that they could find "no misconduct" on behalf of the Wynn and that they would be doing nothing. No reimbursement. Nothing. In fact, Kristen actually asked "why didn't you use the safe". As if the onus was on me to make sure their staff wouldn't be tempted to steal from me.

I understand that the hotel is in a difficult position to weigh legitimate claims of theft (such as mine) against specious claims from hucksters. But by my lights, their "investigation" must have only been a matter of asking Raj if he or she stole any money while cleaning the room. When Raj said "no," the case was closed.

My wife and I are both socially progressive. The notion of needing to lock up all our valuables while we leave our room for a few hours was heretofore morally repugnant, as the implicit assumption is that someone - employed by the hotel - would otherwise try to steal something if it's not locked up. This bigotry of low expectations is not one that me or my wife have. But when we become victims of the very same stereotypical trope that our moral compass would guide against, we feel let down and somewhat foolish. 

The Wynn had multiple opportunities to write this wrong. I even went so far as to provide them incremental photographic evidence that just fell on deaf ears. We were simply looking for indemnification - what must be a trivial amount in the eyes of the Wynn - and they couldn't be bothered. When I posed my situation to Kristen, the manager I spoke to in Guest Services, and asked her if she thought she would feel that justice has been served if she were in my shoes, and she gallingly said "yes, as someone who works in the industry." By her measure, it is totally acceptable for things in your hotel room to go missing and for the hotel to effectively say, "It's your word against our maid's word, and we're sticking with our maids 100% of the time."

And if you're wondering, yes, we also filled out a police report immediately after speaking with the Wynn's security staff (a process that I am told will take several weeks to conclude) and contacted American Express, with whom we booked the travel. There's effectively no light at the end of either of these tunnels. If you're reading this thread for a glimmer of hope that your situation will somehow be different, I wish you all the luck in the world, but scarcely think it will be if you stay here and are a victim of theft.

I love this hotel!!!!

Just got back from my third stay there and the keep getting better!!!!

First stay honest was not great, second stay was a total turnout from the first. Third time was a charm! Service was great, food was better and the VIEW I got from my orbitz upgrade was FABULOUS!!

The only reason way they don't get 5 stars is:

1. Cleaning staff somehow throughout my lovely fiances retainer. However, once notified there were ON IT! I will update pending out come of whether or not the replace them.

2. 3 years in a row the drinks at the pool were WEAK! For $14 a pop for a margarita I want to get a buzz on.

Regardless, this is far my all time favorite hotel.

Cheers Mr Wynn!

There is no finer place in the World than a Wynn Resorts...Steve Wynn is a class act not unlike Frank Sinatra with the vision of Walt Disney. A must see to appreciate the customer service if nothing else.

For Mother's Day in 2017, my wife and I decided to meet our son, who flew from Denver, in Las Vegas. We visit Vegas 4-5 times a year and since the Venetian opened in 1999 we stayed  there each time we went. You can say we are a hard core Venetian fans. 
This time we decided to have a different experience and stay at Wynn's. After we checked in to Wynn, I visited the concierge and ordered a bouquet of flowers to my wife. They asked how much I wanted to spend so I told them around $60-80 . The least expensive flowers they could find was a dozen of roses for $118 so I told them it's ok but I don't want roses only; I wish to have a mix of large flowers. They said they will find me the best but it could take around  2 hours for delivery. I said that's no problem, we'll be in our room.
After 3 hours passed I called the concierge and asked if we leave our room would they be able to deliver the flowers?
Don't worry, they said - just enjoy yourself and we take care of everything. I felt like a celebrity.
But that didn't last long. When we got back to our room , Instead of a large mixed bouquet of flowers, 4 small half rotten pieces of hyacinth and 2 half dried cymbidiums were waiting for us on the table in a small 4 inch vase.  We were SHOCKED. 
I immediately called the concierge and talked to the manager, Chris. 
I told him the flowers delivered were unacceptable and I would like to change it to a dozen roses they told me earlier. 
To my surprise, Chris told me  they cannot exchange the flowers and he asked me if the problem is the price. I asked him how much did they charge for the flowers? He said total $150.
I told him originally I want to spend $120 so the price is not the problem, the problem is the entire arrangement, flower quality, size of the bouquet. The flowers were dried and half dead and is not what I ordered. 
The manager told me he saw the flowers and he didn't see any problems with them. I told him in that case please came to our room and check them out one more time, because this is totally unacceptable not just in a regular day, but for Mother's Day, it's even worse. The manager refused to came to our room. 
In that case, I told him I would like to cancel the order. He said I can not cancel the order, the flowers are already delivered. 
I told him I don't care it's delivered or not the quality of the flowers are unacceptable and he needs to exchange them or cancel the order.
The manager told me "if that makes me happy don't pay for it and keep the flowers".
And he hanged up on me.
I took the flowers to the concierge. I told one of the assistant I would like to talk to the manager, Chris, and return these flowers.
They called the manager but he refused to come to the concierge desk. He told the assistant to take the flowers back, no apologies. 
This experience and the unprofessionalism of the staff was unfortunate. Our family just wanted to enjoy our vacation.
Unfortunately we have another reservation at Wynn in July for my wife's Birthday but she doesn't want to stay there anymore after that and I don't blame her. I guess we'll be back in the Venetian.

Long lines in check in and check out. Slow and can not even find me easily and then give me crappy room even though was guaranteed a good room by client.  Windows dirty in room and next to roof and was noisy. Hard to get fresh air with cigarette smoke that is not well vented. Funny they did not even ask if I enjoyed my stay. Been there a dozen times but they had no clue. Internet WiFI was $20 for 40 minutes. Ripoff like Internet in rooms. Wow! Not good for five star hotel!

Went to stay there for 4 nights. Let me tell you I was very impressed.

Checking in we were greeted right away, plus we upgraded to a higher floor. That was really worth it they put us on the 58 floor. The view was just awesome! Plus the room was very clean.

I'm just going to keep it short and say I am definitely going to be back! If you want a nice place to stay this is the place!

I honestly have no complaints. We got a comp for 3 nights. Waiting to check in was a little cray but there's so much to look at. The bathroom has a mini tv & a huge jet tub. Well the whole bathroom is huge.  :)  The pool is nice. Yup! No complaints.
Rudest bartenders here they treat you like trash unless you look like you're rich based of what you wear

We loved almost everything about the Wynn. It generally will ruin you for all the other casino hotels. 

The rooms (huge and super high ceilings), the baths, the room technology, the service, the beds, the restaurants (pricey but good), the decor, the pool the casino, the stores (! the stores! Penhaligon at Apothecary...I hadn't found it in the US and always have to order online)- all far supersede any other hotel I've been in on the strip (Bellagio, Aria, Vdara, Paris.) Beautiful place and we got put on the 60th floor with a stunning view for a birthday. Much more tasteful than most other casinos.

HowEVER. Our stay was seriously marred by a bunch of really young kids (children are not permitted in the hot tub, clearly shown in the signs) in the hot tub at the pool. We mentioned something to the lifeguard, who followed us to the hot tub, looked at the group of 7-10 year olds in the hot tub, and walked away. Thats it. I have no idea what she did from there but nothing changed. Oh, and about a minute after she walked away?  One of the kids started doing snot shots in the hot tub. 

Yes, really, a 10 year old doing snot shots in the hot tub at the Wynn. There you have it.

I was so disappointed with my stay! They gave me a dirty room so they moved me to another "upraded" room for the trouble. They charged my credit card $2000.00 and even produced an altered receipt saying I authorized it! Beware they are crooks! Also just for your own information check out bbb.org and check out there record before deciding to stay here!

Back at the Wynn in the Tower Suites. In my mind still one of the best places to stay in Vegas. Rooms are well appointed and spacious. Having the separate entrance and guest registration for the Tower Suites is fabulous as you avoid the cattle call at the main guest registration. SW Restaurant is great and  Wing Lei is pretty good if you want a more casual meal. Gym is excellent and plenty of good shopping without having to leave the property. Want to expand your choices, go right next door to the Encore.  A really nice property that compares well with the best in the city.

I've been here over 20 times. I even brought friends! I've lost at least two thousand each time. My friends a $1000. I'm not coming back . Embarrassing!!!! At least let us play!!! This casino takes ur money within 20 min. Most casinos let u enjoy the night if u spend that much. This one sucks it up!!! Don't go!!!

We have been coming to this hotel more than 10 years ago.  One of the world class hotel with fancy restaurants and huge rooms are available and has top brand name shops inside the hotel.  Good casino areas with a lot of tables and many selections of slot machines.  This is a must stay hotel in Vegas.

Steve Wynn has done it again.  Las Vegas style.  It is beautiful, But the Belagio still has the Chihully.  Great Buffet, and good customer service.  Saw some grafity in the elevator, but other than that excellent hotel.  Great VIEW!

It's been a while since the last visit to Vegas ( about couple years) and wanted to have a quick getaway after Memorial day, I booked a room from their website because they offer 15% instance discount if I make a reservation on their webpage. Since their buffet was reviewed well as well, I thought it's going to be a perfect day trip with my wife. At the registration of the hotel, I was offered a promotional room upgrade and quickly fell for it because it only costs me 30 extra dollar for VIP treatment such as private pool & room access and no waiting at the buffet line. The guy at the registration desk described that I will be getting a special treatment that no 'regular people' can get. Yes, he literally said 'Regular People' when giving me a sales pitch and laughed it off when I recited 'regular people' with perplexed look at him. Anyways, the upgrade room was really good and I pat myself that I took that offer from him. But I quickly realized that it is NOT what I was promised. There was no line at the buffet and private pool was so small and completely under the shade made by its own building which blocks sun in the afternoon. It felt like I was just lying under a tree in cool somber day. So I didn't even need to use my sunscreen which I bought for 10 bucks from VONS right before I get there. Well, after spending good time with my wife in the strip by watching great show and having fun at casino, we went to the upgrade room at 2 am and realized that next room's guests are having a 'Hang Over' type party with blasting music on. I called the front desk and was told that Security will take care of them which didn't happen until 4 am. I believe that no security came to help me at all. They just went to sleep after having a party enough and got tired. Sleeping only few hours and with blood shot eyes, we went down to private VIP check out desk next morning and only to find out they charge 70 something dollars after tax to my $175 deposit which I paid at the initial reservation. When I inquired the difference and explained to the front desk girl that I was told only additional $30 will be charged for the upgrade, all I got from her was sarcastic smile and kept hearing (twice) that it is what I'm supposed to pay extra. Although I just walked away from the hotel without asking manager or making a scene with formal complaint, it was truly a bad experience from such a luxury hotel. I'm planning to revisit Vegas at least once a year since I'm a Californian, it'd be my first and the last visit to Wynn hotel. They really need to improve customer service as much as they strive to maintain its luxurious building.

We stayed at the VIP Suites over New Years. And boyyy was it AWESOME! We had free drinks, free deserts, and a good time! The beds were very comfortable and had an excellent view of the city. WooHoo! Wynn is as good as it gets!!!! 5 stars!!! YES!

My first trip every to Vegas. Booked a 2 night stay at the Wynn because of a great package deal they were offering. The room was very pricey but since it was to include their water show ($200 ticket value), I figured it was worth it. That is the ONLY reason I booked with the Wynn as I believe they are overpriced for a hotel at the end of the strip. 

I will give 1 star for the folks that handled my luggage both to my room and later back when I was leaving. They were fabulous and beyond courteous. My original bell captain even took it upon himself to notice one of the lamps was out and so called housekeeping. I also was given a quick overview of the strip and places I might want to see. 

I will give 1 star for the room. It was incredible. The bathroom was laid out like a real spa, I never wanted to leave the shower, the bed was comfortable, my room was spacious and the vew at night was so good, I simply left the drapes open each night. At the price this room was running, I would have expected nothing less. 

Now mind you, I only booked this room because of the generous combo involving a show ticket to what was supposed to be as good as "O". Walking all over the strip that night, called the hotel 2 hours ahead of the show to confirm they had an additional ticket on hold for another friend. Was told the show was cancelled. When asked why didn't they notify us, a very rude woman stated she had no way to get ahold of us. HUH? We are guest in the same hotel as the show. How do you not have a wait get ahold of us? She was beyond rude and did not care. When asked if they would give a credit to the room fee she said the box office was separate from the hotel. BUT this was a bundle package. They have to have some relation to each other. 

Mind you, the entire evening was planned around this show. While I do not begrudge the technical difficulties supposedly which happened with the show, I do take issue with being treated like a disobedient child. No offer of any kind was made and when pushed, all she said was that she might give a $50 credit against the resort fee. Huh? What resort fee? Turns out you have a room fee, tax, then a $25\/day resort fee and more tax. Wether you use the facilities of "the resort" which I never saw, you will pay for it. 

At check out, we were given a bill for the full visit. When we explained we were to have the resort fees taken off, we were told that is never done; ever. We explained $50 was quoted to us. The gal looks a bit more and says "OH, I think I see something here about that". Then she takes of $50. That is it. No more, no less, no apologies, no comforting words, just took my credit card and said they hoped we would visit again soon.  Nope. Won't happen on my watch. 

All it would have taken was some courtesy. Let us know the show we already have tickets for was cancelled. They had our cell phone # as well as our room # for gosh sakes. Offer another show or credit to our room, food, gambling....anything. Pretend you care about this very disappointing news. Thank goodness we called ahead. I had a fancy dress with incredible shoes all laid out for the show. Had we not called ahead, I would have been standing at the theatre, dressed to the nines, and with no show to watch. 

I have no plans to ever allow the Wynn staff to treat me like a second rate citizen ever again. I salvaged the evening by going to the Monte Carlo and buying tickets to the Blue Man Group. Now that was a show !!!!!  Awesome !!!!!!

Terrible experience between check in and also the associates here. 
Got yelled by a worker at for sitting in the floor at the hotel lobby when the lines were very long no computer kiosks to check in, I had knee surgery can't stand too long.
This a gem of a property with all the extra's and even a few surprises. It helps when you win at the Wynn which we did... ENJOY!

First time in Vegas and it was recommended we stay at the Wynn. Got a good rate off of the Wynn website for 3 nights the week after labor day.

From beginning to end the service was exceptional, the property beyond beautiful. Our room was very nice, not extravagant but nice. The bathroom was impressive and the view (29th floor) was amazing!

The bed was decent but the pillows could be a bit firmer. Housekeeping was great, loved how they "organized" my mess of stuff in the bathroom. It's the little things that impress a girl like me.

We hit up the gym one morning which was nice. But what really impressed me was the pool! Loved lounging around and sipping on $18 pina coladas. Ah, the life. "Just charge it to the room."  Beautiful grounds, comfy chairs, and chill music.

Bottomline, the Wynn is the place to go if you want a resort sort of feel while staying in Vegas.
5 stars all the way!  Best hotel in Vegas no doubt!  Food, service,  cleanliness,  gaming, pool, all top notch.
